review:
I like investing on here. Yeah, savings are mainly through round-ups, but I‚Äôve saved a lot. The spend account, however, neither makes sense nor connects to anything within Acorns. You would think you could just move money between your other accounts but it really is just a one way bank account. So I have no idea what the point is. Most people signed up using another bank. If you withdraw funds they go to that bank. You can‚Äôt even move invest funds to spend. It seems like they will send you plenty of notifications about your unused spend card but not explain that it is a separate bank account that cannot be linked to your other accounts in any seemingly useful way.

Edit: I did talk to customer service again and figured out what was making spend more difficult. It might be a decent primary checking account, but I won‚Äôt be using it for that. 
One thing I do like is that round-ups are easy. The other thing, which is easy to forget, is that Acorns will alert you when outside funds are low and pause investments, even when your primary bank doesn‚Äôt. Customer service is good, and aside from that time when everyone thought Acorns was hacked and started freaking out because the app kept closing, logging you out, or saying your login info was wrong, it‚Äôs been pretty solid. I lost a bunch of funds when Covid tanked the economy but I‚Äôve mostly gained it all back. Probably from spending money to live, but that‚Äôs neither here nor there.
title: Great for Investing - Spend is garbage

review: I am not going to pull any punches here. If you are looking for a 2nd chance banking option or the best of both worlds you will not find it here. Take the Banking off of the featured products and this app will please you. Acorns IS NOT A BANK. You can do no banking here whatsoever, there is no documentation or literature to explain how this thing works. I have had this app for almost a month and I cannot perform any checking account actions. You need a bank account for this app to do anything. What??? So wait. You need a bank for your banking app? That is because you cannot fund it any other way because it uses your bank account to syphon funds from it. How much it takes from you account, when and how often is complicated to understand and you can easily accidentally transfer too much, overdraw your account and good luck reversing it as these things take forever. Check deposit? Not happening. Bill pay? Not happening. Loans or credit card options? Not happening. Instant transfers? Not happening. All you get is ‚Äúfeature not available‚Äù so you figure we‚Äôll let me complete this milestone or maybe when the card comes it will work. Not happening. This app dangles carrots and nothing more. It explains nothing, provides you with nothing it just takes and takes and buried it in the app. If you have money and time to waste on an app that looks like a duck , quacks like a duck but isn‚Äôt close to being a duck, you have it here.
title: Unnecessarily Complicated
developerResponse: {'id': 31078870, 'body': 'We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-07-25T12:31:21Z'}

review: A fraudulent company accessed my checking account and took almost $1500 from my account in a matter of a few hours. Upon seeing the first charge come out, I called customer support in a matter of a couple of minutes of it happening to implore them to freeze my debit card to stop the charges. I was told I would be sent an email, which I was, with directions. The directions were to log in to my account. Why can‚Äôt the person on the phone walk you through what do. I was obviously already logged into the app on my phone; how else did I know that fraud charges were hitting my account. I filed a dispute on the charges. I was told there would be a 10 day investigation with the possibility of a provisional credit depending on what they find. I will change this one-star review if this company actually does the right thing and provide me with the relief that I deserve and their insurance will cover. I hate to say this but I suspect it was an inside job and the same people who are investigating this matter are the ones who perpetrated it. I just received an email stating that I have not responded to their email inquiries (not true) and that they have determined that the matter is resolved on my end and that they have closed the ticket. I can‚Äôt believe that after having had $1500 fraudulently taken from account that not one single person from Acorns can give me a call on the phone. I am being treated like I am the criminal. Beware of using this company!
title: Transaction Dispute
developerResponse: {'id': 31766191, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to address your concerns. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-08-31T12:19:09Z'}

review: While they make it easy to save, they are clearly reckless with their customer‚Äôs Personal information. My husband and I both signed up to save passive income and it turned into a nightmare. We assume because we have a joint account. Assume because no one actually could tell us. His account was frozen first until he could prove his existence. After his was frozen, mine was next. I was asked to provide either a bank statement or canceled check in an email that instructed me to login to my account to do so. Well‚Ä¶ since your account is locked, that is not possible. When you ‚Äòchat‚Äô you are solicited for multiple personal information documents such as ss card, DL copy, a bill and bank statement. When informed that the email states they only need a voided check, you are told no and to submit your personal documents via chat. I escalated to second level phone support and made the individual read the email to me after they were trying to justify this. They could not. I understand the potential that customers can defraud the company, but Acorns LLC has an obligation to protect their customer‚Äôs personal information and to be so reckless with it is appalling. I encourage anyone looking to start saving to go to an established company that likely has good security measures in place and proper training. What we experienced was insane. To be honest, we had no idea what the issue was with our account. We just had to keep guessing.
title: Do not use this Company
developerResponse: {'id': 33178569, 'body': 'We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-11-15T16:28:02Z'}

review: Make unlinking accounts ACTUALLY unlink accounts. I had ‚Äúunlinked‚Äù my checking account only to find that, whenever I tried to deposit money or pay my subscription, the UNLINKED ACCOUNT was used. As a result, I incurred $175 debt from 5 (FIVE!!!) different overdraft fees, all from an UNLINKED account. Absolutely ridiculous ‚Äî all the money I had saved in Acorns and more (about 2x more, if you‚Äôre curious) went straight to banking fees because of this ridiculously convoluted system of linking/unlinking accounts. I wanted to use Acorns to save money passively, but instead I ended up losing everything I had saved and more over the course of my ~2 month usage due to some silly fees resulting from either a terribly architected UI (make unlinking accounts ACTUALLY unlink accounts, don‚Äôt gray out an account that is still being drawn  from, don‚Äôt make me navigate past 4 different menus into some obscurely placed drop-down to ACTUALLY unlink an account, etc) or an egregious error on Acorns‚Äô end. Such a shame ‚Äî the concept for the app is wonderful, and I firmly believe it can help myself and others learn to save effectively, hence why I left an extra star up on my rating. I am now skeptical towards this entire platform due to the months of small, incremental savings wasted to banking fees that could have been avoided if the app did what it said it did.
title: Great concept, but needs serious improvement

review: Ya know, Acorns for the most part is a great idea and useful and user friendly platform for people to invest, bank, and do other things, but I have to say that I just found out that without warning or notice my debit card was cancelled and a new one was ordered all because of. A dispute that I filed about a transaction I had seen that I had no knowledge of. So without calling me or emailing me to let me know the results of my dispute and after I specifically told an employee over the phone I cannot have my card cancelled they without warning did it anyways so now not only do I have to take the hit of the transaction unknown but now I have to endure the bombardment of returned payment fees if all the bills I have set up on autopay through the card that was cancelled. This is a very halfbaked unthought out protocol and I am on the fence of switching to a different investment institution because of this. And it‚Äôs not like they expedited the card delivery either, I now have to wait 2 weeks, and that‚Äôs business days don‚Äôt forget so weekends don‚Äôt count for the amount of time I‚Äôm waiting. Wouldn‚Äôt you rush someone‚Äôs card to them seeing how there is no physical bank for acorns and one depends on that debit card to have daily access to the money they worked hard for? So frustrated right now
title: In shock!!!!!

review: They had a promotion on the app, if you share it with your friends you would get so much money, so i shared it with several people, and on all of them it was ‚Äòpending‚Äô and never fully went through. So it was pretty much impossible to share and get your referral reward. They were also doing a $75 promotion for getting the debit card, so both my brother and I order the debit cards. As soon as I got mine I went to activate it and the promotion disappeared. My brother called to ask about it and they told him that the promotion never existed. My brother then realized that they would take a percentage out of whatever you‚Äôre investing through them, so we both decided to cancel our subscriptions because they don‚Äôt tell you there‚Äôs a charge for investing through them. So we decided it wasn‚Äôt worth it to use them. Since you can invest through other places with no charge.  Later I saw I got a $5 charge for acorns for my ‚Äòsubscription‚Äô (this was after I had deleted my account) another charge from acorns that they try to hide. After that my friend who had signed up also got a charge. Even though her account through my referral was still ‚Äòpending‚Äô. So if her account was ‚Äòpending‚Äô why would they be charging a subscription fee?? I was excited to use it since it‚Äôs a great idea for investing. However it‚Äôs not worth the cost or deceitfulness.

review: After using them for years I switched my bank account after my bank got bought out by a horribly incompetent one. After changing information on all my other investment portfolios I went to this terribly done program to do the same. To switch my primary account I have to submit to them a voided check from the first bank and the new bank(which just added more time since I had to wait for new checks to arrive in the mail for the new bank). After doing that they said they would make two deposits into my new account which never came through. After contacting them they first told me i have to check my bank account and confirm the amount put in so clearly they didn‚Äôt care what my email said. They then proceeded to tell me I hadn‚Äôt properly cleared the switch and I needed to upload voided check images again‚Ä¶ after the first upload i was told the one check came through improperly(which okay that can happen) and so I uploaded it again. After confirming I uploaded it again I got a new customer service associate who seemed totally unaware I had uploaded the documents and is requesting me to restart the process. If it‚Äôs not figured out soon I will unfortunately have to go the legal route which I really do not want to do since as I said in the title the idea behind this really is great‚Ä¶
title: Great Idea, terrible customer service

review:
I woke up today, and saw a charge for one dollar by acorn. I was very confused because I hadn‚Äôt opened this app in a couple months. On top of not using the app, I was not notified that I would be charged any money. I have had the app on my phone for a while but never used it. Apparently they signed me up for a subscription but I was unaware that this platform had subscriptions. I definitely haven‚Äôt been on this app in two or three months so why would I be charged a dollar out of nowhere at the end of March? The problem isn‚Äôt just that they charged me a dollar for what I consider no reason, the problem is why now? My other question is, where did this dollar go? And why would I pay a subscription to save money? I have a lot of questions needless to say but one thing that I am sure about is that I will never and I mean never recommend this app to anyone. It was a good idea when I heard about it but to see them do business like this, unacceptable. The last thing I‚Äôll say is, I don‚Äôt believe this is the first time this has happened because one of the options when trying to cancel your account says that you were charged unexpectedly. Hope y‚Äôall do good with the dollar y‚Äôall took!!!
I also checked to make sure that this was not the first time I was charged comment and it said that this was the first time I‚Äôve been charged from acorn.
title: Charged Me A Dollar For No Reason

review: In this day and age I understand security is important. However, there is such a thing as overkill. I ran into a situation where I needed to change my banking information. My old account was closed due to fraudulent activity, plus I changed banks. Because I was in the middle of the verification process the app/website wouldn‚Äôt allow me to change it. I went three rounds of back and forth through emails with no luck. So I decided to call. Upon getting in touch with a representative(which didn‚Äôt take long at all), I explained to her my situation and if she could possibly override the feature in the app that kept me from updating my account information. She couldn‚Äôt do until she very I had an old account with the old bank. I had no statements or old checks as the account was closed over a year ago. I know it wasn‚Äôt her fault as she only abides by the rules and procedures. After calling the OLD bank and not being able to identify me(because I no longer have an account with them) I decided to give up. As my simple request was not being handled. What a horrible draconian policy to have in place as banking information can change at anytime. This is truly asinine. There should be a way to just change your information like any other website.
title: Bad policy!

review: Used to use this service 5-7 years ago. It was an interesting and fun concept. Over time, naturally consolidated investments over to larger and more sophisticated financial institutions. Welcome 2022 and Acorns decision to automatically enroll folks whose bank information is still connected somehow to their platform (*because they don‚Äôt actually allow you to fully ever disconnect said information) to a monthly subscription fee ‚Äúservice‚Äù that gets you who knows what‚Ä¶   I haven‚Äôt had money on the Acorns platform in years. Bottom line: tremendously infuriating to have any systematic auto-enrollment initiative begin charging you money. There‚Äôs never any guarantee that we still have the App on our devices, we may not receive emails from a particular account that‚Äôs over 5 years old (eg an old school or work email)‚Ä¶ we may not even be able to login to the App/Service platform anymore because of all of the aforementioned logistical issues. Don‚Äôt charge old customers money by auto-enrolling them because you need to drive your own revenue. It‚Äôs an incredibly dishonest and irresponsible manner of capturing a few extra dollars. Completely shameful. So infuriating that I‚Äôd absolutely be willing to be part of a class-action lawsuit should one ever materialize. Frankly, if I were a lawyer, I‚Äôd file it myself.
title: Pathetic Business Practices

review:
I recently tried depositing a check and they locked my whole account, including my debit card. When I called to speak to a real person, they said they are not on the internal team, and cannot connect me directly. I was left with no access to my funds in the bank. I have never had a bank lock down an entire account when depositing a mobile check. It‚Äôs insane.  Rendering me unable to access my money that was already in my account for days. What‚Äôs worse is they said this is standard practice anytime I deposit a check from someone new. As a contractor, I have lots of small projects and new deposits meaning every time I try and deposit a paycheck, I have to deal with days of head aches. It‚Äôs flat out unusable. 

Additionally, I was making a larger purchase  and called to see if I could get my debit card limit increased for the purchase. This has been common and easy to do with past banks. Once again the call center person, had no power to do anything, leaving me unable to access my funds. 

I recommend Recommend Chime which does the round up debit card for free. Then find other ways to invest your money, as this just simply isn‚Äôt well supported with trust worthy customer support. Better yet, go back to your local credit union which actually has human beings and empathy.
title: Horrible customer support.
developerResponse: {'id': 29535878, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to address your concerns. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-05-03T15:22:23Z'}

review: Acorns is an attractive option if you are looking to begin your savings with little knowledge investing.  The low monthly fees seem like a good option and the app has a great UI; although I‚Äôm not a fan of the first thing I see when I log in being another Acorns ad for opening more accounts instead of my portfolio.  I‚Äôm leaving this review, however, so you begin your investment journey with this knowledge:  Acorns makes it incredibly difficult for you to take your money out.  I‚Äôve had issues where they have transferred funds to closed accounts and confirmed transfer requests to the wrong businesses.  If you rollover you‚Äôre Later account, you‚Äôll need to find a Medallion Signature Guarantee even if you are the individual account holder.  As well, they will not provide updates to your other firm and will keep you locked out of your account throughout the process.  The industry standard is 1 month and they are well behind in their response.  Imagine these issues, all the while, communicating with Customer Service though email and hour-long holds on the phone.  I believe their model is to make it as difficult as possible to leave Acorns so that they hope their user gives up and sticks with their service.  Plenty of other options available to early investors.
title: Simple to invest, nightmare to withdraw

review:
I had a spend account with them which i finally closed because it wasn‚Äôt benefiting me at all. They had very low limits on how much you could withdraw from an ATM. When I called to close the account, the rep told me I will get my funds transferred to my other bank account in 3-6 business days. Took 10 business days and I still didn‚Äôt receive the funds so I called back and I was told they don‚Äôt know what happened and had to submit a research. I waited 3 additional days and they finally emailed me and said that I ‚Äúshould have ‚Äú received an e-check. I told them that I didn‚Äôt. They said they will check on it. I finally received the e-check 2-3 days later after our last conversation and I deposited it. After I deposited it someone reached out to me and said that they are now sending me a physical check. The didn‚Äôt even bother to follow up with me before stopping the payment on the e-Check.I got charged a returned item fee from my bank and my perfect record ruined with my primary bank. The customer service is very slow. They have two different teams, phone reps and ‚Äúback office‚Äù. The phone reps cannot do really anything except submit a request on your behalf and you get email days later from
A different team. There‚Äôs lack of communication between the two teams.

review: So I just started investing. I‚Äôm about 19 and only work part time, so since I don‚Äôt have a lot of money to invest I thought I‚Äôd start here. I‚Äôm in a bit of a tough spot now because Acorn was trying to charge my card, but my work just switched from weekly pay to biweekly pay so I was taking a bit to adjust and didn‚Äôt have much money in my checkings account at the time. Well, Acorn didn‚Äôt take the hint that I didn‚Äôt have enough money and kept trying to charge my card rather than just declining it. Every time they tried 30 dollars got taken away from my account. Not only that, but no money at all was added to my acorn portfolio. They didn‚Äôt even notify me my card wasn‚Äôt working, and charged twice on the same day (What looks like twice in a row) and then again the next day so I ended up losing 90$ for absolutely nothing. I tried contacting customer support, they said it‚Äôd take 1-2 business days to process the request. It‚Äôs been a week and I haven‚Äôt gotten any email past the confirmation email. It‚Äôs really frustrating having just under -90$ in my account because acorn wouldn‚Äôt stop trying to charge my card and didn‚Äôt notify me that my card wasn‚Äôt going through in any way. Acorn is the only company I‚Äôve had do this to me. So I‚Äôm done with it.

review: This app is good for investing, but I do NOT recommend the checking ‚Äúbank smarter‚Äù feature. I opened a checking account & got the card so i could do real time roundups & get small percents back on some purchases. I deposited my check through there on Friday (Big Mistake. It took several tries to work & is very confusing)  & it said it should be available the next day. Next thing you know, my checking account is locked. I called customer service Saturday, she was very indirect about what needed to be done to fix it or why it was happening. Sunday i reach out again. They tell me the same thing, that they‚Äôre forwarding a request to unlock it. Still can‚Äôt tell me why it was locked. Today, Monday, i get a notification that my paycheck went through, i click on it to see‚Ä¶ nope, account still locked. So they put my check through for a grand & can‚Äôt tell me why my account is locked & am unable to access my money. They are in no hurry to fix it & whoever i talk to doesn‚Äôt seem to have answers for anything except to forward it to someone else. I will NEVER be using the checking feature again. And will be lucky if i have access to my money by the time i go on vacation this week.

What‚Äôs the point I can just invest in a different app that doesn‚Äôt take money without asking and not using that money for my investment account which is ridiculous- every time a 5 was deducted I checked acorns and nothing was there every time plus i was a new user at the time so I think it was a bad app for investing unless you want your money taken then sure be my guest. review: Honestly, this review is only going to apply to people who bank with smaller, less popular banks. Just like everyone else, I saw the ads, invest your spare change, blah blah blah. I was super intrigued and excited to download and set this up. Come to find out, my bank isn‚Äôt listed in the seemingly endless list of banks big, small, and very small banks. I ended up having to go through the hassle of manually setting up my bank via account and routing number (which is the least inconvenient reason I‚Äôm leaving this review). After i contacted my bank I‚Äôm immediately prompted to get a subscription to advance further. I never was able to verify my account because they never sent me the micro transactions. I couldn‚Äôt connect my card because my bank was not listed and there is no manual card setup. So in the end I had no access to the thing I got the app for in the first place. Very disappointed overall because there‚Äôs no easy way to contact someone and ask them to add a bank or anything like that, but who knows maybe someone will see this and open up some new doors for future users. It‚Äôs a 0 out of 5 for me. Worth a shot I guess, probably works great if you back with a mainstream bank.
title: Useless if you don‚Äôt have a mainstream bank.

review: This is an excellent way to accumulate savings without even feeling it. Their‚Äôs a retirement account also to get some retirement savings started. This could be the only retirement that some people can manage. I‚Äôve had very choppy employment. This is great for me because I‚Äôve always felt that I was to broke to get started, consequently, I got a very late start on my retirement savings. Small automatic withdrawals are the key, I believe. The portfolio that I set up in the ‚ÄòInvest‚Äô account was just answering a few questions. It was the same with the account that they call the ‚ÄòLater‚Äô account. It‚Äôs a retirement account. If your account balances goes down, you still own the shares. Historically, it‚Äôs worked out to hold on to them. That‚Äôs how Warren Buffet does it. But I know nothing about investing, so DON‚ÄôT take my word for it. Nobody knows what will happen in the future. If you can start an account for your children, it would be a great way to get their future under way doing round ups and/or contributing small amounts.
title: A sneaky way to build a nest egg

review: I had this app in 2017 & 2018. I used it for the round up feature. It worked fine. Great actually. I made $23 in round ups 1 year and $28. Not much in investing so I got out / deactivated once my bank offered the round up feature. Recently this summer I was using Uber or something & I saw a discount if you connected the offer through Acorns so I decided to try again and see how Acorn operates now. So I requested my account to be reopened. That was quick and easy. Linked an account but never a debit card. I also read that acorns had fees now. Anyway life happened. The world had opened up and I started to travel and then bday and back to school. I never went back into the app to choose an investing plan or options. Looked at my bank statements and noticed Acorns charged me 3 months in a row and I had not even linked a card for the roundup feature even though the feature was selected. They had my bank but was not rounding up. Yet they were charging me. THREE MONTHS. No email saying ‚Äúchoose an investment plan‚Äù or ‚Äúnext steps to saving money‚Äù. Nothing informative, just charging me, but I‚Äôm not sure what for since I received no service?  Kinda shady.
title: A bit scam-ish feel

review: I was put on to this app by my brother. He has had great success with it, but that has been far from my experience. When creating an account, I was prompted several times to enter my information because the app either crashed or didn‚Äôt connect to their server. After finally getting my account set up I attempted to link my checking account for funding. In the app it clearly shows my bank account listed, checking and savings, yet still prompts me to link a checking account. I have followed the request of both customer service reps (one by email and one by phone) to manually enter in my routing and account number. Acorns comes back with a message saying ‚ÄúThere is no bank associated with this routing number‚Äù yet when on the phone, the lady confirmed that I had entered it in correctly. This is after 2 days of emails back and forth with someone else who, after the second day, quit returning emails altogether. I have yet to hear back about a solution and feel that the difficulty to just sign up may not be worth the headache should something important and time sensitive occur. Great idea and very streamlined in how it is supposed to work, but atrocious first impression for sign up and even worse customer support.
title: Customer Service is incompetent
developerResponse: {'id': 21503647, 'body': "We're sorry to hear that you have had an unsatisfactory experience, and we want to make this right. If you're interested in moving forward with the registration process, please contact our team at support@acorns.com with Attn Head of Operations in the subject line so that this matter can be further reviewed.", 'modified': '2021-03-08T05:52:10Z'}

review:
I admittedly made a mistake and changed my primary funding source by accident. But trying to change it back has been unbelievably difficult. I have submitted the requested documentation 3 times now and have never received verification. And with each inquiry as to why not, I‚Äôm just given a blanket response telling me how to submit documents, which I‚Äôve already done. Customer service is a joke. Once this issue is

UPDATE:
Funding issue resolved...somewhat. I‚Äôve had to use Paypal as my main funding source, which is linked to my bank. So in a roundabout way my issue has been resolved, albeit with no actual help from the lazy and inattentive support staff offering nothing more than pre-rendered responses. But now I‚Äôve been sporadically locked out of the app and web browser and told my password I‚Äôve had for months is incorrect. Cool! This service has taken a complete nosedive in quality in the last few months for me. New investors should look into other options
title: At my wits end

review:
Update:
Decided to wait a couple more months, ordered a replacement card TWICE and haven‚Äôt gotten it. It‚Äôs literally been months and no one can give any answers. Their agent responses are even more unrelated and useless than I originally posted my review. Just don‚Äôt do it. 
Everything in the app is good but DO NOT open the spend account. It‚Äôs complete garbage. I have the simplest question since I opened one a while back but they cannot respond with a straight answer or even a related topic. I literally keep asking the same question as simple as possible and they don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre saying. Just keep getting the same automated response. Called my other bank and got an answer straight away so I guess I won‚Äôt be doing what I needed this account for. Update:The communication go so much worse. They can‚Äôt even read an email before sending a completely irrelevant response. There‚Äôs literally no way to contact anyone useful if you have a problem. My question is a super simple one: how to send money from a spend account to another account. Now I am stuck not knowing how to get my money out of their useless debit cards. Don‚Äôt do this to yourself and learn from me.
title: Used to love it but now it‚Äôs TRASH

review: I manually entered the routing and account numbers for the checking account I wanted this app to withdraw from because the Plaid financial authentication service wanted to connect all accounts from my institution, which I canceled out of, but it still connected all those accounts, including an 18 month CD that charges large fees for withdrawing before maturity. I only discovered this on my own while exploring the app: it didn't tell me that it accessed five separate accounts from one account & routing number. Worse, when I tried to cancel the automatic investments, it wanted me to authenticate my checking account with a transaction that hadn't happened yet, so I would have to wait 3 business days before I could cancel a weekly withdrawal that presumably would have happened before then. After canceling and deleting everything I could find, I can only hope they won't rob my proper investments. Even if this is a misunderstanding, these people should know there are a lot of folks out there who could use a little more transparency. I give this app two stars because it's otherwise decently well designed.
title: Dishonest Money Withdrawing Machine

review: It‚Äôs by far the most horrific experience I‚Äôve had with any bank customer service and that is saying something because I‚Äôve been with BofA. 1-2 business day response for an email question?!!! What are these guys using dial up? In the world of instant communication that we live in, this is a joke. Why on earth does it take that long and if your lucky you get a response. Yes I love there product in the sense of saving money for the future but if you hit a wall your screwed I suggest not using there bank service, just transfer the money or link up your physical bank to your acorns. If you want an online bank with great customer service go to Discover or Ally even Chime and they all offer the same apy if that is your main use for an online banks and if you want to invest they offer that too. I just want my a new debit card because their debit card stopped working wether it be the chip or swiping. I have all my none responded emails and recorded all my attempts at contacting them via phone. I‚Äôm simply going to make it my hobby to blast this type of review time and time and time again and on all the social media platforms because this an absolute joke.
title: SLOW, TERRIBLE, INADEQUATE CUSTOMER SERIVE!!!

review:
All in all, Acorns is great for people to begin saving. I‚Äôve used it for a little over a year and it‚Äôs been prettt cool to watch something that starts little grow into something more. For that I give 5 stars.

The offset to 3 stars is their constant marketing schemes. If you‚Äôve ever read the book ‚ÄúStart With Why‚Äù, you‚Äôd know it‚Äôs a form of manipulation via promotions. What they do is they say hey we will give you $1000 if you recruit only 5 people to Acorns. But reality is, you‚Äôre given 2-3 days, they all have to make initial investments which can take some time, so therefore it‚Äôs practically unattainable. They‚Äôre relying on breakage as, of course, they don‚Äôt want to give out $1000 to everyone, so they make it unrealistic enough to where they can get 2-3 new people each time they run that little scam (it‚Äôs very frequent) while maybe only a select few actually reap the benefits of the promotion. Eventually, there‚Äôs no one left to bring to Acorns, so it kind of works as a pyramid scheme in a sense. I feel it‚Äôs dishonest and it‚Äôs the only thing I don‚Äôt like about Acorns.
title: Great Concept but Shady Marketing
developerResponse: {'id': 30520894, 'body': 'We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-06-23T12:53:54Z'}

review:
I had high hopes for this site. I have been using TD Ameritrade for 20 years and Schwab for a few months but wanted to take advantage of Acorns‚Äô Round-Up feature and automatic approach. Been a member for less than a year and it could be so much better!

Pros: Round-Up seems to work well, large list of banks/institutions to connect, easy automatic approach and setup, simple ETF basket investment choices based on personal goal and other questions, and weekly positive emails with informative and inspiring articles, stories and resources.

Cons: Eliminating their ‚Äúbasic‚Äù plan and forcing current members into next tier at triple the monthly fee! (I just don‚Äôt need a checking account or debit card, sorry.) Actual linking of accounts requires multiple tries if it works (still can‚Äôt link two accounts after several attempts), forced to use ‚ÄúPlaid‚Äù to link‚Äîcouldn‚Äôt input account info as an alternative on app; unable to choose specific ETFs or even sector choices; unable to choose monthly investment option like other sites‚Äîweekly ONLY.
title: Glitchy, not enough choices, tripled fees
developerResponse: {'id': 24275573, 'body': "We really appreciate your in-depth feedback and we'd love to hear more from you. We never stop working on making our customer experience the best it can be. When you have a chance, please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859. ", 'modified': '2021-08-03T01:02:55Z'}

review:
Overall I‚Äôve nothing really bad to say as I‚Äôm just getting started and crunching some numbers myself to figure out if I‚Äôll stay with Acorns in the long run.  But two things Acorns could do to make it easier for non-Wall Street money managers or the like: first, those of us who do the Round-Ups manually vs. automatic, we should be able to select all the transactions we want for one larger deposit instead of limiting it to about $5 a time.  Who wants multiple $5 (or thereabouts) withdrawals from their banks on the same day?  Second, the graph indicating profits/loss isn‚Äôt very clear.  Let‚Äôs face it, anyone who‚Äôs trying out Acorns knows of or probably also used Robinhood.  Their graph is a bit easier to understand.

These minor issues aside however, Acorns is pretty solid in my opinion and will likely keep with it as a supplement to my finances.  Just needs some streamlining and it would be even better!
title: Great App, but could be streamlined.

review:
The option to invest in ESG ETFs is a great new option and I was excited to see this. However, in order to partake in this new option it forces you to withdrawal the investments you have already made, and then reinvests them. This causes taxes to be withheld from any gains you have made. I wish they would add an option to keep the investments you have while investing any new deposits into the new ESG portfolios so I don‚Äôt have to pay the tax on my earnings. 

Otherwise this is a great app and makes investing so easy. I have no other complaints and recommend this to anyone serious about wanting to invest but not sure where to start. Round up feature is great and the recurring investment option is pretty seamless. The amount I have accrued in dividends and the returns I‚Äôve made on my investments have already exceeded the price ($1/month) the app charges so it has essentially paid for itself. 

I‚Äôd give it 5 stars if they added the option to invest in the ESG portfolios with all new investments and not forcing you to switch everything else over as well.
title: New portfolios

review: I got this app initially to use the feature that rounds up your debit card purchases and saves the change in an account for you. I had something similar before. However that one took the change out each time you used your debit card and immediately put it in their account, so you never felt like you were missing anything. This one waits until it adds up to at least $5.00 , and then they take at least $5 out of your account at one time. I know that it‚Äôs really the same thing in the end, but when you‚Äôre taking $0.23 or whatever it is at a time you don‚Äôt feel it. You see at least $5 come out, and you feel it a bit more. The other thing that I don‚Äôt like is that they control your money, YOU DON‚ÄôT. I‚Äôm not sure why I can‚Äôt move my money from one part of the account to the other. I know that you can‚Äôt just movie it around like crazy, because it‚Äôs supposed to be invested for you. However, there should absolutely be a way to take like $50 out of your account and put it in your spend account if your in need. However, you can‚Äôt. At least I don‚Äôt know how (and I looked) if it‚Äôs possible. It is my money after all.
title: No control!!

review:
Love the navigation and look to the app. The debit card they supply is very cool and has your signature on it that will never rub off. It did take over a week to finally receive my card in the mail, but this was more of an annoyance because I was eager to start using the round-up feature. 

Another annoyance is the incessant email and app alerts prompting you to link your account with your work payroll‚Äôs direct deposit. No way that I can find to turn these off. 

The area that is bothersome is that money transfers into one‚Äôs checking account (to reload the debit card) takes a LONG time to clear‚Ä¶ like 5 business days. This is longer than any financial institution I have ever dealt with, and is the only major drawback to Acorns in my opinion.  Support is very good, but they informed me that in the first 60 days of my account that transfers will take 3-5 business days, then 1-3 business days to clear after 60 days.   Would happily change my rating if this problem were to be solved.
title: Great app and business model. A couple things to work on

review: Well after reading all the reviews it‚Äôs almost seems like this company needs a class action suit against it. I signed up and elected for the round up option. I‚Äôve issues getting into my account since I opened it. Finally got someone to reset the password for me. Sign in and realized they hadn‚Äôt rounded up for over 8 months. That for some reason they stopped rounding up and investing it for me but they didn‚Äôt stop charging me the monthly fee to do that. So here I thought they were investing my money and they weren‚Äôt. Just taking my monthly fee to do JACK. Customer service was no help just ‚ÄúOh sorry for the inconvenience‚Äù. Seems like companies acting as investment agents should be doing just that. Seems like if they‚Äôre not it‚Äôs an issue for the FEC who governors investment firms. Customer said maybe it was your bank that blocked the round ups. I was like then don‚Äôt you think you should have notified me if that was the case. Seem like they had no problem taking my monthly fee from the exact same bank. Just asked to withdraw my funds. As soon as it‚Äôs in my bank account I‚Äôll close the account. This company is just screaming for a class action suit.
title: FRAUD
developerResponse: {'id': 30202700, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to address your concerns. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-06-07T01:40:21Z'}

review:
*ONLY catch is they do charge $1, $3, or $5, depending on your plan and they don‚Äôt exactly make it very well known, but it‚Äôs still extremely worth it with the spare change. My investments pay the cost.* 

*It also takes 7-14 days to Withdraw from your change jar account, but it‚Äôs all legit with no, or extremely minimal fees (I don‚Äôt remember paying anything and I took out $50) 

I couldn‚Äôt believe this wasn‚Äôt a scam, I search high and low. Nope! 100% legit and it‚Äôs helping me save so much. $50 in change a month on average, and I think I‚Äôm going to double that because I don‚Äôt even notice the money missing. 

Their deals are also amazing, takes 120 days (haven‚Äôt gotten mine yet, so we‚Äôll see. I‚Äôll take a star away if anything goes wrong) is at $55 of free money, and (if it does work) much more as I‚Äôll be using their debit card (only for their specials and emergencies) 

Top notch for beginners, I‚Äôm 28 and feel so stupid I didn‚Äôt do this a decade ago (well idk if it was around then!). Once I build up some extra cash, I‚Äôll start moving money around myself with Robinhood. (But continue this app obviously because a cyber change jar that isn‚Äôt a scam and invests the change? FREAKIN COOL) 

But I‚Äôve easily combined my Roth IRA, added to throw in $5 a month while I‚Äôm unemployed. It just makes it so easy.
title: Great for all ages! It‚Äôs a gosh darn digital change jar that invests your spare change!
developerResponse: {'id': 20718070, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your thorough review! We're happy to hear that you're enjoying your investing experience and ease of use with Acorns. To touch on your note about pricing, our subscription tiers can be found on our website, here: https://www.acorns.com/pricing/ and withdrawals from your Invest account to your bank account can take  3-6 business days. Regulatory requirements dictate a mandatory two-day settlement period after shares are sold from your Invest account before we transfer funds to your bank account. ", 'modified': '2021-01-28T21:41:38Z'}

review:
Acorns is a great app, but it‚Äôs not getting better over time. It has stagnated. While they‚Äôve reached that lull point of stability whereby everything works properly, nothing is new. This is always what happens when a company gets investment money; they over-hire and sit on their hands pretending to be focusing on efficiency and scale.

I‚Äôd like a Goals feature like Betterment has. What I‚Äôd also like to see is their being less attached to the single mode and method. I‚Äôd like more granular control over investments, the ability to dedicate funds to specific stocks if I‚Äôd like, and just general granularity that can be tucked away so that I don‚Äôt have to have 85 different investment apps to buy what I need. What about those who like passive investment for the long haul but are ready for more? A real, percentage-based cashback program would be so much better than this cheesy, commission-based Earn program. Some days I don‚Äôt know why I pay the $3/mo. for the privilege of their Spend account when most banks would pay ME to keep my money with them. Spending goals is long overdue at this point, especially for an account I‚Äôm paying for.
title: Great App. Needs more features.
developerResponse: {'id': 30520824, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback! If you have any other suggestions for us, please contact us at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-06-23T12:51:41Z'}

review:
I signed up for this app based on my brother's recommendation. I was investing once a week. I received the offer that if I refer three friends, I will receive $500, so I referred three of my family members, and they are also investing. According to the acorn policy, the rewards should be verified within 14 days, and I'm supposed to get money, but it's been months and I haven't received any. I received another offer in which I would receive $700 if I preferred 5 friends. I invited 5 friends, and it's been more than 14 days, but I still haven't received my renewal. It's a complete scam, believe me. I'm going to delete my accounts and will notify everyone I invited to do the same. Someone playing with other people's money and making money is not acceptable. This app should be banned by the US government as well as the rest of the world. I'm so regretted  that I've already squandered some of my money here. 
Another issue is that they have terrible customer service. Every time you call, they will put you on hold and no one will be able to help you with your problems, and they will prove that you are wrong. Please avoid it at all costs.
title: Acorns is a Scam
developerResponse: {'id': 28610884, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to address your concerns. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-03-16T14:25:31Z'}

review: They took my information and did not provide service or support. I signed up for Acorns late 2018/early 2019. I provided all of my personal information and all of my banking information. After providing it, the app said I needed to provide additional verification without details and without a phone number to call. Ever since when I try to login it says additional verification needed and does not allow me in. When I‚Äôve contacted support they say my request needs to go to a special team. The ‚Äúspecial team‚Äù has not provided a response since the new year and I still cannot access the account despite providing all requested information and following every step they‚Äôve asked. I‚Äôve now asked them to delete my account twice and 3 weeks later they still have not responded. Personally I‚Äôm sad I gave them my information because now they have it and I have no way to know what they are doing with it. I don‚Äôt feel like they are a legitimate investment company if they do not provide any support for their product. Glad I never funded it. I‚Äôll take my money elsewhere, but not until I ensure they provide support when needed.
title: Can‚Äôt access since 2019 - no support- 0 stars!

review: I‚Äôm recently diagnosed with bipolar disorder but in the past I‚Äôve spent money like it grew on trees, and I didn‚Äôt know how to set up retirement stuff or even how to invest. I first downloaded this as a passive way to invest and get money but then acorns started showing me my potential which I couldn‚Äôt see a future for myself at all. Then it started giving me hope with retirement and helped me set up a Roth IRA. More recently I‚Äôve started using the debit card and so far I really like what I‚Äôm seeing with it. I just hope they come out with a credit card sometime cause it would be very helpful. In the end money is something that scared me but acorn helped me set up a solid baseline and even took away the fear of not seeing what my money was doing and it helps control my bipolar episode‚Äôs because many of them were money related and it just feels like I finally have a net to catch me when I fall
title: A saving grace

review: So Acorns is great until you run into trouble. Acorns was designed for the average person trying to save money and not that well versed in finances. I opened a ROTH IRA at a time where my income qualified for this type of account. Now my income has changed and I unfortunately continue to contribute to the ROTH IRA. Since then, I‚Äôve been trying to get a hold of my broker because I need to amend my taxes and pay a penalty fee for contributing to an account I no longer qualified for. I‚Äôve been calling Acorns to get this straightened out and always get the same answer: ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt give financial advise.‚Äù I know my account is being managed by a person not a robot! I just need to know what my earning where and if they have a different type of account, such as non-deductible IRA, so I can transfer the excess earnings. So far, I only get outsourced customer service reps and a generic email redirecting back to the link where I can find my statements. Can you at least tell me where is this information in my statements? Assuming I can find it there! This is horrible! Great company to take your money but not available when you need them.
title: Where is my broker?
developerResponse: {'id': 31554339, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to address your concerns. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-08-19T12:30:38Z'}

review: I didn‚Äôt complete the confirmation process for an acorn account. The app said I was 25% completed. I never executed a transaction. I canceled my account before completing the process. My subscription was cancelled. However, the they didn‚Äôt delete my bank router number and bank account number. I was only given the option to PAUSE the link to my account and NOT to DELETE it. When I asked for confirmation that this data was deleted, I was given two non-responses. First, they don‚Äôt sell my data. I would hope not since we were discussing my router and account numbers. Second, their data is secure. I told them that I don‚Äôt agree and that is why I want my bank access numbers deleted. No one is un-hackable, as evidenced by numerous large institutions that had their ‚Äúsecure‚Äù data hacked. REGARDLESS THAT I‚ÄôM NOT A CUSTOMER, THEY WILL NOT DELETE MY ROUTER NUMBER OR ACOUNT NUMBER FROM THEIR DATABASE. Acorn does not indemnified me if a hacker gets access to my bank account and empties my it. If you don‚Äôt like Acorn keeping access to your bank accounts after you cease being a customer, DON‚ÄôT EVER START THE SIGN UP PROCESS WITH ACORN.
title: Bank account at risk after ceasing to be a customer
developerResponse: {'id': 29011067, 'body': 'We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-04-06T13:20:22Z'}

review:
My bank account was ‚Äúunlinked‚Äù without my knowledge, or so said the rep. My account actually WAS linked and for some reason was marked as unavailable for round-ups (the whole reason I have the app). 

I‚Äôve been charged for 6 months without the all actually doing what I‚Äôve been paying for it to do. The rep told me since it‚Äôs a subscription they denied my request for a refund or a credit but continued to offer to cancel my subscription and close my account. They would rather cancel my account then refund $15. It took over an hour and asking more than 5 times with round about explanations on how the application works before they finally told me they wouldn‚Äôt give me a refund. 

This was AFTER they had me re-link the same bank account that was showing as unavailable. It felt so violating for them to require my banking information to be removed and linked again before they told me that they couldn‚Äôt figure out the issue or give me a refund.
title: Be careful with they secret changes
developerResponse: {'id': 29796735, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to address your concerns. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-05-17T12:30:30Z'}

review: Someone hacked my account, changed my email address and attempted to change the linked bank account. It happens, not the end of the world. Fortunately it sent an alert email to the original email. I called Acorns, changed email addresses, passwords, pins and restored the original bank account.    Fast forward one week and it happens again, by the same person changed to the same email address, attempting to switch it to the same bank. How did they get past the two factor authentication and how did they not ban the email address. Their fraud detection is the least sophisticated I have encountered. What's worse is that when talking with them on the phone they don't seem to understand the concerning nature of the problem. They want you to send several sensitive documents to them to confirm the account. No other reputable company that I know handles this problem, in this way, so poorly. This started out as a learning tool for teaching my four kids to invest. I will be taking the money out (when I can access the account again) and looking elsewhere.
title: Can‚Äôt seem to deal with fraud

review:
I downloaded the app thinking I would make small investments with my spare change. While looking through the app you get the sense that in order to fully get the app set up you need to initiate other portions of the app. I looked into the ‚ÄúLater‚Äù investment section and found it was a ROTH IRA and I went through the set up and was simply mocking up an IRA to see where the investment would lead. I set it up for $150 a week and found that I would have significant savings when I retire. When I completed this section I realized it was going to deduct this from my account every week. I did not want that to happen so I turned off the auto contribute so that money would not come out. This week of course it did come out and now I have to wait a week for that money to transfer to Acorn then I have to withdraw it so I can get it back. Now because it‚Äôs an investment account I am probably going to get hit with fees for the early withdraw. There is no real way to contact them other than email which gives them the ability to simply ignore you. 

Going to get my money back and delete the app. I would advise nobody download it.
title: BEWARE!!!!!

review:
I don‚Äôt even notice the roundups so it‚Äôs wonderful to watch essentially your spare change grow over time. I also love that it will automatically notice my bank account is low. I had some large home repairs from a storm and was so stressed out. Then I got a notification that roundups have been paused automatically‚Äîone less thing I had to worry about was a huge relief. 

The weekly bonuses for referrals are a good way to quickly boost your account. I am always interested the found-money deals that invest your cash back for signing up for offers. Offers through Acorns frequently give more cash back than the same company‚Äôs offer on other platforms. 

Using this app has been a positive experience. I navigate it so easily I can‚Äôt give specific feedback because I‚Äôve never even thought about it.
title: Fantastic way to get started as a beginner

review: I have had Acorns for a couple years now. Initially I used some of the save/invest accounts. For the last year or so I have mainly used the checking account to link to my EBay business so I can track the funds. With this arrangement I have frequent transactions is the $3-400 range. Out of the blue last month my account flagged when a DEPOSIT was made. I had to send pictures of the transaction to get it unlocked. After that my debit card was locked. It took 3 customer service contacts and 7 days to get everything running again. There had been no unusual or fraudulent transactions that triggered all of this, they were all routine deposits/payments that I had done for over a year. Randomly, Acorns decided my account needed to be protected from me! The people I spoke with were unapologetic and did nothing to explain what was causing all of the issues. I have to be able to access my own account. I will be leaving Acorns after these events.
title: Unpredictable security flags

review:
During a time of a bit of a financial hardship for me I deposited a check into acorns checking account I made sure I would have access to the funds in a timely manner everything I read said maximum of 3 business days and ended up basically having my money held hostage my daughter went without a birthday present. Customer service is the same woman I can‚Äôt understand her English honestly I think she uses that to her advantage cause I don‚Äôt think she knew what she was saying and had no actual answers to my questions. What kind of documentation can one possibly have for depositing a personal check from my father whom I share a last name with!? They (acorns) locked my account so not only do I still not have the funds from the check I deposited but they are holding all my money denying me access to my own money and if there‚Äôs one thing not to ‚ÄúF‚Äù with it‚Äôs my MONEY.

Update:
Still nothing. Countless calls, emails, and texts chats with support and no answers and no money. It‚Äôs not available in account and the accounts locked but they took it out of my dads account 15 days ago.

review: I‚Äôve had Acorns for over 2 years now, and it‚Äôs so easy to use and save that sometimes I even forget I have it! You can set it up to automatically deduct from your bank account and deposit to your Acorns account for as much or as little as you want, as often (or not) as you want! You can even pause your deposits anytime you need to, or set it to automatically pause when your bank account gets below a certain amount. AND you can withdraw whenever you want (I don‚Äôt recommend doing that often for tax purposes, but I‚Äôve had to do it twice now and it didn‚Äôt affect anything negatively), and it typically takes about 3-5 days to deposit to your bank account. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this app, and I rarely take the time to post reviews unless I really think it‚Äôs important. GREAT INVESTMENT APP FOR STARTERS!!!!!

review: Acorns has most definitely made it easier on me in terms of saving money. Whether a person is or isn‚Äôt good with saving their money or organizing a personal budget... there is absolutely no way anyone and everyone can‚Äôt benefit from this app, there‚Äôs no way you can go wrong :)

review: I was using Acorns to invest money and I had about $250 on the app and it was also connected to my bank account. About 6 months ago, my account was hacked and all of my money on the app as well as all the money in my bank account was taken out. I contacted Acorns multiple times to try to get my money back, everytime they told me they would get back to me. I never heard back from them. Eventually, I gave up. All I wanted was to close my acorns account and never have anything to do with them again. I called and had my account ‚Äúclosed‚Äù. Little did I know, them ‚Äúclosing‚Äù my account meant they were still taking money out of my bank account every month. Now, they are taking money out of my account every month but I can‚Äôt get back into my Acorns account because it is ‚Äúclosed‚Äù. I‚Äôm going to contact my bank and have them stop Acorns from taking my money anymore but this is so upsetting and I feel like acorns has been taking advantage of me and scamming me out of money. I seriously question whether my account was hacked by an actual person or if it was just Acorns.

review: I have been trying to get my August statement since September 16th and it‚Äôs still not in my account. I was assured multiple times by multiple customer service agents on the 19th that it would be available by the end of the day. No one could give me a phone number to the mysterious internal team who would need to take care of the issue and no one could give me to a supervisor. We called and spoke to at least 10 different people trying to get this resolved. The next day, the statement still wasn‚Äôt available. Then I was assured multiple times again that it would be available by the end of the week. Here we are on the 25th and it‚Äôs STILL NOT AVAILABLE. I needed that document for my lender in order to buy a property and wasn‚Äôt able to use my money in this account to qualify. Thankfully I had another bank account I was able to use and we closed on our house, but what if I hadn‚Äôt been able to? That is MY money I‚Äôm trusting you with and I expect my statements to be delivered to me ON TIME. If you can‚Äôt do that, I‚Äôll have to move my money somewhere else.

review: I have enjoyed the features this app provides for several reasons. If you have any questions, please contact us at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.', 'modified': '2021-09-15T14:11:29Z'}

review: This app is awesome overall but there are some functionalities within the app that make no sense whatsoever. 1) Banking transfers are either unnecessarily complicated or overly simplistic depending on how you view it. One time transfers into the savings can only be done via your Acorns checking, and one time transfers into checking can only be done via  your primary linked account. Not sure why account transfers can‚Äôt have many-to-many parity as opposed to one-to-one. 2) Enabling roundups happens across the entire app instead of per account (checking, saving, or investment). If you enable or disable the roundup feature then there‚Äôs no way to specify which account you‚Äôd like to apply it to. In my case it seems to be synchronized across my checking and investment account, where if I enable/disable it one account then the other is updated as well.
title: Great app but functionally wonky

review: If you have $1,000 lying around, this app is for you! I don‚Äôt do round-ups or automatic deposits. I don‚Äôt trust an app enough to do that. I manually invest whenever I can, and I can say that with $1,000 invested with a moderate risk portfolio, my monthly dividends paid for my monthly $1 subscription fee. This app is so worth it. I had been planning on not touching this money for at least a year to avoid a capital gains tax, but  it‚Äôs so nice to see that money grow that I might just end up keeping it there for many more years. There have been a couple of scary drops, but I resisted the urge to withdraw or freeze my investments, and the market has always bounced back. This app is not for everyone, but I highly recommend it for those who might have a grand or two languishing in a low yield savings account.
title: Easy way to invest

review: Acorns is an absolutely trash app there are millions of better apps to use and ways to invest money. My wife asked my what acorns was because she was looking at our bank account and for the last year they have been charging a subscription fee because I still had $0.13 in my invest for future account. The account they wouldn‚Äôt let me take the $0.13 out of in the first place. I wouldn‚Äôt waste my time if I was you. You are better off investing in stocks through an app or going to your local bank/ and or credit union and opening up a Roth IRA.

review:
If you have any issues with them, you will be beyond frustrated! I tried to deposit a check from my MOTHER, who had the same last name/address on the check that was on file for my account. They deposited it within 24 hours, and immediately locked my account due to ‚Äúsuspicious activity.‚Äù 

When I contacted them, I was told to provide proof of the purpose of the check, which there wasn‚Äôt. I was later asked to provide documents that showed that my mother‚Äôs account had sufficient funds, and that the check had cleared (it did the day that it was deposited into my account). Once I provided that information, I was told that I‚Äôd still have to wait until the 5 business days were up, and I‚Äôd have to call them to unlock my account then. 

I will be closing my account immediately upon receiving my funds. I‚Äôve never known a bank to ask for documents for an account that isn‚Äôt held by their customer, and their customer service was atrocious. This entire experience has been insane!

review: I‚Äôve been with Acorns since 2017. With the roundups feature and a reoccurring monthly investment I‚Äôve been able to a decent amount that I struggled to do previously. Set it up and leave it there and let it grow. I‚Äôm looking long term so this is working for me. I give it 4 stars for this reason: the gains are slow and won‚Äôt match up to a strategy that you could create on your own with Robinhood or another platform. I am new to investing so going with the stock and bond options that they offer was fine for me. If you are looking for a more aggressive approach and want to see more immediate gains and returns this may not be the app for you. If you have the patience to save slowly and put your spare change to work for you without even thinking about it, download this app.  Best of luck financially to all of you.

review: Initially I loved the app. Until I had fraud on my account. They made it so difficult to cancel my current card and in top of that I was routed to people in the Philippines. And it took me 3 customer service reps to finally cancel my card. Then I had to ‚Äúmake‚Äù them file a claim for me because I was not able to file the claim until the fraud charged was processed. I was told that it was filed but a week later I got a notification in my email saying that If I do not file a claim they will not refund the fraud charge. This was way too difficult for a charge that was only about $15. And also these reps had so much attitude for something so sensitive. Ridiculous! I could only imagine if it were worse, how difficult it would have been. The same thing also happened to my US bank card the day before and one simple phone call they refunded me and sent me a new card right away. This gives me a really uneasy feeling about acorns.

review: This app is not for the use of anybody, no matter what you do to try and get the money out of your account they just keep it and hold it. review: Buyer beware! I have had an account for approximately 5 years. At the beginning of the month, I initiated a withdraw from my account. It takes 5-7 business days to process. I sent all the information to verify my identity and was told that ‚Äúour team‚Äù has to evaluate it and it would take another 5-7 business days. At the end of that time period I checked back in and have been consistently told that it‚Äôs going to be another 1-2 business days, but I NEVER hear back from them and my account is still locked. I have contacted customer service multiple times via email, chat, and phone and I always get the same answer‚Äî1-2 business days. I looked at BBB and the have an F rating. Please find another service because this one does not seem to be above board in their business dealings.

review:
I have been waiting almost a year now for the debit card that I‚Äôm supposed to be receiving and forget about me trying to cancel it so o can get my money back because getting to support is so complicated for whatever reason. 
  Not only that, where did this subscription fee come from that‚Äôs seems to be charged to my account every month? I was not made aware of such a fee, yet it‚Äôs being taken out of my account, nor am I being made aware how to unsubscribe. The only reason I gave this four stars and not anything but is because I will admit that it is a good service and it helps me put my coins away into a good portfolio. I closed the account considering rejoining in the future when I‚Äôm in a better position to do so but after this I would highly recommend not trusting them with your financial information.

review: This app promised me when I signed up that I would never be over drafted. When I contacted them to have me reimbursed, they told me that I just need to send my investment money back into my bank account. How does that make sense? I have $75 in overdraft fees, so why would I pay it back in MY invested money?? I asked the gal to wait til I transferred my money to my bank account before closing my account and she did it without even giving me the chance and ended the chat. The support is unbelievably disappointing. For a company who is constantly offering to give $800 in referral investments, they somehow didn‚Äôt have the money to reimburse me $75 in fees that they caused. title: wont let me withdraw money

review:
When I first got Acorns I completely fell in love with them‚Äîhow brilliant is it to invest your spare change instead of littering the rug of my bedroom? Then I got a chance to make a thousand dollars by referring 5 friends to Acorns. Now this is usually not my style, I just don‚Äôt like being pushy, but I was so excited I went out of my comfort zone and referred five of my friends, and I felt great, in fact, I had more friends to refer! Lots more!

This is where Acorns really made me mad. The link I forwarded them was the link right NEXT to the incentive program. It said, ‚ÄúRefer 5 friends and earn $1000!‚Äù And then the Share Button (I have screen shots) So in good faith, I hit the share button, referred my friends who all started accounts, contributed, texted me back to make sure I got the credit, and guess what? I never received a dime. No credit for lil ole me. 

Why not you may ask? Because the actual link for me to get credit was on an entirely different page. The Share link right next to it was for something completely different, a gimmick in my opinion, and that, friends, is what I call SHADY. Why put a Share button right next to the incentive program and not have it count? I emailed, called, emailed some more but all to no avail. 

All I can do is write this review so that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm doing. 

I‚Äôd recommend a puddle of rat urine in the middle of the street before I recommended Acorns. 

Thanks for the glance, 

~Disheartened

review:

I also love how you can make  random 1 time deposits as well. It‚Äôs great to have access to the savings when needed (only takes 2-5 days to withdraw from the savings if an emergency comes up) 
I use a normal brick and mortar bank as well as Acorns. The money I save in Acorns are for random big purchases/vacations I want to go on. I simply figure out how much I need to save up and set the recurring deposit. And then I withdraw it when the time comes to use the money.

title: A waste of time..

review:
Anyone who wants to save needs to fight the urge not to spend. I think Acorns is doing a great job helping people fight poverty by saving and investing. The technology is awesome- safe and easy to use. The portfolio reporting is in real time and near excellent in quality. You can set yourself up according to your risk appetite and watch your savings grow, almost effortlessly. Yes, there is a service fee, but I think the charge is exceptionally good value for money. 

Summary? So far, I'm up to over $1400 in seed savings in just about 11 months of using the app. But it does take some effort on my part too, to build up savings. Sometimes, I deliberately and a few more hard dollars to the pot too. 

Bottom line is this: Acorns will help you, if you really do want to save. If you don't, you'll find an excuse not to anyway.

review:
I had an extremely disappointing experience with Acorns and feel compelled to share my negative feedback. Firstly, their customer support is abysmal. When I had an issue with my account, reaching their support team was an absolute nightmare. They were unresponsive, slow, and seemed completely disinterested in resolving my problem.

Moreover, their referral program is a complete waste of time. I referred several friends, and none of them received the promised bonuses. When I contacted customer support about it, as expected, they were unhelpful and offered no resolution whatsoever.

I strongly advise staying away from Acorns if you value good customer service and expect a referral program that actually works. There are plenty of other investment platforms out there with better support and more reliable referral rewards. Save yourself the frustration and choose a different option!

review:

No matter how many times I emphasized that I needed to CANCEL my withdrawal, they kept sending me the same copy-and-paste information, which taught me how to submit a withdrawal. 
Two problems with this:
1. I already know how to submit a withdrawal. 
2. The problem was that I needed to cancel a withdrawal, not submit one. 
3. (Bonus problem) this kind of low-effort, inadequately trained customer support should be a thing of the past. I‚Äôve dealt with far more capable companies concerning equally, if not more, complex issues. Get your stuff together, Acorns.
