review: I‚Äôm all about smart investing. This is easy, effortless and effective way as any to make your money grow. You don‚Äôt miss the pocket change coming out of your bank account, but when you see how those pennies turn into dollars through Acorns. Wow!  Wish this would have been around 20 years ago, I might be retired by now. Do yourself a favor, make use of all they offer. After I saw how well they did investing my pocket change through Invest account, I started a Later IRA with them, and got the Spend Account with a debit card too. For $3/month, you won‚Äôt find a cheaper way to have your money managed for you. Using Found Money has also added a nice little ‚Äúacorn‚Äù to my financial goals. BTW- I was not paid for my review, I just love this that much.
title: Brilliant

review:
I‚Äôve been with Acorns for years now, but I wanted a bit more control over my finances, so I started the transfer of assets process to another brokerage after a few bad interactions with their phone support. Two months later of following up with them, Acorns still hasn‚Äôt let me transfer out my assets, so I tried to withdraw my money directly. They then locked in the withdraw price as expected, but then instead of following the 3-6 business days for a withdrawal, they unlinked my checking account without telling me and suspended the account. Unless I followed up with them, they weren‚Äôt going to actually process the withdraw.

Acorns phone support can‚Äôt do anything complicated and needed to email other departments that can take several days to weeks to respond. Acorns really badly needs to improve their phone support and the ability for support to do something quickly.
title: Money going into acorns is fine, but money coming out is impossible

review:
On top of the fact that when you set up dates to transfer money they will take upwards of 5-7 days for money to actually show up in your account when you call to get a reason why it takes so long the folks on the other end of the phone have no clue what they are doing. The flip side is occasionally they will transfer the money the day early out of your account which could mess everything up. 

When you put in for an account transfer using a different brokerage they will not comply or communicate. You will have to call them up and find out apparently they emailed you 3 weeks ago and we‚Äôre not going to follow up or process the transfer. So now you get to wait another 3 weeks before the accounts transfer. So money‚Ä¶ your money you have no access to and can‚Äôt move easily. Then you call customer support and they can‚Äôt help you either. 

Atrocious. And their fees are ridiculous.
title: Worst customer service EVER

review: This is a great app for putting money back.  Acorns is a lot more flexible than they advertise as far as the function of the app. Sure, you can deposit money and watch it follow the trend of major markets, and the roundup feature is a great virtual coin jar, but more so it is a great way of setting aside money for savings, projects or anything else in life.  Being able to select specific amounts of money to be deposited on either a daily, weekly or monthly basis is a top tier feature instantly making this app extremely flexible so that literally anyone can save or invest in their future. The main selling point that makes this work is that there are no fines for withdrawing money at any time at any amount.
title: A very useful app
developerResponse: {'id': 32577119, 'body': 'Thanks for saving and investing in your future with us! Grow your oak!\n', 'modified': '2022-10-14T12:49:23Z'}

review: I'm sorry Acorns, I don't like writing bad reviews, but you had two chances on the submitted tickets I sent asking for a refund. Your response has been extremely bad. I was charged $3 a month for 2 years that I didn't even logged in in your app. I had $10 dollars rewards for a trial promo back in 2020, I even gave that cash back away in exchange for the "refund" you promised and I only got $9 back. I complained, was told I was gonna get $6 more and never got them. If I had known I would have just transfered those $10 to my account and cancel my account myself, I would have one more dollar in my pocket. It's really bad, your app is about helping people save money, you must be the first ones to be aware with SO MANY subscriptions nowadays it's hard to keep track, and for me to not be able to get a refund when there was clearly ZERO use of that account for two long years, I wouldn't expect that from you.
title: Really bad customer service!

review: Like being stranded without a debit card for two weeks or more? Do you like it when customer service gives you the run around? Wanna be told that they don‚Äôt allow a third party service, such as plaid, to access functions within your account, even though they use them their selves to link to your bank? Then this is the bank for you! Not once, but twice they have failed to deliver my debit card in a timely manner. I have been stranded without access to my funds on many occasions and I probably should have seen the red flag the FIRST time they failed to deliver on their promise when my debit card expired. I would 0/0 recommend using Acorns. Read the reviews. Almost every single issue I‚Äôve read about Acorns has been a similar or same experience. They are unreliable at best and love to lure you in with the idea of investing spare change. Please don‚Äôt use this organization. Their credibility is in question.
title: Terrible banking practices

review: I cannot believe the return from this app. I started with 100 dollars a few years ago and within six months the amount had grown to almost 1000 bucks. Then it kept going and I had to take out money every now and then to cover my expenses. Of course, a bit tricky that it takes 5-7 days to get the money but also very good since I don‚Äôt dip in there often. Acorns have saved my rent situation quite a few times and within about six to seven months bounced back up. Now that the market is down my account is a bit lower as well, but this is the time to invest for when the market comes back up. I am so excited about this app and how smoothly it saves my money for me.
title: Amazing savings app!

review: I‚Äôm trying to close my Acorns account because first off they were taking money from my account and blamed it on Robinhood even after I turned it off and unlinked my account. review: I can not say enough good things about this app. I was never able to save money and that has all changed. I was always paycheck to paycheck. The round ups are amazing and really do add up. I started with an invest account then added a spend card card, then a later and now I also have the early kids account. This was everything I needed to be able to get on track for my daughters and mine financial security. You can turn it off when things are tight, it will not over draw any account will just let you know they are putting it on pause, once you get comfortable at a certain savings amount, like with round ups, you can adjust it to 2x. I see it as a level unlocked. I find saving fun now.... ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Fantastic! Just do it!!!

review:
I don‚Äôt usually leave negative reviews but I‚Äôm so fed up with this place. I switched to acorn because I had a job that did direct deposit and for awhile it was great. I‚Äôm now currently at a job that‚Äôs checks only, but Acorn claims you can do mobile deposits. Just don‚Äôt. You go through the normal steps of signing the back and taking photos but then they tell you to write ‚ÄúFor deposit only into Acorns.‚Äù But then they won‚Äôt accept it because it‚Äôs suppose to say ‚ÄúFor deposit into Acorns only.‚Äù Then when you finally get it to go through they do a reverse deposit. I tried to dispute the claim and the response I got is the reason I‚Äôm leaving this review. So thank you Alyssa from Acorn, I really appreciated the app screwing up and causing me to have to wait another 7 days before I can actually get paid. 
Btw, if you're going to deny a deposit, maybe contact the person in an email and let them know WHY. Simple, non-tacky, communication would‚Äôve solid my problem.
title: Mobile Deposit is a NIGHTMARE

review: I‚Äôve been with acorns for over 2 years now and have lost $95 in my investments, no gain. As well as I put in around $120 a month to more into this which means I should at a minimum have close to $3,000 invested. But it only shows $1,700 invested so not only have they lost half my money I have put in but also I am not gaining anything. How is this investing, when in total I have lost an extreme amount compared to nothing gained‚Ä¶.. It would be 100 times better just to put my money into a savings account and only gain like 11cents a month, compared to losing $50 a month and so much more. I pay for the $3 a month subscription, I do the round up on everything I purchase, and I put in $10 a month just as a little extra. Still only lose of income has occurred. Maybe I just have an awful person taking control over my account or someone embezzling my money. Either way my experience with Acorns has been awful.
title: Zero Gain

I regret giving this company my bank details or any personal information ever. I‚Äôve never had issues like this with Robinhood or tdameritrade. review: I like the concept and I was excited to set it up and use it. I just cancelled it to ensure I‚Äôm no longer charged and a bit ticked I didn‚Äôt realize I was going to be charged that whole time when I didn‚Äôt even have the account fully set up in the first place. review: I have been an acorns user for over a year now.  The largest problem I have is the fact that the return is very minimal and that it is all projective which I get the markets are. The accounts that they invest your money into that you are not allowed to choose from are generally horrible if you do your research. When I say not allowed to choose from I mean I was invested very aggressively so they call it. It is a great platform if you choose to use as more of a savings account than a investment account.  I have over 500k invested in T.D. Ameritrade for low trade fees and have made much more in a year than on this platform. Great for a savings account for first timers looking to put money away without looking at it. I am also only 28. So at first I thought it would be great for a small savings start not to look at but unfortunately I look at my financial accounts way to much.
title: Not much return for the amount you put in.

review:
It is cool to save money quickly. Build a quick nest egg. But some days it take daaaays to pull money from your account which confuses your bank account and the acorns app. The metal card is cool - shows they care about their product. If they stopped the metal card I‚Äôd honestly be out. I‚Äôd like them to speed up the money transfers. I am trying to put money in the account and the fact that it takes so long is disheartening. I wish they would also explain a bit more about some of the features. 

All in all it‚Äôs a great way to save money while making a little more on the side. It‚Äôs all about making your money work for you, but the fact that it‚Äôs so slow is not fun. I have ‚Äúfound money‚Äù that has still yet to transfer into my over all total and some days it takes a week for my money to arrive into my investing account.
title: It‚Äôs okay

review:
I‚Äôve been reading a lot of the negative reviews, and I‚Äôve concluded a lot of them are complete and total morons who have no idea how to manage money, or get their money to work for them.

One person compared RobinHood to Acorns. They are not the same and in no way has acorns said they are. Acorns is less riskier and for more long term goals. RobinHood is if you want to throw money at something and lose or gain instantly. RH is direct stock investing (and it‚Äôs an awful app at that, I don‚Äôt recommend RH to anyone) Acorns is portfolio and risk-mitigated based. You are absolutely stupid if you think the two are comparable. Steer clear of RH, go with Fidelity or some other stock investing app, but I digress.

A lot of the reviews are also classic ID-10T user errors who refuse to take responsibility for their own lack of understanding of an app or companies purpose and functionality. Or investing for that matter; Don‚Äôt do it if you have no clue what you‚Äôre doing.

If you‚Äôre that stupid, you shouldn‚Äôt mess with investing (or money) at all. Otherwise Acorns has been serving it‚Äôs purpose for me.
title: A lot of people are dumber than I thought.

review:
Acorns went from a great way to save money to just another greedy financial company. You can no longer just save money with them. They force you into services you don‚Äôt want or need such as there checking account or child college account. There is also no way out of the constant barrage of advertising for the services you haven‚Äôt subscribed too. Why would I want to open a college fund when I don‚Äôt have nor plan on ever having any kids?

If you want to save some money without really trying. This is the service for you. In 3 years I had almost $2500 saved and never noticed the money missing from my day-to-day checking account. The app on the other hand is horrible. It seems like every time they update it they make it harder to find your account value. Use the website you will be better off.
title: Amazing Service - Horrible App

review: Be warned. They will lock your account for transferring funds to your acorns bank account. The first time it was over $1000. I had to show a bank statement showing I have money in my account. Then I had to show a picture of my account once the funds cleared. Only after i jumped through all of these hoops would they unlock my account. They assured me this was a one time thing and it wouldn‚Äôt happen again. Well guess what. I transferred $500 and they locked my account again demanding the same evidence. And when they lock you out you can not even see your account at all. As soon as this is resolved i am closing all amounts with them. Never again will I do business with them. I am also contacting the BBB about this. I can not wait to sever ties with them. Hours of wasted time for a transaction that is common place and handled by the banking system. User be warned.
title: Locked account Zero stars if I could

review:
Update to my comments below:  I was nervous as to where my money was, but after a week or so, I saw the funds back in my bank account.  It would be best if Acorns could at least email an a statement upon closing the account regarding the expected wait time for deposited of funds.   Otherwise, the app was so-so.  The monthly charges for the minute amount of money I was investing, with so little control over where it was invested, were chipping away at any earnings I may have gotten.  Not a good fit for me.

Previous review:   I never received an email confirming that the account is closed. There has been no explanation as to when I might receive my money back into my bank account. I feel like the money is in limbo.

review: Love everything about acorns. Everything from direct deposit, account alterations and customer service response time has been flawless. The cherry on top of the delicious cake would have to be the debit card though, a small part of me gets sad when I go some where and have to swipe the card myself instead of slapping that bad boy down and watch the person silently marvel at that heavy SOB for a second. That being said I do recommend working on finger muscles while you wait for your card to come in because you need them.
title: Great app/service

review:

The main issue is that Acorn deposits / investing takes at least a week to complete . They ran a promotion from 11-1 to 11-6 where you get $600 invested for inviting 3 friends and having them make their first investment. review:
Acorns promo prices and offers change at will and they will not inform you about it. Which means you can complete an offer without getting your reward or suddenly no longer qualify for it at all. 
I started noticing money was being taken out from my account by Acorns. When I emailed customer service, someone basically told me they didn‚Äôt take anything that wasn‚Äôt approved so I must have approved it and they were going to keep taking the amount they want unless I cancelled my account. 
I only approved round-ups and a weekly recurring $50. I‚Äôd even signed up for a free subscription because their college promotion stated ‚Äúfree services for college students while they attend school‚Äù That was a scam too. 
The Acorns Rep let me know that there was no such thing as that promotion/if there ever was it no longer exists, so they were going to charge me for a $3 monthly subscription now too.
However, you can Google this promotion, it existed! I know because I was on it, but not one of the 150+ employees Acorns brags about could tell me it was over and to expect a charge. 
Customer service is unapologetic to complaints. if they reply at all it will be days later and likely won‚Äôt address your issue. They will just make a professional excuse or blame you while they count the money you didn‚Äôt know you were making for them.
title: I can‚Äôt believe I fell for this acorns scam üôÑ

review: For a first timer in investing money, this app is great for that! It has videos that explain everything about it. This app is great for those that want to invest long term, 5 or more years, not to keep your money in for a couple of weeks or months. It also shows a graph of how much your money will grow over time. I still haven't had to deal with customer service and I've had the app for a little over a year now. So far I got $10 extra from dividends, found money, and a referral from investment account. I also have an early account for my children, and I've seen how their account has gone up. I'm hoping it will stay a good app down the road.
title: Loving it!

They NEVER have a supervisor on duty, in order to speak to a supervisor you need to wait over 24 hours when they call you back. This company and their employees are scammers and thief. If you aren‚Äôt careful, there is another company with a similar name when Googling and you‚Äôll talk to the wrong company about your issues.

review: I take pride in the fact that I‚Äôm putting money away intelligently. Money in a simple bank account does nothing. No interest. No compounding. No sense‚Ä¶ might sell put the chips under your mattress. It takes a minute to really gain trust with anyone when it comes to money. It‚Äôs all a risk though realistically, but you have to take risks in life and avoid complacency. I‚Äôd rather take risk with my money and intelligently gamble on a win then do nothing with it falling victim to complacency. review: After over a year of inactivity and canceling the auto round up acorns just charged my account $30 and another $5 after it. Keep in mind I didn‚Äôt set up reoccurring investments either. Going through my bank statement I don‚Äôt have another charge from acorns as far back as I cared to scroll. Edit: After going through reviews it appears this will probably receive a half hearted reply from the developers trying to save face for their poor customer service and unwarranted charges happening to other accounts. Save your time and refund my money. There are enough negative reviews your copy and paste ‚ÄúWe are sorry‚Äù responses. I am sorry you got stuck with a terrible brand you constantly have to apologize for.
title: Charged $30 1 year after canceling auto round up.

review: I used this app many years back and had a decent experience with it. When I finally started using a financial advisor I moved from this app to them so I could have real investments instead of their generic single investment. Well at the time I was never able to find that close account button so I cleared my account for as much as I could. Well when I cleared the account it took a few days to process and my account was at a few cents after it went through. But now they have started this subscription service, this subscription service was never sent to me via email for approval nor was I ever asked for approval at all. I just started getting charged every month. The amount was so minuscule that I didn‚Äôt notice it till months later. So if you have a old account or starting a new one be aware of the monthly subscription that they have recently added.
title: Old users beware
developerResponse: {'id': 23761304, 'body': "We're sorry to hear that and would like the opportunity to look into this for you. When you have a chance, please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859. ", 'modified': '2021-07-05T21:54:11Z'}

review: I had nothing but great things to say about Acorns, up until this morning when I finally had to deal with customer service. They were very polite, but hold ZERO accountability for the company making a mistake and taking your money. And after discussing with them that I did not want them taking money out of my account and took the steps I needed to pause all of that MULTIPLE TIMES, they still told me there was ‚Äúnothing they could do.‚Äù But they COULD take money out of my pockets anytime they wanted. I have big payments coming out of my account today and REALLY counted on the rest of my money to get to my next paycheck. And that‚Äôs the money Acorns took from my account the last 4 days in a row. I‚Äôd advice any of you to avoid Acorns. They started off meaning very well. But once they have your money you get it back on their terms. Even if you are in a bad financial spot. Absolute shame.
title: An absolute Shame.

review: I‚Äôve been a customer since the beginning and deposited a check and Acorns froze my entire account even though they know the check is valid. It was a small check well within the terms of service and they previously accepted checks for more from the same source. The huge problem is they have horrible customer service and there is no recourse. I have requested they return the funds to the issuer of they check and they supposedly are and I guess then my account will be unlocked but what a hassle so just be warned. My account is not large but if it was it would be a huge concern that they completely lock accounts away from customers at will. (A simple action they could of taken if they had any concern at all would be to just not release the funds for that check till it properly cleared)
title: Be warned they freeze accounts for simply depositing a check

review:
After two weeks of waiting and a call to customer service, my account was still yet to be verified. Conveniently, this was all done during a period where my account was necessary for not one, but two different referral bonuses to be given to customers for signing people up! How odd of a coincidence.

Don‚Äôt fall for the referral scam - even after submitting the right documents 5+ times through both an app and browser, Acorns refused to verify it so that it wouldn‚Äôt have to give me my $600 for signing up 3 people, or my brother his $600 for signing up 3 people (one of which was me). 

It‚Äôs clear to me that this was done intentionally so that Acorns wouldn‚Äôt have to pay up their too good to be true referral program. Don‚Äôt waste your time with this app. If you want easy financial freedom, make a schedule that works for you and invest in index funds through Schwab or RobinHood.
title: Intentionally broken promo scheme
developerResponse: {'id': 24697806, 'body': "We're sorry to hear about your experience and would like another opportunity to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.", 'modified': '2021-08-24T21:30:56Z'}

review: Here is a warning for any potential new customer. I was a customer for 7 years. In order to set up a new funding account due to a bank account change, Acorns requested I upload a voided check from my new account and a copy of my last statement from my old account. I did this on 3 separate occasions. Next they sent an email stating I needed to do a three way call with my new bank to certify the new account. Keep in mind that this is after I verified my new bank and the connection to it through PLAID. I didn‚Äôt want to go any further in case they required a blood draw to check my DNA, so I requested they close my account and cut a check to the name and address in file for my account. The next day I receive an email stating ‚Äú The check has been requested and will be delivered within 3-6 weeks due to delays in the manual check process.‚Äù
title: Warning for new customers- Policies are ridiculous

review:
First off, I don‚Äôt really have much to say regarding Acorns‚Äô round up feature or it‚Äôs other investment tools. The round up was ok, might as well just get a cash back credit card at that point though. And I personally couldn‚Äôt get the chance to use the other investment tools. However, I had great difficulty when it came to closing my account. I thought it would be simple enough but they kept on billing me the subscription. There were three charges on my bank account, three months after closing my acorns profile. After the first month they sent an email saying they were sorry, but then it happened twice again afterwards. Today I reopened my account to try to remove my bank account information but the app does not let you, it only allows you to replace it with another one.
Poor service that I don‚Äôt recommend ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

review: Explain to me why someone would keep trying to pull from your account when it‚Äôs obviously empty and because there‚Äôs no cash in the account charge you $30 because they couldn‚Äôt get the $5 they wanted. They did it twice. Now I‚Äôm out $60 and the cherry on top is that they did all of this while I‚Äôd not granted them access to my account. So I‚Äôm out $60, they tried pulling from my account without permission and the only reason they even knew anything about my account to do all that was because they WOULDN‚ÄôT LET ME CANCEL IT!!!!! THEY FORCED ME TO KEEP IT OPEN SO THEY COULD YHE MONEY I DON‚ÄôT HAVE!!!! THEY TOOK FOOD OUT OF MY FAMILIES MOUTH BECAUSE NOW I‚ÄôM OVERDRAWN IN THE BANK. If I could I‚Äôd rate you zero. But alas 1 Star is as low as it‚Äôll go.

review: I‚Äôve had this app for about 3-4 months and I‚Äôve saved close to about $800. Of course, this is with Round-Ups turned on and daily investing, but it‚Äôs still insane how fast money can accumulate! You can start and stop depositing money whenever you want to with ease, and if you‚Äôre bank account gets low it‚Äôll automatically stop transferring money from your bank account until you have sufficient funds. There‚Äôs different ways to save your spare change, so you can choose whatever fits your need! If you‚Äôre looking to save money over time, then DEFINITELY make sure to download this app and start saving today!
title: Great Way To Slowly Save $$$
developerResponse: {'id': 30997581, 'body': 'Thanks for saving and investing in your future with us! Grow your oak!\n', 'modified': '2022-07-20T14:03:46Z'}

review: Not for the trickle in investor. I thought it sounded like a great idea to just let my rounded up change slowly accumulate while being invested. Sounds great right? Well while I was letting my few bucks a month slowly build up Acorn was charging me $3 a month account fee. So when I had $50 in the account Acorns was charging me effectively a 6% account fee. When I finally got to a hundred it was down to only a 3% account fee. So in the many months it took me to get to $150+ anything I gained in interest was negated by the account fees. You also cannot choose your own allocations on the $3 a month plan. You have to take their basket of funds complete and whole whether you like the way account is distributed. There are so many more flexible and cheaper alternatives out there now that I see no point in using Acorns as an investment option.
title: Better/cheaper options out there.

review: The acorns app does what it advertises. The app is consistent and I‚Äôve never run into any issues. Getting start is fast and easy. There are a couple things I would like to see. One, more of a focus on the users information. While the app is reliable sometimes there‚Äôs a lot of information presented to you on a page and your own info can get lost among the educational links or offers for other products. The second thing, would be to add a feature to their service, it would be great to have the ability to use virtual cards for online purchases. This type of thing is very valuable to folks who like to shop online but also value privacy and security.
title: Reliable

review: Reading all these negative reviews on here made me realize how delusional most of you Gen Z & millennials must be. Acorns isn‚Äôt meant to be used for making quick bucks. It‚Äôs a marathon. Unless you are swimming in over $25K, leaving money in a savings account only gets you pennies back by the end of each year. You also have to follow the trend of the markets as well. Everyone who threw in anything over $500 right before covid started were the smart ones. Acorns also makes it crazy simple when it comes to tax filings every year. Acorns is just another tool out of many tools out there. Do your due diligence, and reap the rewards.
title: Simple and clean

review: Acorns is a good app for learning the basics of investing, and the roundups makes funding your account simple and easy. Acorns has 2 issues that you should be aware of before putting your money into it. 1) if you are investing smaller amounts of money initially, the monthly fees disproportionately affect you, cutting significantly into your gains in the market. If you use it, you need to have 1000 dollars minimum in it for the fees to be competitive with other investment firms. 2) The app has a difficult time connecting with several types of credit cards, so if you‚Äôre like me and use your credit card for all purchases and pay on full at the end of the month, you‚Äôll be getting far fewer roundups than debit card users.
title: Good for beginners, need $1000 so fees make sense

review: Everytime I did a mobile deposit they locked my account and would give me an excuse why. I spent 11 hours today trying to get it unlocked and got told it is on the banks end and not ours. And I called the issuing bank and they said it is on acorns side.  I cannot access the money that has cleared and been deposited because they want to lock your account.  Just yesterday on the 21st of December they u locked my account because it was locked again for no reason and went to use my debit card this morning and my account was locked again with no explanation just well I need to wait for the internal team. But u can‚Äôt speak to them u can‚Äôt do anything and I have been stuck out of town for 11 hours because I cannot use my account. This is ridiculous and as soon as they unlock my account I am transferring everything out of there and closing it

review:

I recommend acorns to anyone and everyone, it is an easy way to save money for different small items or trips. Although It requires patience to move the balance to either your checking account or acorns checking account program, it is well worth it!
title: Savings that have really added up for me!

review:
I had Acorns for 2 years and 3 months and made almost nothing at all while I was investing significantly less money into Robinhood for less than 2 years - which, I managed myself and gained +30%.  I was not involved in options and have no trading experience at all.  I called Acorns and asked why this was happening and they could not explain.  They would not allow me to speak with a broker or trader to explain and said they would have someone call me but, that never happened.  I closed my Acorns account as I was just about to start losing what I had invested and just reopened it today (to try it again. 
 I would think that a company hired to grow my money would invest it wisely.  I‚Äôm giving Acorns another shot but, feel bad for referring so many people who have suffered the same experience as I did.  I will not refer anyone else in the near future.
title: My experience with Acorns

review: I‚Äôve used Acorn for several years anf from a financial investment does what it claims and was an innovative model from the beginning. When the message was sent I called their help desk only to be forwarded to another number which disconnected.  That happened repeatedly during business hours.  I found I was locked out of my desktop application and was able to access the account on the phone IOS.  Buried is a chat function which I was repeatedly kicked out of due to long waits.  Finally after two hours, I was able to get someone and at that point could only type:  close the account now.   Never do business with a financial institution that cannot ever answer the phone when there is a problem.

review:
So it‚Äôs great except that it takes a ridiculous amount of time to make transfers. Not just with outside banks, but from acorns checking account to invest. Also I don‚Äôt understand why the emergency fund function is there if it‚Äôs not FDIC insured as well and why can‚Äôt you transfer money from your acorn‚Äôs checking to your emergency fund. It all makes no sense.
I wish the whole operation could just use my existing bank account to track and withdraw for roundups. 
I‚Äôm still going to use it and see what happens, but there could be definite improvements. It sounds like I don‚Äôt like it at all and that‚Äôs not the case. It was easy to start and you can set things up so you can just forget it. I also like that they have early accounts for kids.
title: Love the Idea BUT‚Ä¶

review: It‚Äôs amazing that there is an app like this that exists now. Things like this really make me more sure of technology and how it can be used to help people in such tremendous ways if it is used in the right hands. I think helping people save and get started with saving is such an important lesson that, unfortunately, is not taught to the youth as much as it should be. I never learned. But with something like this I have hope I can save my money and have at least, at the very least a decent, stable future with the money I‚Äôve saved using this app. It makes you realize that a little bit really does go a long way.

review: This has been the best app for me! It works well, user friendly, explains everything. You can easily change your options and move money around and it has saved me financially so many times! review: I‚Äôd highly recommend this app to those who are new to investing and/or starting new retirement accounts. I‚Äôd suggest doing roundups and adding a multiplier. Also sometimes the referral bonuses they offered were downright amazing. Try to cancel but they say you have to verify your account with the deposits that were made into your account. Cancel account and stop investments only to then be denied cancellation again because of pending transactions.  Think it‚Äôs okay because you stopped investing only to have 2 more recurring payments come out in 1 day instead of each week.  Then be denied cancellation again because of said transactions pending.  I only have 30 bucks in this account but if you think I won‚Äôt drag them through the mud for this Ponzi scheme they better think again.

review: A few years back I used to use Acorns. I enjoyed it back then, helped me save while I was in college and learning about money. Come to find out, idk how long ago it was but Acorns switched to a paid service and started billing me without my consent $1 a month. The minute I realized this is completely deactivated my account on acorns, literally had to redownload the app. That goes to show how little I used acorns in the past few months, the fact I had to redownload the app to an investment account. Anyone who has used Acorns like me for years should go on it and make sure they are not charging you. It‚Äôs not worth it!!!!!!
title: Free service turned paid with no warning or consent

review:
First and foremost, they closed my checking account unexpectedly and without any notice. This caused a lot of inconvenience and frustration for me.
Additionally, they broke federal law by selling my personal information to third parties without my consent. This is a major breach of privacy and trust.
Furthermore, they charge a monthly fee of $3 for their service, which is not justified considering the lack of features and connectivity to other financial apps.
Their partners also have access to and rights to sell my information, which is concerning and further erodes any sense of privacy and security.
Furthermore, their customer support is non-existent. It is impossible to contact them for any issues or concerns.
To make matters worse, their service doesn't even connect to Plaid or any other financial apps, making it difficult to manage your finances in one place.
Finally, the high trading fee they charge eats up all your earnings, rendering the app essentially useless for anyone looking to grow their wealth.
In summary, I would highly discourage anyone from using the Acorns app due to their lack of transparency, poor customer service, and high fees. There are much better options out there for managing your finances.
title: Avoid Acorns: Poor Service, High Fees, and Privacy Breaches

review:
I can‚Äôt believe the returns this gem has given me in the last few months. I love this company. I have it all. review:
I‚Äôve referred 5 people to this company, two in the last month. My friends were given the directions and i was available for any questions. They didn‚Äôt have any questions and after 1 day they texted me back saying they completed the verification process. 

I didn‚Äôt see my $100 referral bonus so i inquired. The representative said everything looked good however i needed to wait until the 15th to get my bonus. 

So i called back today (15th) and one of my two referrals didn‚Äôt make an investment. All he needed to do was do a one time deposit and he didn‚Äôt know, nor asked me any questions. He just said he was finished with setting up and verifying his account. 

When i called to confirm and find out where my bonus was, the representative from acorns said my buddy needed to deposit before may 31st. He said he‚Äôd done it all so i believed him. Now we find one minor issue and i CANNOT get my bonus trying to help people and acorns as well. I‚Äôm withdrawing all my money from them and looking for a new app since acorns couldn‚Äôt give me the slightest help to give me a one day extension to get my buddy to invest $5 now. 

I‚Äôm taking my 5 referrals away from acorns and have no intention to help them i any way.
title: Horrible customer service policies

review: Signed up, but I work for a brokerage and Acorns is not currently approved.  Sadness.  If I change jobs I will try again.  Four stars because they it took me some hoop jumping to find out why my account want working.  Acorns needs to make their support more accessible.  It would have been nice to have the app notify me of the answers to my support questions.  I signed up with the app. Had trouble figuring out why my account was not working.  Tried to get support and finally tracked down a support email address outside of the app.  Which lead me to find they Acorns had responded, just not through the app.  Would have been nice to know this sooner. Thanks.

review: I‚Äôve been using Acorns for a while and it‚Äôs definitely served me well. I‚Äôd only ask the developers of the app to include proper support for iPad. I know most use the iPhone (can‚Äôt comment on other mobile os devices) but it is noted as compatible with iPad. However, this app is way old in scaling to iPad. Orientation is locked making the app only useful if you DON‚ÄôT have a keyboard. Kinda like the old apps from the 2010‚Äôs. I‚Äôm sure there‚Äôs a SWIFT expert on their app team - let‚Äôs put them to work. Yes?
title: Great product/service; the App needs a little more

review: ‚ÄúThis app is the most poorly designed app I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing. Literally nothing about this crap heap works. Add you bank? Doesn‚Äôt work. Verify your email doesn‚Äôt work? Try three times? App crashes. If this company has hired an app dev department that is this incompetent who are they hiring to manage your data and privacy? review:
So, it‚Äôs a great way to start investing. I liked the spend account until I needed a report to get a loan. (Which they told me to just screen shot) it took me three days just to them to send me a pdf of my transactions like it was a top secret document and it require management review? Y‚Äôall take a breath. 

The other thing is now I can‚Äôt use my atm card to buy anything online. It automatically declined every time. I‚Äôve had no issues with fraud or anything. 

Then there is hardly any info about the amount you can send via the ‚Äúsend a check‚Äù option. I am assuming it‚Äôs $2000 because that‚Äôs all they let me send. I guess they impose a limit, which totally get, but put that some where like, idk, on the screen that you send the check from? 

Finding a number to call requires a master‚Äôs in informatics and they were less than helpful. You have to call because sending a ‚Äúform‚Äù help request takes forever to get a response from. Maybe that has to be approved too. 

Anyway. Looking for something a little better if y‚Äôall don‚Äôt act like you got home training.
title: Thought it was cute, then it got ugly.

review: This isn't one of those applications you can review within a few days or even in months. I waited for a year, and so far it's a very consistent application that helps you save money, and grow your money in the market at the same time. I rarely use the round-up feature but it‚Äôs useful for people who would like to save money without realizing it simply by making purchases. You an also invest money at any time for as low as 5 dollars at a time. Every little bit adds up. You may not become rich in the short term, but if you're a compulsive buyer and have problems saving money this may really help out.
title: 1 + year Acorn User

review:
Got this for the round-up feature because honestly it's easier to manage even amounts of money when managing finances, and who's honestly gonna gripe about spending a few extra cents? 

The problem begins where I noticed I got hit with two fees; one for $5 and one for $6.14. Yeah apparently there's fees and subscriptions you have to pay to use Acorns, neither of which were clearly mentioned at any point in time except for additional features I had no use for.

Acorns is deceptive and doesn't say anything clearly. At some point, it just automatically subscribed me to the family package, which I'd have never done. I was under the impression from the beginning that Acorns is a free app. Instead, I was tricked into paying $11 to round up less than $5 in spare change. I basically just gave them charity. You're welcome Acorns.
title: Unclear and sneaky
developerResponse: {'id': 28738572, 'body': 'We apologize for any inconvenience. We are a subscription-based service and our plans start at $3 and $5. Additionally, you can withdraw the funds from your Invest account under "Invest for your future" > "Withdraw." If you need any assistance, please contact our support team at https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.', 'modified': '2022-03-23T12:17:54Z'}

review: By the time your change is to roll up and into your Acorns account, it is a significant amount of money/transactions and you‚Äôre seeing random pulls from your checking account. From there, the amounts that are pulled don‚Äôt match and on top of that, when you want to terminate something you can‚Äôt just discontinue the service on your own, you have to go through customer care‚Ä¶and wait and wait for a resolution - all while the account is still withdrawing money when you go through transactions. Not to mention that when you do finally get someone to help you, the funds you get returned to you aren‚Äôt even equivalent to the amount that‚Äôs in the account to begin with‚Ä¶all around, I have to say, though I was trying to have this as a nice extras account, it‚Äôs DEFINITELY not worth it and I‚Äôm glad it‚Äôs closed.
title: Unreliable and faulty

review:
I may be speaking too soon, but:
I love the concept, and was recommended this app by a friend. Not sure why, as I‚Äôve ‚Äùlost‚Äù over $45 of my investment in addition to paying a subscription fee. I wasn‚Äôt even aware of the fee until today, and for some reason was automatically signed up for the family plan ($5/month) instead of the personal (which is $3/month). I‚Äôm aware markets fluctuate, but I‚Äôve been at a constant loss since first investing a few months ago. I have a retirement account that makes profit on investments that does significantly better. I‚Äôm waiting to see if the account value will turn up before withdrawing and discontinuing use. I‚Äôll be choosing something that gives me more control over my investments in the future.

review: In December acorns had a ‚Äúrefer 4 friends get $1,000 before January . I talked to 3 representatives that assured me that I had done everything needed and that I would receive the bonus. However,  I never received it so I contacted customer service again and they told me that I wasn‚Äôt eligible because of the pending individual. I reached out to that individual and was informed that they followed every instruction in the appropriate time.  These bonus programs are scams to get others to join.  They do not pay out because they can find a loophole in their own game.  SCAM.  I‚Äôve been waiting to see if anything happens and plan to cancel as soon as I can. This platform cannot be trusted.
title: Referral program is a SCAM

review:
I used Acorns in the past and I liked it up until they starting taking money out of my account and causing me to get overdraft fees. The point is to save money and they have access to your account balances. So when I have $0 why make me pay for the -7 and the $35 over draft fee when I PAUSED it to avoid this? I‚Äôve lost more money than I‚Äôve saved at this point. This app is for rich people who always have money in their account and never lose a job to be completely honest. 

If there‚Äôs a way to get refunded for the money I‚Äôve lost that would be great but I had to close the bank that was struggling due to the overdraft fees and can no longer prove that this happened to me. I recently decided I was going to try again and low and behold another over draft. I‚Äôm over it.

Really sad because they will be scamming millions out of money with these tactics. Hope the SEC looks into it.  Very disappointing.

review:

OH, Acorns has absolutely 0 humans that will ever consider talking to you. I‚Äôve been nothing but proper and polite and have had zero human responses, just bots attempting to find which FAQ is closest to mine, and it‚Äôs not helpful in my case. 

WHATS BETTER?: set up a recurring deposit with a legitimate broker like Fidelity and Charles Schwab/TD Ameritrade and use that money for ETFs and mutual funds. At least with TDA I can talk to a broker/service agent 8a-8p instantly.

review:
I'm.56 have been self-employed most of my life. Have worked so hard always until.5 years ago been lose my money never really understanding how money works.

     Live @ Learn!!
title: Understanding finance!!!!

review: Acorns changed my life big time. I started investing with acorns when it first came out right after I graduated college. I was broke as a joke so I had very little cash flow to get into the market. This style of investing changed all of that. I was able to put the little amounts I had rounded up into a growing portfolio - at a fraction of what it would have cost to do so only a couple years prior. That little amount of money still grows. I recommend the reoccurring transfers, and the 10x multiplier. It‚Äôs super saving to invest and change your financial situation around, and Acorns is the way to do it. I love Acorns!!!!

In the end, I feel exhausted and ask them to close my account. Their response is ‚Äú we are not able to close it because your account is suspended.‚Äù

ACORNSü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I hate to be a negative person because I‚Äôm not but I‚Äôm sure this company banks thousands and thousands of dollars off people like me. Absolutely ridiculous.

If Acorns Spend can beef up it‚Äôs offerings by adding support for basic budget tools and ways to organize and save money (without investing into the market) I may be enticed to use it as my main bank. review: They require a medallion signature guarantee to transfer your money to a different institution. Nobody anywhere near me offers that service so I had to just accept the IRS penalty for an early withdrawal. Acorns was no help in finding a company that would offer an MSG either. After withdrawing the money from my IRA, I still couldn‚Äôt close my account because even though Acorns said they would withdraw the full amount, they left a little over $3 in the account. Acorns won‚Äôt let you withdraw less than $5, so now I have to add money into my account just so I can withdraw the full amount again and close my account to avoid the subscription fee of $3 which is almost the value of my entire account at this point. title: I love my Acorn!

review:
Setup account. Single checking account, single card. Week later I see mysterious round-ups for accounts other than that I setup. Seems they decided hey, these other accounts have his name on them too - let‚Äôs round up on all of them! This was not noted anywhere in the sign up process. Very shady. After trying to get an understanding from the sixth support agent, I finally asked to just close my account. Bonus: they sent me an email hey we closed it like you wanted. Click here to cancel your subscription because we are still going to charge you. Click the link? Great idea. Resolved to a page that says sorry. Your account is closed. Nothing we can do unless you want to reopen an account. 
Completely shady. Do not recommend using this service.
title: Violates PCI-DSS

review:
My bank account was charged $30 by acorns, assuming it was the round ups I didn‚Äôt look into it. Well I checked my investments and there‚Äôs only $5 to show for. I reached out to customer support to try and get an understanding of what was happening on a Friday, said it would be a business day before I would be assigned someone to help with my situation, so I waited until Monday. Monday came around, I finally received an email around afternoon asking for a picture of the bank statement, so I sent one. After that, I got no reply. Not even a confirmation that they have received the info and are looking into what happened. It is now Tuesday afternoon, and still no reply. 
I would expect a company that handles people‚Äôs money and investments would handle these situations swiftly and appropriately.
title: Unapproved transactions, bad customer service
developerResponse: {'id': 21503139, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback and understand your frustration. We want to make sure you receive the assistance you receive. Please contact our team at (855) 739-2859 and a member of our team will assess the matter further. ', 'modified': '2021-03-08T05:09:54Z'}

review: I love this app. I read about it in the NYT last year. I was intrigued. Could it be that simple? Yes!!!!! I have a number of investments and Acorn's returns are on par with my major accounts. It is so, so easy to save this way. I wish this app had been around 30 years ago when I had to learn the hard way to do what you guys make so simple. I have even decided to make Acorns a bigger part of my portfolio because it's fun, professional and profitable. Keep up the good fight to get every kid rounding up on their purchases. Compounding is not an urban legend! üòÄ
title: So simple

review: I created my account two months ago, everything was fine, the account was verified and approved, I invited friends and their accounts were verified and approved, but when I started asking about the promised bonus (when you invite friends..), the problems started.  account is blocked.  every day I call and write to Acorns, I provide all the information that they ask to confirm, we arrange conference calls with my bank and an Acorns employee tells me that everything is fine and all the information has been received, the next day I receive a letter from another Acorns employee with the same  requiring me to provide information.  so this week , every new day I have to provide the same thing, my account is still blocked
title: Not recommended!

review: Terrible company. The company does not care to actually help you. In my instance the support team refused to assist with the issue I was having with the referral bonus. All I got was copy pasted guidelines and terms. Getting the issue escalated was a problem. When the escalations team finally contacted me by phone they were unable to ‚Äúrecode‚Äù the system after the referral has been attempted (how the agent stated it.) I should have had 3 successful referrals. But they counted 0 of them. Basically they don‚Äôt care about your referral bonuses. They just want to get people on board. My best recommendation is don‚Äôt trust anything they say and ALWAYS read the fine print. To conclude they are just terrible with customer service and I will not recommend any of my friends to use their app.
title: Terrible company
developerResponse: {'id': 26458118, 'body': "We're sorry to hear that. If you have any questions, please contact us at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n", 'modified': '2021-11-24T15:59:45Z'}

review:
This is a banking/investment group that allows the average person like myself to not only save money and have a checking/debit account, but it also gives us the opportunity to invest in our future with the stock market. 
Anyone can invest in the market with as little as $5 and set up a reoccurring auto debit. You can set up your direct deposit and use the really seriously cool debit card they give you. You‚Äôll be the man when you break out this paper weight for a debit card. I wholeheartedly recommend this app.
title: Great app

review: They have weekly promotions that pursue you to believe they will send you money for referrals. For the past 3 weeks I have been referring people to acorn. First week was $1200 if you refer 5 people and last week was $1100 if you refer 4 people. I only had 2 peoples account been complete so far. I have called multiple times and made sure each account was verified. They give you additional 14 days after the promotion but I am still seeing how there accounts are getting processed and not willing to meet the deadline (14 days) some of the people I refer has money in there bank account to transfer to acorn. Acorn is taking its time for me to miss out on the promotion which is unfair so me and my team will use others apps that provide the same thing‚ÄºÔ∏è
title: Weekly Promotions

review: I‚Äôve been a member for 6 years, I round up (x 3) each time I use my debit card and deposit $20/month.  In 6 years I have deposited approximately $7,500 but my account value is over $10,000 (a 33% gain)!  Not saying this would be the norm for everyone but you will make more money in an Acorns account than you would in a traditional savings account. Even at a 1% gain, you are making 2-4 times what you would in a traditional savings account.  It‚Äôs a no-brainer and a great way to invest for beginners.  I recommend this app to everyone!!
title: Free Money!!

review:
Simply put the app is okay. It does most of what you would expect, great for long term saving and with innovative investment portfolio options. However this is an issue that seems most personal to me, i love the round up feature but my online banking seems to lock for suspicious activity everytime i login with my bank through the app and although i have it set to automatically roundup it never seems to do it and has many transactions missing when i do it manually. 

Overall if you have a bank account that you can keep from locking up this is a great app and an easy way to passively invest for the future.
title: It‚Äôs okay

review: This company cares about its customers. I think the best business decision is one that benefits the customers AND the business. Acorns does this. They recently had to raise their prices a bit, which is normal as companies grow. But they allowed people who may be struggling to say at the only subscription cost. Every other company just raises their prices and if you can‚Äôt afford it, too bad. Business need to grow, but Acorns isn‚Äôt trying to take money from the people who don‚Äôt have much of it. So you can trust Acorns with you money.
title: Good company

review: Acorns is always sending offers out to invite friends and they will deposit money into your account if you do so. I was supposed to get $350 if I invited 2 people to join and deposit their first five dollars into their account. They give you a short time frame to do so, so I got my daughter and her boyfriend to do it. For some reason they could not verify my daughters credit union‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.she put in all of her information correctly, but just kept receiving a message from Acorns stating that ‚Äúverification processing ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.of course now it is past the due date that I needed for me to get paid. We contacted Acorns and they were no help. So they get 2 new members to Acorns, but I am not rewarded with my money that they are supposed to pay me. It‚Äôs not right.
title: Friends invites NOT paid out!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 31996620, 'body': 'We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2022-09-13T14:28:39Z'}

review: It‚Äôs worth the time to set this up, as it slowly builds up, without one feeling the burden of money being saved rather than used. I especially like the link the credit card part, where it rounds up to a dollar to put it into your savings. I recommend the most aggressive/ risky account if you are looking to save long term. The $1 per month subscription is so worth it. I‚Äôve already saved $800 just by starting with $100, putting $10 a week, and rounding up my credit card.  Highly recommend this app!
title: Every penny adds up.

review:
After finding out that you will make very very little money on your investment (think less then $1 in over a month), I withdrew my money and deleted the app. Come to find out that even though I had no money invested and didn‚Äôt even have the app anymore, they continued to remove money from my checking account as a ‚Äúservice fee‚Äù. Huh?  Service for what? Not using your app??

Turns out I actually lost money on this app because they didn‚Äôt even tell me they were taking money from my account, hoping, I would imagine, that I wouldn‚Äôt notice. Well, I‚Äôm sorry but I did. 

Now they refuse to return the money they stole from me. Months after stealing money from me on the 17th of every month and nothing to show for it. 

How much money, you might ask?  Only a few months at $1.00 per month. Sure it‚Äôs not a lot of money but had I not noticed, they would be stealing from me forever. And is your reputation worth the less then $5.00 I asked to be refunded?  Apparently not because they said NO to my refund request. 

Go elsewhere to invest. Customer service is definitely NOT a priority to this company.
title: Watch Out
developerResponse: {'id': 24055985, 'body': 'We are very sorry to hear about your experience. There is a monthly subscription for all open accounts. If you need any assistance, please contact us at:  https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.', 'modified': '2021-07-21T18:28:23Z'}

review: I downloaded this app to invest extra change but once I realized that I had a bank service already doing that for me, I deleted the app mid-setup thinking that would be the end of it but acorns still charged me (a deposit to check my bank account) somehow without my bank information??? I don‚Äôt know how that works, maybe I clicked an auto-fill option for my routing and savings account without realizing it or remembering? Tbh I think that‚Äôs a little fishy. But I did call support and they completely ended the account so that‚Äôs good. I don‚Äôt know what to think about that so take from this what you will lol.
title: Charged After Incomplete Setup?

review: Although acorns will not make you money as fast as educated stock picks, it will make you money over time. This is a great tool for the first time investor, I currently use it as a secondary (soon to be tertiary account) and am about to start a shared account with my girlfriend to begin building wealth for my future. If you want to have an extra 100,000 sitting around when it comes time to retire get this app and use your debit card as your normally do. You won‚Äôt even notice the money leaving your account. I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough.
title: The best automatic investing tool there is

review: I would love to come back and change this review later, but as it has been so far banking with Acorns has been nothing but a nightmare. My direct deposit request into acorns was not accepted, having two of my checks mailed out until we manually accepted it on Acorns side. Secondly, the metal card is nice but when it chips in the corner they have to issue you a new one, and they deactivate your current one immediately. Giving you no way to access your funds until the new card arrives, which takes 10 business days. They give you the option to transfer to your other bank, but that takes 3 business days. I switched from Chase bank because I really wanted to give Acorns a try, now i‚Äôm regretting my decision to switch and contemplating switching back.
title: Still too new

review: I‚Äôm a fan, I‚Äôve been with Acorns since 2017. Mice to have a separate institution to keep some money with. I‚Äôd recommend putting even 20 or so in to start since round-ups alone can take some time to grow. Big events/emergencies where you might need to cash out happen, so plan for some time to sell if you can. Saved me when I had some unexpected bills. You can also toggle your portfolios to avoid investing in less-than-sustainable companies and divest from nasty nasty parts of capitalism.
title: Great way to squirrel away some savings

review:
It does what it‚Äôs supposed to, ie; easy investing. However, it takes 9-13 business days to transfer money from acorns later or invest into your non acorns bank account. And there is no option to transfer your acorns later/invest money into your acorns bank account.  In this day of instant everything, 7-13 days to transfer money is some blatant bull.
The ‚Äúround up‚Äù feature also doesn‚Äôt work instantly. Say you spent 1.98, and 2 cents goes into your acorns account? Nope. It remembers that 2 cents, and adds up all those 2 cents until it‚Äôs 5$ and THEN removes it from your account. Which makes tracking your money more difficult. Overall, could be impressive, but is instead lackluster
title: Meh

review: I am pretty terrible at saving money. Even if money is automatically taken into my savings account, I know there is extra money that I can transfer immediately. With acorns it‚Äôs like I have to ask myself ‚Äúhow bad do you need this money‚Äù and ‚Äúcan it wait a week?‚Äù If it can wait a week, you probably don‚Äôt need it. It takes 5-7 days to get that money transferred. It is perfect for saving money and using that saved money on something important to you and yours. I love this service. Thank you acorns
title: Great for people like me.
developerResponse: {'id': 25775925, 'body': 'Thanks for being an investor with us! Grow your oak!\n', 'modified': '2021-10-19T17:03:10Z'}

review: I have had Acorns for years and it‚Äôs been great as long as your bank account works well with Acorns but when it doesn‚Äôt, it‚Äôs very problematic. I need to pull the money out and I can‚Äôt because it wants to verify my account so I cant link it to another account until I verify my old account. I have called numerous times and I am on hold for longer than the recording states. I‚Äôll keep trying to contact someone.

review: I don‚Äôt have kids, will never have kids, and really want you to stop sending me marketing about planning for my family - including every time I open the app. Probably sounds minor to lots of people, but this is a growing irritation for me. The constant shakedown for additional subscription fees for something I will NEVER use (while also regularly asking me to review the services I do use - and have previously reviewed) isn‚Äôt a way to keep subscribers. Maybe you need to learn more about your subscribers beyond a mailing address and checking account number?
title: Needs kid/family OPT-OUT

review: I starting my acorns later (Roth ira retirement) about 2 years ago and love it. Was able to select how aggressive I wanted my portfolio then it just took off. I don‚Äôt put anywhere near max into it but it is up around 42% and after only 2 years that‚Äôs been a pretty great return. Worth the 1$ a month for the next 50+ years already üëçüòÇ. Honestly tho easy to forget about which is perfect and very easy to check up on and the invest account is also a great way to save.
title: Great for beginners and anyone that wants easy investing.

review: This app is purely and should only be an investing app for yourself. I have been trying out the bank feature with Acorns and it is horrible. It is a horrible experience to have to constantly call to unlock your card because the bank is ‚Äúpreventing fraud ‚Äú even thought I primarily use Face ID to purchase most things. There is a weekly limit of 500 dollars for Zelle as it is out of network. Calling support is a nightmare as no body is helpful and you must find out how to do it anything on your own. title: Invest only.

review: I had the app years ago, and none of my cards were eligible for round ups, so I deleted it. Now they started charging me $3 / month as a subscription. They charged it to my checking account as ‚ÄúSubscription‚Äù rather than ‚ÄúAcorns‚Äù, so I had to call my bank to find out where it was even coming from. Now I can‚Äôt even log in to the app. It was saying my old password was wrong, so I clicked ‚Äúforgot password‚Äù and changed it. Now it just says ‚Äúsomething went wrong, try again later‚Äù for days now. Cool, can‚Äôt get into my account. Then I called customer service and proceeded to wait over an hour after I was told the estimated wait time was 5 minutes. Do better and stop taking my money.
title: Shady business and the worst customer service
developerResponse: {'id': 26741402, 'body': 'We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to look into this for you. Please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.\n', 'modified': '2021-12-09T16:45:27Z'}

review:
The entire idea of Acorns is that is should be light...almost unnoticeable.  

In their quest to increase revenue and profits, they fail miserably at letting you forget about them. 

They remind you DAILY and push you to do more, earn more, refer friends, use partner links (which pay you AND them)....incessant. 

After about 2 years using the service, I‚Äôm filing my taxes and HOLY COW was the tax document they provided less than helpful.  It met federal standards but basically don‚Äôt ever withdraw $$ from your account, especially if it has been there for less than 1 year (which I did twice due to COVID19 emergencies).  

If they would lay off and truly let me forget they existed...all while quietly taking pennies here and there...fantastic. 

Current management, however, is PUSHY to customers.  Poking you in your shoulder every day or 2....Hey, wanna invest in this?  Hey, did you know you get a buck if you use XYZ service?  Hey, did you remember to send us more $$?  No??  Wanna???  

I like the idea (Digit does similar, and I‚Äôm a fan) but I‚Äôm this close to dumping Acorns.
title: FAR Too Pushy ‚Äî INVEST MORE!!  INVITE FRIENDS!!  Cult.

review: The app was great while I used it, only complaint I had was they withdrew to much money into my spend smarter account and I got penalized for it by my bank. I would‚Äôve rated it 4 stars if it wasn‚Äôt for them reopening my account after I was emailed they would close and delete my account after a few days after I requested to delete it. It‚Äôs been a few weeks since then I looked into my statements and saw they started to withdraw from my account again? Other than that the app was great but they‚Äôre very sneaky. The worse part is they won‚Äôt let me cancel my account. Every time I try they say something went wrong try again later. I‚Äôve tried with my data, wifi, my friends phone and my laptop but the same thing keeps popping up.
title: Reopened my account without my approval

review: I used this app several years ago and it was okay, however I could never get the round-ups to work despite the ‚Äúhelp‚Äù from their customer service. I ended up deleting my account. well a couple months ago I decided to give it a go again and went to reconnect my account. What a nightmare. I don‚Äôt know how many times I tried to reopen, how many emails sent to customer service (and every time someone would reply that my account is being reopened and it‚Äôll take 1-2 business days, yet it would NEVER actually open). It FINALLY got reopened (after I called several times to talk to a supervisor and waited on hold for 30+ min). I got so fed up I ended up deleting my account again. Seriously awful customer service and their app is totally screwed up. I wasted so much time!
title: Awful

review: Allows me to connect to the market easily and is a fantastic learning tool. I was able to sign up and make my first investment in less than 20 minutes. The app is amazing for beginner investors and long term investments. The app takes your investments and spreads them out into a personalized portfolio and can divvy them up across over 7000 stocks and bond. It also allows you access to an awesome optional bitcoin share which is also personalized into your portfolio to fit your limitations and your goals. 100% recommend
title: Magnificent App

I love the different portfolios it‚Äôs has, from aggressive (which is not that aggressive) to basic investing.   Like any investment there‚Äôs always a risk, but this app has gotten me pretty good interest return, wayyyyyy better than any savings acct.   just invest,  don‚Äôt touch it, & ur money will grow.  Trust the numbers.  Very Ez app to understand.   Btw, u can take ur money out just as ez, 3 business days for it to transfer to ur bank.
title: I love this app
developerResponse: {'id': 27774198, 'body': 'Thanks for saving and investing in your future with us! Grow your oak!\n', 'modified': '2022-01-31T23:26:08Z'}

review: I‚Äôve had my acorns account since 2017 and had been making a nice little savings account with it.  Unfortunately, last year I had the worst experiences with acorns.  I had my account hacked twice in a matter of 2-3 weeks. The hackers tried adding a new bank and tried to change the email address on file. At this point I reached out to customer care and was told to just change my password.  I asked if there had been any breaches and was given no information on that. Finally I had to change my email, remove my bank account, and change my password multiple times.  Ive recently gone in to withdraw my funds, which will take almost a week to be deposited to my bank. And now cannot get a clear answer on how to close my accounts.
title: It WAS great at first...

review: I think Acorns is a great app, if they would fix their time frames and would also have better access to assist. The reasons I say these things are because I had invested over $200 to which they built from. However when it came time to pull the money from the account, it made me wait a whole week before I could even receive a penny. As well as the verification process being extremely tedious. Now as far as Customer Service, they are literally just there to get your hopes up. They don‚Äôt assist you with with simple tasks like verifying a small deposit being sent to your account which alone takes 3 days on its own. But I have yet to speak to an English speaking employee, overall the app is amateur. Needs to be fixed.
title: Unhelpful; Time consuming

review:
I‚Äôm a noob and don‚Äôt know anything about investing. I‚Äôm also don‚Äôt make enough to invest elsewhere at the moment. However, the options to add my ‚Äúspare change‚Äù is genius. It doesn‚Äôt seem like much, but a few bucks being saved is better than spending it elsewhere. 

I used to carry cash but just like the ease of using a card. Change was great because at the end of the month, I had an extra $20 bucks to throw into my savings account. 

Now, I can still do just that! BUT DIGITALLY. 

Great for those who are beginners and just want to spare your change and forget about it. What‚Äôs nice too is the option to do it automatically or manually. 

I personally prefer the choice of manually, but those who are like I said ‚Äúforget it and move on‚Äù - it‚Äôs perfect! 

Interface of this app is also easy to use. Not too overwhelming and confusing. 

5/5‚≠êÔ∏è
title: Great  for Beginners!

review:
Hi,

I started using Acorns in 2018 as a naive student trying to get ahead in the investing game. After realizing this entire app is pointless when you open a brokerage that allows you to invest in index funds periodically, i withdrew all of my money and have not opened the app since early 2019. It is now late November of 2022, also 4 years later, and I noticed that they have started secretly charging me 1 dollar a month for a new subscription service "assist" that they started in June of 2022. This is very shady behavior, I have not used the app since 2019. I believe the company is desperate for funds considering the state of the stock market, and they are trying to sneak customer funds out from under their noses. I can only imagine how many others are being taken advantage of this like I have. While $1 a month is not a lot, it is the principle of charging a customer after they have not used your services in 4 years. This app is trash, get a brokerage and close this app to get out of this shady, sly companies grasp.

Thank you and I hope you take my advice,

Pierce
title: Criminal App, secret charges years after deactivating account

review:
Here are some of the issues I was facing: 

My automatic roundup settings were automatically being toggled off - on their own - without any prompting from me. 

My investment account was closed by request - problem is I didn‚Äôt request it to be closed. 

Milestones weren‚Äôt recording even after money was withdrawn from my Checking account after 2-3 days and  shown in app. 

And lastly‚Ä¶.the money I had invested and it‚Äôs earnings were withdrawn‚Ä¶apparently by me‚Ä¶and set to go back into my bank account. Except‚Ä¶I didn‚Äôt request my balance to be withdrawn. 

So‚Ä¶I just decided to call it quits. When you‚Äôre dealing with money - the app needs to work and function as it‚Äôs supposed to. Any hiccups like this - it doesn‚Äôt I still confidence. 

And no‚Ä¶it isn‚Äôt user error. As it was happening - I would show it to my husband who owns an IT company and who also has acorns (he uses it successfully - and has never had any issues with it.) says - yeah something is wrong. He was the one who helped me set it up in the first place.
title: Lots of technical issues

review: This app really disappoints me because I am 15, turning 16 and about to get a job and need somewhere to put my left over change. Acorns seems like an extremely helpful app, but they for some ungodly reason decided to add an age restriction. This app probably would have 25% more people in it if their age restriction wasn‚Äôt a thing. At least lower it if possible. The age for getting a job is 15 and above. I‚Äôve seen manny apps like this (that I don‚Äôt trust) not have age restrictions. So, if you can listen to us people that are under 18 and trying to make money, please uplift the age restriction or better yet just lower it. I know it isn‚Äôt easy to do so, but just keep this review in mind and I will definitely use this app and manny people my age will to. Have a nice day
title: Age

review:
I‚Äôve tried three times to set up an account now. All three times after I verify my bank, it prompts me to log in again. Okay, cool, a lot of apps do this once you complete setup. Once I log in, though, it tells me to ‚Äúlog in using the app for the best experience‚Äù. The issue is, I‚Äôm already in the app, trying to log in. If I force close the app or log out, it takes me through setting up my account again from the beginning.

At least the setup process is quick and painless. It would just be a little more painless if I didn‚Äôt have to do it three times just to loop back around to do it again. For that, I can give a bonus star.
