review: App is awesome & makes it easier to save but Each time I clicked on my portfolio in the Invest page the app freezes doesn‚Äôt even take me to the following page where I can see whats in the portfolio and/or where I can change my portfolio I have to force close the app in order to use the app again but everytime I click on the portfolio it just freezes again I have to use the acorns website to view that information I‚Äôm using the iPhone 13 Pro Max on iOS 16.0.2
title: Freezes

review:
I was extremely happy with Acorns for the first few years I used it. Saving money without really trying was AWESOME!

Fast forward to December 2022. My husband lost his wallet earlier in the year and we had to close and switch many accounts. I needed to get at some of the money in my Acorns account, so I contacted customer service about making that happen. After sending numerous documents to verify my identity, initiating a three way call with Acorns and my bank, and not hearing back from my email inquiries for a week most times, I am STILL trying to get at my money!

I love the idea of this app...when you have no complications! I'll be looking for a new way to invest if this keeps up.
title: Seriously slow customer service and communication

review:
I have been using Acorns for well over a year now. It was very easy to start a SEP -IRA , something I probably would not have done otherwise. I also like the round up deposit, which you can double, triple or more which goes into my personal savings. It adds up and comes in handy, it‚Äôs automatic savings at a few dollars a day. I also set up an account for my son. 
  Sure, it costs $5 a month. But it‚Äôs well worth it because it‚Äôs easy and otherwise I would not save at all.
title: Great way to save.
developerResponse: {'id': 30191328, 'body': 'Thanks for saving and investing in your future with us! Grow your oak!\n', 'modified': '2022-06-06T13:39:53Z'}

review:
I use Acorns like a savings account. I love that I can set it up to take a certain amount from my bank account every week. So every Friday, they take $50 out of my bank account and put it in my acorns account. I can change the amount anytime. 

I also have round ups turned on. This is also a great way to sneak in money to your acorns account. Before you know it, you will have a lot of money saved up! Acorns works great for me as a savings account!

I used to have all of my acorns money in bonds. I recently changed it to all stocks. I have made more money by doing this. Of course, there‚Äôs more of a risk also. The bigger the risk, the bigger the gain. 

Acorns always has some sort of deal going on for referrals. I participated in one. I was able to get 3 people to sign up for Acorns, and Acorns thanked me with a $300 deposit into my Acorns account. Thank you, Acorns!
title: Refer some peeps
developerResponse: {'id': 27360924, 'body': "Thanks for saving and investing in you and your family's future with us! Grow your oak!\n", 'modified': '2022-01-11T01:58:50Z'}

review: I love this platform, and its app that comes with it. It has helped me manage my money better and save for the future. I use my iPad each and every day and would love to have a dedicated iPad app that works well in order to manage my money and track my investments. Overall it is a great app and experience!

I‚Äôm so close to closing my spend account and transferring my investments elsewhere. Acorns spends only lets me withdraw money from an atm and it maxes out at $400 per day. Please call us at (855) 739-2859 and a member of our team will investigate further.", 'modified': '2021-03-08T08:18:56Z'}

review:
Pleased with how simple and seamless acorns app works. Most everything is at your fingertips. Just need to publish the toll free customer service number in addition to the email option. 

The service I got by rep Richard was great. He assisted in resetting my PIN that I forgot. Lest you speak to a customer rep like Richard, I‚Äôd still be trying to navigate the reset PIN screen. I googled the customer service # then got a knowledgeable and personable Richard who explained FORGOTTEN PIN can‚Äôt be reset by user. That needs to be made clear on the site. 

Richard likely saved this acorns acct with his professionalism in handling the confusion. The non publishing of a toll free customer services number, and clarity on PIN reset are unforced errors on acorns that people dealing with money have little time or patience. Seems arguably disingenuous from a consumer perspective. 

That said I really do like the Acorns platform and plan to learn more about the app and its value. Make those corrections and you guys are solid to me. Great concept!

review:
It seems like a cool app where you can just round up investments over time, but then they sneakily hide a $3/month subscription fee.

I called back again and was told there was nothing I can do. So basically they just wanted me and my friends to remain on their payroll during this time so that they could make an extra $15 off of all of us. Don‚Äôt use this app
title: Terrible and predatory app

review: I was enjoying my acorns account knowing well that it wasn‚Äôt a powerful banking app. I used it as intended as a secondary ‚Äúsave/invest‚Äù account. While using their checking account service, there was an issue about unusual transfer activity. After confirming that I authorize this activity, they continue to keep my account locked and my money frozen. After three business days of calls and emails back-and-forth my account is still locked with no real explanation as to why. They just continue to tell me to be patient for three business days? It‚Äôs negligent money handling, it‚Äôs suspicious, and it‚Äôs are disgraceful customer service. I am disappointed, and even considering closing all three of my accounts with acorns.
title: CUSTOMER SUPPORT IS AWFUL!

review: This app is such a scam. You have to pay for a subscription and at the end of the day you‚Äôre not really getting any benefit out of it. It was almost impossible for me to close the account it never would let me after trying countless times and I reached out to technical services and emailed with the company and they would not allow me to close the account unless all of the money was removed and even after I removed my money from it it still wouldn‚Äôt let me close it so I kept getting charged despite trying to cancel the account. do not waste your time and money. you‚Äôre better off just taking money out of your account and putting it into a savings account every week.
title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY

review:
I had a question on the daily balance activity (why it currently lags market performance by a day when it used to be in near real-time). Went through the automated system, then got to a chat with a live agent. Agent had no answers at all, and even tried to offer canned answers to wholly unrelated questions as a way to get me to drop off. It worked - I was so frustrated with the discussion that I left the chat. 

If you‚Äôre looking for even an iota of support from this company, you probably aren‚Äôt going to get it. I always use quality of support/customer interaction as a proxy for overall company quality - and this was bad bad bad. So don‚Äôt invest any significant sums with this app (I certainly don‚Äôt, and never will).
title: App is OK - Support is TERRIBLE

review:
I had about $20 left in my account, 1 day away from my paycheck arriving. I always keep a balance above $20, because I have automatic $5 weekly deposits, and round ups from acorn. 

Unfortunately, acorns made a real big mistake and took the $5 weekly deposit, and then they took a double $7 roundup from my account, and on top of that made a mistake where I was charged the $3 monthly fee twice. As a result, I ended up with a -$5 balance in my bank account, and as a result was charged a $25 over draft fee. 

I have had my account for 5 months, and have collected almost $300 in my account which is great money to be taken out and invested at age 18, but the Index stock hasn‚Äôt even made me that $25 that I am now being charged by my bank. 

Overall, I am incredibly disappointed, and had no warning or no possible reason to anticipate and extra $10 taken from my account, and being charged a $25 overdraft fee as a result. I would love for acorns to make that up to me, because overall, it is very disappointing. It‚Äôs a really good app, but this is just an awful experience!

I have had an issue with their referral program and have been trying to talk to someone on the phone about my issues. At the end of this experience I was left without a clear picture of why my 5 referrals wouldn‚Äôt qualify me for any of their promos even after all relevant info had been accepted from my referrals. Nor was I contacted on the phone after I was guaranteed I would be, twice. 

This company is by far the most expensive option for micro investment, so if you are going to pay for a service where it feels like you can‚Äôt interact with a human then go the cheap route and use a different platform. 

And to Acorns directly, no need to respond to this as I have already closed my account and also informed my referrals to close their accounts. Your practices have left me feeling very unconfident in your handling of all of our personal info. 

Again any service you use, App Store peruser, will be better than this. Don‚Äôt settle for a flashy UI, that‚Äôs all I feel like it has.
title: Not the platform you are looking for if you want quality customer service.

review:
I like the idea of Acorns. The round up feature is what really sets it apart from all of the other robo-advisor platforms. 

However, the main issue that I have is that I cannot link my CapitalOne credit card on Acorns. I believe this is an issue with CapitalOnes not allowing third party access, thus it is impossible to add on Acorns. This is the card I use the most (because of excellent rewards) and the fact that I cannot use it for Acorns is a drag. 

Yes, I can manually count and add ‚Äúspare change‚Äù total but that kind of defeats the purpose of the round up feature. 

If this is ever fixed, I would love this app even more and give it 4-stars. 

Now, if we had an option to customize our allocations, like for example 50% VOO, 50% VTI, that would make it a 5-star app for me. Until then, 3-stars unfortunately.

review:

review:

PLEASE DO NOT USE THIS APP. 

The app seems to work great until you try and withdraw money. Since then I have unable to link the account BUT IT STILL WITHDRAWS $50 A MONTH FROM IT. So basically it will take my money, but it won‚Äôt let me ‚Äúround up‚Äù or withdraw anything from my acorns account. Since my account isn‚Äôt linked I don‚Äôt get any of the benefits on shopping. It also started charging $3 a month to have the account. And I can‚Äôt close the account because I can‚Äôt link it to a bank account. There is also no customer service except a chat box with a computer which as been absolutely useless.

review: The app does as advertised. But when I comes to withdrawing your money this app can take nearly TWO weeks once the withdrawal process starts for you to get your money! This delay in getting my funds was na major inconvenience when I had an emergency and needed a bit of cash. There‚Äôs absolutely no excuse when similar apps can get your funds when requested fast when needed. For this reason I give one star because taking over two weeks for funds to process when withdrawn makes this app useless for access to money for unforeseen events or emergencies.
title: Over two weeks to withdraw money
developerResponse: {'id': 26458108, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback. Sell orders (i.e. withdrawal requests) placed before 11am PST on a market day typically will be processed the same day. If your request was made after 11am PST on a market day, Acorns will typically sell shares the following market day. It can take 3-6 business days for withdrawals to fully reflect on your checking account. This time period accommodates withdrawal and bank processing timelines as well as bank policies. You can track the status of the transfer within the Recent Activity section of the account.', 'modified': '2021-11-24T15:58:41Z'}

Love this app, but I wish there were more ethical investing options....like investing vegan friendly, environmentally friendly, only in BIPOC owned businesses, only small businesses, women owned businesses.....if those options were avail I would give this app 6/5......but will resort to 3/5 bc it‚Äôs that disappointing that those kinds of ethical portfolio options aren‚Äôt available. ALSO when the market is down, your account are depressing. :/ I am fearing that the market will stay down and this will have been a poor decision, I hope things look up soon.
title: Love this app...but!

review:
The amount of time it takes to withdraw money (7 days and counting) means I can never use it as a savings account. This is - deal breaker for me. 

Additionally, the alleged reason it takes so long is either poorly explained or a half truth but ‚Äúselling your shares‚Äù obviously doesn‚Äôt take 3 to 6 days as they advertise. Nor should it disappear from my acorn on Monday but still not be in my bank account going into Thursday. Where is the money?

So I did 2 stars. Not because it is a bad app, but because it positions itself like a savings account with market returns when really it‚Äôs more like a 401K with less options.
title: Withdrawal Experience Is A Deal Breaker
developerResponse: {'id': 25573381, 'body': 'We apologize for any inconvenience our withdrawal processing times may have caused. All withdrawals take 3-6 business days to transfer to your connected primary checking account because there is a mandatory 2-day settlement period. The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) mandates this period when buying or selling shares in Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs). It‚Äôs referred to as Regular Way Settlement. Once this period expires, Acorns initiates a draft into your checking account. If you do not receive the funds for your withdrawal within 6 business days, please contact our support team at: https://help.acorns.com/contact or by phone at (855) 739-2859.', 'modified': '2021-10-08T13:44:37Z'}

review:
This app/investment strategy is low and slow, don‚Äôt expect to make a ton of money over night. 

Great for beginners and investors who want a more hands off approach. Round ups and recurring is the best way to go over time but you can turn them off whenever you like and just do one time transfers. Found money is also cool if you do a lot of online shopping, just click on the retailer in the app and make your purchase and you get 1-10% cAsh back deposited into invest account.

You don‚Äôt pick your stocks like Robinhood you pick your risk profile (conservative, moderate, aggressive)and the app invests in etfs for you. Either way you go it‚Äôs fairly diversified/safe. 

$1 a month for invest only, $3 for invest, Roth IRA and checking account, $5 for all of the above plus investment accounts for minors(unlimited)

review: I‚Äôm 25 now, and have been using acorns for about 5 years. It‚Äôs a stable, versatile and user friendly platform. review:
For a $3 subscription I got absolutely nothing. 

1. The chrome extension feature doesn‚Äôt work at all and when it works, I get like 15 cents on ny cash backs. While other extensions like Rakuten gives me $40 sometimes on a 10% cash back. 

2. There are tons of apps that offer simple no fees banking like Cash App, Current, Albert‚Ä¶ frankly any of them works just as great. 

3. OMG the invest portion is the most idiotically thing I‚Äôve ever experienced. Initially a few months ago when I first signed up, I thought there is an actual good algorithm to pick stocks and invest. But the reality is they are just buying a combination of bad ETFs. I can just do it myself and frankly, it might be even better because I get more flexible selling-and-buying turnaround time. As for performance, I lost 14.3% since the beginning of the year and SPY lost 14%. So you get the same result by auto invest SPY with a 0 commission brokerage app. 

I really made a terrible decision by locking myself on Acorns and paid 6 months of subscription for nothing.

review: This app is the coolest easiest most effortless way to save back some cash for a rainy day jus using my spare change and a $5 reoccurring end of the month each month deposit I have unknowingly saved over $100 and foreal didn‚Äôt Evan do anything but forget about the app they do all the work for you Very awesome app it‚Äôs a must have just wish I would have discovered it about 10 years ago in my 20‚Äôs:):):):)

review:
I have been an Acorns user for years now so I felt I‚Äôd share my experience ‚Äî Acorns has an amazingly simple platform to use and is probably the best finance-app out there for individuals who just need something to passively save $ in. Set it and forget it, and it will grow.

If you have any real test for investing, it‚Äôs not built for that. You have very limited options on what you can invest in, the portfolios they choose may not be something you would want to invest in, and there‚Äôs no real transparency on that end.

It‚Äôs also pretty difficult to find where it calculates your true growth vs. the amount you have invested into it, which I don‚Äôt particularly love but as it‚Äôs a savings tool, I digress.

Overall, great app and something I will continue to use for the long foreseeable future.

Enjoy!
title: Great for passive savings, not for investing

review: Great concept, and I highly recommend the product from the standpoint it is something smart to do to help save. Problems: Dashboard can be confusing with amounts that don‚Äôt add up/make sense. Limited investment transparency and options. Price (while the account is small) - if doing an investing account, you need to reach 3k to make the $3 monthly fee begin to make sense (end even then that‚Äôs 1.2% annually, which is not cheap - and at 1k it‚Äôs 3.6% annually, which is expensive).  Obviously as the account gets bigger the fee is reasonable or even very good, but early on, it‚Äôs a lot. Finally, customer service is almost non-existent. It‚Äôs terrible actually.
title: Needs work

review: I have been attempting to close my account and have my funds ‚Äúliquidated‚Äù for over a week. But cannot find the ‚Äúpending deposits‚Äù that the customer service representatives assure me is required to close my account. I have now contacted them at least five times to get this issue resolved to no avail. Might as well flush your money down the toilet for all the good it will do you. Still waiting to get my money back and no answers from Acorns. Nothing. I‚Äôd rather give Robinhood and the hedge fund guys free reign of my bank account they‚Äôre at least easier to leave. -5/5 would NEVER recommend this app to ANYONE.
title: Terrible, horrible customer service to put it nicely

review: A super simple app. I like to treat it as a ‚Äúset it and forget it‚Äù kind of thing. I have rounds ups and weekly contributions. Acts sort of like a 401k except I can withdraw whenever I want without a penalty. I toss extra in when market is low and I withdrew when market was high for home down payment and made a few extra bucks with almost no effort. I would recommend for anyone looking for a simple long term investment app.

review: Acorns used to be great for a non noticeable investment account, and the cashback earnings WAS awesome. Also, there is no data showing the total or yearly amount of fees paid to get a better idea of what your actually earning. I‚Äôm canceling my subscription to go a different route, hopefully Acorns changes some things in the future.

I think that their aggressive portfolio is not all that aggressive but overall I think that acorns makes it easy to begin investing.

review: I love watching my ‚Äútree‚Äù grow.  Doing a modest weekly investment helps grow faster.  Also love the ability to adjust multiplier on round ups.  When I am able, I set it to 10x the round up and really watch it grow. When my funds are tight I can go back to 2x or 3x my round up or even no multiplier.  It is also easy to take withdrawal if an emergency happens.  The flexibility is great.  What an easy way to save money!

I am very tempted to close the account and just buy some crypto coins in Coinbase or Uphold. Acorns is feeling off for me. Reading the other comments is confirming my feeling.

Acorns rep: They take their time on verifying your sign ups.
Me: Why I have 12 sign ups that met the qualifications. 
Acorns rep: This is the new way they do it.
Me: So you‚Äôre telling me that it could be 3 months, 6 months, or a year til they verify it?
Acorns rep: Thats correct and if any of those sign ups cancel their account within any of that time frame and you drop below 8 sign ups you will not receive your bonus.

title: Acorns: A lucrative timesaver

review:
I could have made more with leaving my my funds in my savings account than this thing. Unless you‚Äôre a big fish and can do major deals it‚Äôs not worth it. What‚Äôs disappointing is I paid a fee to lose money. 

Even LasVegas bans the cheaters. The markets need to do the same. Acorns is a great app if you want to put your money into the market only for the big fish to take it. I suggest staying with a standard savings that doesn‚Äôt charge you a fee. Shop around for the ones with the best rates or put your money in a CD. 

I sure hope the government regulates the markets more and stops all the manipulation. We shall see.
title: Not worth it until the market cheats are stopped
developerResponse: {'id': 21499116, 'body': "Hi Dan, we believe in the long game. While in the short-term, stock prices can fluctuate a lot, over the long term, the S&P 500-stock index (generally considered a benchmark for overall market performance) has returned 9.8 percent a year, on average, over the last 90 years. You can't invest directly in an index, so ETFs, like VOO in your Acorns portfolio, provide a way to benefit from an index's return. title: Best finance app I have ever used

review: I have had Acorns less than a week and will be closing my account due to the terrible customer service and scammy ways. I have never received my referral reward nor my reward for signing up for other apps. This was after contacting them multiple times. They just blamed me for not doing it correctly. They were rude, condescending and took a very long time to respond to emails if at all. Also, financially, this app does not make sense because you are probably losing money due to their monthly fees and slow gains. Just invest in another ETF in another app like Robinhood. Do not download.
title: Acorns has the worst customer service. Get another investment app.

review: Good way to save $ by setting and forgetting. I am not impressed with the referral $ that you should be making by making purchases through companies that Acorns refers. There are numerous occasions that I don‚Äôt receive the bonus investments and Acorns doesn‚Äôt respond when you inquire abt it.  Halfass support.  Also getting 1099 at the end to file tax is way too late.

review: Wanted $1 subscription but it changed to premium $9 one. review: Acorns locked my account for transferring money from their investment portfolio to the acorns checking account. I have not been able to unlock my account for over 2 weeks now and I need to pay bills. I send them the latest requested info but I just get robotic responses from their pathetic customer service stating I need to send the latest statement, which it is the latest statement. I‚Äôm losing it, I don‚Äôt know what to do. I have no way of pulling my money out from being invested.
title: Locked my account

review: I‚Äôve tried for two months now to log into my Acorns account and it keeps trying to sign me up for a new account. I go along with all the steps and then it tells me already have an account. This is very frustrating. Why won‚Äôt it just log me into my account? It really makes me wanna just cash it out and not even bother anymore.
title: Very irritating

review: App is ok but service is really poor. Roundups don‚Äôt work with capitalone cards. Easy to get your money in, but extremely difficult to get investments transferred out. The fees are fully disclosed but exorbitant. $50 per ETF to move to Fidelity. Now I know how they can pay $1,000 signup / referral fees. It‚Äôs been a 2 months journey to get my investments out and remaining balance still hasn‚Äôt been wired back into my funding account. Chat support is non existent, just skip and call instead to get help. Glad to put this behind me, and could not recommend Acorns to anyone with a good conscience.
title: Investor beware if you ever want to to change brokerage

review: Had trouble verifying a checking account. It is very hard to get anyone at acorns to work with you solve your problem, they just seem to want to send you an email that tell you to do everything you‚Äôve already done. They seem to be in a hurry to get off the phone too when you call. They have always resorted back to not solving the problem and telling me to look for an email about the situation that should help in a few business days. Wasn‚Äôt a huge factor for me when I set up my account with them. Wish I would have thought about customer service sooner before investing thousands..
title: Customer Service

review: I‚Äôve had an account since 2016 - should have left a review sooner. I‚Äôm seeing 27%(!!!!) lifetime growth on my account. The automatic weekly investment has this on cruise control and they manage the portfolio for you. You can withdrawal funds with no fees unlike a typical retirement account - leaving your savings here makes more sense than a savings account in my opinion.
title: Easy way to invest, fantastic growth.

review:
I have had an account with Acorns for years but it seems from my experience to be getting buggier and less reliable. My cards become unlinked without explanation and parts of their website have trouble loading or saving information. I‚Äôm not cancelling my account but I would love for them to improve the service.

review: Guys seriously this is a scam, unless you have tons of money to lose don‚Äôt risk it they will not give you any money back, they will only transfer money out of your account they Will never ever transfer money back into your account, if you get upset and decide to close your Acorns account you will never get any money back regardless if you made dividends or not, my experience is that I‚Äôve funded over $200 then started running into issues asked for the money back my account has been in transferring status for a month now, and it‚Äôs plainly obvious that I will never get that two hundred dollars back!!

review:
It‚Äôs great as long as everything is perfect. Have an issue (like you card getting stolen) and it‚Äôs many days to get access to your money. 

Their roundup idea is great and that does work. But the spend account is just one hassle after another. Again if it‚Äôs all working fine you never notice. But heaven forbid you have something slightly out of the norm. I gave them a second chance after the first fiasco but here we are again with the app not allowing you to change something and no good way to get any kind of reasonable support. 

Put your spend account somewhere else!

review: The Acorn platform is one that have your mind at peace knowing that your investment have been diversified by the system with only a minimum fee. review:
After having both recurring and round-up payments setup for the past FIVE years, I checked on my account to find that I had far less money in my account than I should.
In fact, I had less money in my account than I had invested in total on a conservative plan. 
It turns out, a lot of my investment and ALL of my dividends had been eaten by Acorn‚Äôs fees.

Acorns is basically scam preying on people who are trying to be financially sound but don‚Äôt have the know-how or time to focus on stocks and such.
They have tons of options for getting credit cards and shopping through their app, and dozens of ways to connect your paycheck, cards, and bank account to make sure your money is flowing in.

Do yourself a favor and pick a more reputable app or just use a regular bank. Skip these profiteering vultures.

Terrible service, cashing out and never returning.
title: Basically a scam. Find Something Else. Even a real bank would be fine.

review:

review:
It is extremely easy to start reoccurring investments, but not so simple stop it, and takes way too long to get the withdrawals. They charge you the taxes by the withdrawal, even if there was no profit (or even losses) on you investment.

You cannot close your account unless you money is withdrawn, the issue with that is, that because it takes so long for the withdrawal to process, you get charged a monthly fee in between‚Ä¶
I will stick w Robinhood etc. no thanks.

They also make it impossible to completely delete your linked bank account from the app. You can unlink your bank account, but the app can still take money from that unlinked bank account. review:
So, I found Acorns and loved the easy investment methods. The roundups were genius to me and made it fun knowing when I spent money, I was also saving.
I set up a ‚ÄúLater‚Äù account as well as the roundup savings account and set up automatic withdrawals for Friday's.
However, I have found that the withdrawals are not always made on Friday‚Äôs and I‚Äôm getting money withdrawn without knowing which day to expect it. I don‚Äôt know how to undo it either.

review:

Not sure why Acorns has been such a bust, but it‚Äôs disappointing to say the least.

I referred 3 friends within the time frame of the promo, who completed referral , signed up to a subscription and made a $5 investment. This company seems like a pyramid scheme, to be honest. review:
You verify you identity you give it money it works for you. You quite literally watch it grow. It‚Äôs amazing.

They have an set it and forget it recurring deposit option. I had my 401k set for 15/month the last twelve months and it‚Äôs worth 800 at least. 

All in all I personally use this for my future for as long as it stays the way it is. I have nothing negative to say about it. The only thing it doesn‚Äôt offer is personal trading everything is automatic.

title: Transfer your money out
developerResponse: {'id': 26174799, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback. Sell orders (i.e. withdrawal requests) placed before 11am PST on a market day typically will be processed the same day. If your request was made after 11am PST on a market day, Acorns will typically sell shares the following market day. It can take 3-6 business days for withdrawals to fully reflect on your checking account. This time period accommodates withdrawal and bank processing timelines as well as bank policies. You can track the status of the transfer within the Recent Activity section of the account.', 'modified': '2021-11-09T17:08:19Z'}

review:
I have a robust retirement investment plan so was using this app for fun. I thought I‚Äôd save a few hundred bucks a year and doing something fun with the extra money. 

My main frustration was the time it took to have my rounded up change move into the app. And then it seemed as if I had to move this money manually. Maybe that was pilot error but it wasn‚Äôt something easy or intuitive for this savvy user. 

Given my savings goal, it‚Äôs just as easy (actually, easier) for me to count up my rounded up change once a week in my online bank account and transfer that money to my savings. I just did this, in fact. And, it saves the $3 monthly fee this app charges. 

My recommendation: avoid this app.
title: Experience was meh; takes too long for $ to transfer

review:
I exclusively used the round ups feature because I figure other ways to invest. This was a cool feature that I liked at the $1/month level. After 3 months into rounds ups I had saved about $150 which I was satisfied with. Probably on track to save $500-$600 for the year. 

Later Acorns bumped the fee to $3/mo. I don‚Äôt use those higher tier benefits. This translates to $36 for the year. 

I figure that on an average year with a 7% return, I‚Äôd gain $35-$42 dollars on my round ups. That‚Äôs about the same as my fee for acorns.

For me, I decided the investing impact wasn‚Äôt worth it and have since withdrawn and closed my account.

review:
I like the concept, I like the app and ease of use and setup, but the fees are going up. They even have a sustainable portfolio which is pretty sweet!

However, now with the increase in fees ($1 a month now $3 a month), I would either have to invest a ton of money or lose money until my break even point. I made about a 2% return on agressive, and I tried both portfolios. 

This app may still help some people invest, but when the point of an app is to save with each little bit of change you have, charging $3 a month is a steep and greedy cut considering what it used to be. 

I‚Äôm out. Peace!

review:
Over a three month period my earnings never broke more than +1.5%. My accounts earning typically floated between -1.5% and +.3% 

This is not the app if you are looking to get started in the market. 

The app itself gives a very vague description of where your money is invested.

Withdrawing your money takes a week whereas other apps is instant. 

If you are looking to save money this is the way to go as it will not let you easily take your money out and could give a small amount of return.

developerResponse: {'id': 31554275, 'body': 'Sell orders (i.e. withdrawal requests) placed before 11am PST on a market day typically will be processed the same day. If your request was made after 11am PST on a market day, Acorns will typically sell shares the following market day. It can take 3-6 business days for withdrawals to fully reflect on your checking account. This time period accommodates withdrawal and bank processing timelines as well as bank policies. review: I really like to concept of Acorns overall. The App is super easy to use. My biggest problem is customer service. Can you guys get more worse?! I‚Äôve chatted, emailed, and spoken with customer service representatives and they‚Äôre all terrible. A week ago I inquires about transferring my 401k to my Later Acorns account. In the chat, the representative had bo clue what I was talking about. She ‚Äúescalated‚Äù my request and the other representatives sent me an email asking for the same information previously requested (security protocol , I understand). Provided the information they requested. Waited about 24 hours andfinally got an email. Unfortunately , the wrong documentation was provided. I reached out again via chat, wen through the whole process of identifying myself (although I logged in with my thumb print) to get the same response‚Ä¶ it was a literal copy-and-paste from Acorns website how to transfer funds (I researched that before hand but my current 401k had different instructions how to transfer funds). The representative I chatted with went with the same sequence I previously dealt with‚Ä¶ so I requested a supervisor. She kept telling me my request was being escalated. During this time, I‚Äôm on hold to speak with a representative. I waited 40 minutes. When I finally got someone on the phone I identified myself told him I am inquiring about transferring my 401k to my Later Acorns account. He seamed to be reading from a script so I politely asked for a supervisor. He kept insisting what I was calling for, so I responded I‚Äôm inquiring about my Later account and like to speak with a supervisor‚Ä¶ he replies with ‚Äúsir, I need ti know what you‚Äôre calling for‚Äù I responded with, it‚Äôs in regards to my Later account and I would like to speak with a supervisor‚Ä¶ he hung up on me. I do like the concept Acorns offers,  but my patience is running thin. I‚Äôm currently waiting  for an email response (for the third time) for the same request (transferring my 401k to my Later account). It feels like Acorns doesn‚Äôt want my business and if they fail to resolve my request, I‚Äôm canceling my account and transferring my funds to my current employer‚Äôs 401k program
title: Customer service is terrible

For more information about our financial wellness system, check out our FAQ: https://www.acorns.com/support/how-does-acorns-work/. If you have any questions, please contact us, here: https://help.acorns.com/contact.', 'modified': '2021-01-21T15:06:17Z'}

review:
I‚Äôm not sure why the negative reviewers are screaming about not having their money grow when they‚Äôve put in $25 in like 6 months and pay $1 per month for the services.. like come on do some basic math and research. Stock market average annual return is 7-10% throughout its lifetime. If you only put in $5 a month and pay $1 a month then that‚Äôs already -20%. Of course you won‚Äôt profit like that.
I guess part of it is the fault of acorns for making investing in their app sound like a good idea for anyone who is willing to invest as little as $5. Sure that‚Äôs a start but the app is only worth it if you have decent money to start with or if you constantly add to it.
If you aren‚Äôt able to contribute $500 in a year I suggest saving up that amount in a bank account first before investing with a paid app. 
I used to have my gripes about acorns too, but the app easily shines when you do auto transfers and if you take advantage of the partnerships they have with companies that reinvest when you shop through the app. I‚Äôm able to make back the money I spend on fees by the cash back from companies that I was already going to buy from. In less than a year i‚Äôve actually gotten like $50 from these deals. It used to be limited but now they partner with a lot of retailers (Adidas, Apple, Ebay, Levi‚Äôs, etc). So before I even purchase online I‚Äôll just check if they‚Äôre on acorns and if they are then I buy from there for the extra money . It‚Äôs also great that the dividends get automatically reinvested. Automation is the best way to invest because you really just set it and forget it. But yeah a pretty looking and simple to use app that promotes investing to young people. I think that‚Äôs a good thing considering how bad americans are at saving money.
title: Worth it if you invest consistently and have at least hundreds

review: The amount missing from my account was greater than the declining assets. They keep you blind and shave money off your account

review:
I give Acorns a 4/5. I appreciate that this app makes investing easy and accessible to unsophisticated investors and those who want to use spare change to grow their resources. I invest through a traditional brokerage, a Roth IRA, and also through a work-sponsored tax advantaged account. But Acorns is actually a fun app. I have two major concerns about the app: (1.) the ‚ÄúFound Money‚Äù feature is hard to navigate and unpredictable, and (2.) the ‚ÄúInvite Friends‚Äù feature does not always work. Found Money. I have redeemed just under $50 in Found Money bonuses. However, I definitely made three additional and relatively large purchases (hotel booking, flower delivery, and satellite radio subscription) through Acorns and never had any money invested in my account (the 120-day estimated time limit has long come and gone). For those new to this concept, Acorns has partners that offer either a flat fee bonus or a percentage bonus deposit of your purchase into your Acorns account. So a flower delivery or music subscription service may offer you $10 bonus for placing an order. Or perhaps your favorite travel booking website or clothing store may offer you a 4% deposit bonus back for a purchase. The problem is that you click on the icon for the store you want to shop with, and in a single sequence of selections, you have to make your purchase. Obviously this is not how the average consumer shops, and it‚Äôs customary to switch windows in your browser, respond to messages, or answer a call while you are making a purchase. Notwithstanding this, I can tell you the app has not always monitored my purchases and I have not gotten all of the Found Money I contemplated. Referral Fees. You can get a $5 for referring friends. Sometimes you can get a substantial bonus for referring enough friends (if your friends actually sign up) within a given period. I have gotten one $250 bonus for getting 4-5 folks to sign up in one month. One weekend I had company staying with me and invited them to join Acorns through the link. I watched my guest download my link through the text message I sent them, but neither of us got the $5 bonus after they linked Acorns to their bank account. Indeed this is a new app so some bugs are expected. In fairness, I have gotten the referral fee on 7 other occasions.

****
Update, I‚Äôve had the account for years now and it‚Äôs still growing.  It would be nice and optimal if you could add beneficiaries in the Invest account directly in the app, instead of via a printed sheet of paper that needs to be uploaded.  That is crazy complicated for a near 100% cell app.
title: Great concept, some disappointing aspects

review:
My main issue with acorns thus far is not having the option to access a digital card .. I know many bank customers lose or have their debit cards stolen throughout the year, so to not have the ability to access my funds when that happens is completely absurd, and the only suggestion is to transfer the money out, but what is the point of having to transfer to another account when you can just use the account you‚Äôre having to transfer to and have your deposits set up there. Another issue is on top of not providing digital cards, we don‚Äôt even have the ability to connect our bank to really absolutely any other party, or to another bank. Online banking is supposed to be made more convenient, not more tedious, or insoluble especially when contacting support. I‚Äôm not even sure if I‚Äôll keep this bank account past this month, my debit was stolen, so I had no choice but to order a new card, however, due to not having my debit, and not being able to connect my bank to anything, I missed two on-time payments, and my credit dropped 111 points. Due to this I‚Äôm debating about a change in banks. I love Acorns, especially the ability to invest, and open an account for you child .. However, I feel completely let down when it comes to the importance of having the ability to access your funds at all times. That should be a priority, and it isn‚Äôt. I don‚Äôt want to have the same issue or problem in the future! 
- Also, I‚Äôm still waiting for my card so as everyday goes by my payment are in bad standing and I‚Äôm still unable to access my funds ü§Ø

review:
So let‚Äôs get one thing straight‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre not getting rich or retiring early by rounding up your spare change, that part of acorns is a total gimmick; however if you‚Äôre someone who literally has no clue how to save money then I guess I can understand the roundups helping you change your mentality or shifting it towards saving rather than spending.  Although when acorns charges you $3 a month, a lot of that spare change will be going to towards your fees so it doesn‚Äôt make much sense to me in that regard.

Where acorns does start to make sense is when you have $15K or more invested.  At that point the $36/year fee becomes on-par or better than the competition (most charge 0.25% a year). Once you hit that threshold, then Acorns makes a lot of sense, because as your money grows, your expense ratio decrease; whereas with other brokers your fixed 0.25% fee stays the same regardless of how much you have.  So if you have a decent chunk of change and want to have automated investing with a clean, user-friendly interface, while not getting too overwhelmed with stock options and portfolio allocations, then acorns would be a very good option for you.

I hope in years to come they add a little more flexibility with their fees and account features because I think Acorns has a lot to offer, but they need to build upon it.  Enhance the user features slightly, offer tax loss harvesting, and maybe bring back the $1/mo. ‚ÄúLite‚Äù model and you‚Äôll have a lot more customer retention (IMO).  $3/mo. Is just too much for the target group of people you‚Äôre advertising to.  People rounding up their spare change will be paying insanely high fees where‚Äôs they could use M1 Finance or SoFi for free and have the same ability to save with roundups while having WAY more flexibility with their asset choices, etc.  So like the title says‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúGreat, depending on how you use it‚Äù.
title: Great, depending on how you use it.

Sell orders (i.e. withdrawal requests) placed before 11am PST on a market day typically will be processed the same day. If your request was made after 11am PST on a market day, Acorns will typically sell shares the following market day. It can take 3-6 business days for withdrawals to fully reflect on your checking account. This time period accommodates withdrawal and bank processing timelines as well as bank policies. You can track the status of the transfer within the Recent Activity section of the account.', 'modified': '2022-03-08T00:34:01Z'}

review: I love Acorns & I‚Äôve been using it with contentment for a while now. I have some ideas/recommendations that seem reasonably simple to engineer and would result in lots of love from the Acorns community!! (By the way I only marked it 3 stars so the devs would see) 1. It would be great if the Widget for Acorns Spend updated every couple of seconds so that users can see how much they have without having to open the app and type in their password. I doubt it would be seen as a privacy violation considering that the only people that it would have an effect on would have previously chosen to have their balance on their Home Screen. 2. I think that if the Acorns GUI was customizable then people could be more conscious of their spending. For example, milestones appear before round ups, which seems counterintuitive considering that people care less about the future (milestones) than the present (roundups / what may be coming out of their bank account in the near future) 3. This one is less achievable and understandably difficult because of the banking infrastructures we have in the US, but it has bugged me a bit and I think it would be a significant improvement to the UX if Acorns users were able to deposit cash into ATMs instead of having to use their primary checking account outside of Acorns to fund their spend/invest/early accounts‚Ä¶ this would give working class users who make a trade-based living and deal primarily with cash more access to investing. It would also provide older people with the ability to invest their money in a way that they are used to, considering that cash is used far more often by the elderly. This might be considered a stretch but it would also help auto-immune disabled users who aim to make the least amount of physical and potentially dangerous contact with others. Thank you for your already impressive engineering that has helped me save for my college education and one day my children‚Äôs. - Cole :)

review: I‚Äôve been using Acorns since the beginning. For the basic saving/super basic investing app, it‚Äôs good. Certainly plenty of room for improvement. I got the checking account with debit card right when they came out and have been using it as my primary account since then. Most of the time, I don‚Äôt have issues. Except for when I want to transfer money from my Invest account to my Spend account. NOT POSSIBLE! I know, a banking app that wants you to transfer money OUT to another account is required. Then, I can transfer money from my other, separate account with a Credit Union, back into my Spend account within Acorns. Meanwhile, at least 5 days has gone by, with my money in limbo. The performance of the Invest account, is mediocre, at best. You‚Äôre talking 3-4% gains on an aggressive portfolio. Meanwhile, Vanguard, a collection of stocks you can invest in by purchasing one of many Vanguard stocks, performs more than triple that on average. And Robinhood also offers a debit card now. So I‚Äôll end up switching my primary account to Robinhood so I can invest and spend from the same account, with WAY better returns, and just as safe. And Not have to wait 5-10 days to access transferred money. The round-ups is cool, and adds up pretty quickly, surprisingly, without noticing I‚Äôm any lower on spending money. Another problem is trying to link this acorns account with any other app. Example, NerdWallet or any other budgeting app. Can‚Äôt link. None of my friends who use acorns can either. Also, I cannot transfer money directly from acorns to Robinhood or fidelity for real investing. I have to transfer to my credit Union first, then to Robinhood. Another 5-10 days of limbo. Anyone that knows stocks knows time of the essence on many trades. 5-10 days makes a difference. So with this lacking many features that they don‚Äôt seem to be addressing, because they seem to be focused more on creating a 401k for people, than to address the issues that would make this app/company more of a real value to me, and many others who may read this review. Just download Robinhood, buy any of the top Vanguard stock, and you‚Äôll get a much better return on your investment. And they still offer a debit card with no fees. And your company probably already does a 401k that matches a certain percentage of money invested, so do that. It‚Äôs a lot better! Acorns is becoming good for a niche market, but not great. It used to be great for many people, for the few things it did. They do too much now, and not enough of what‚Äôs most important in accounts/money management. Unfortunately, I‚Äôll be transitioning my accounts to Robinhood. These are NOT new issues. It‚Äôs been this way since the beginning. Just thought they‚Äôd fix the little things that make sense for a financial company like Acorns. They did not. It‚Äôs been years. Not weeks or a few months with basic issues. Years. Get better.

developerResponse: {'id': 22385911, 'body': "We're sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with your experience. While we assess a subscription fee, we offers ways for you to earn cash to help offset the monthly fee. Our refer-a-friend program rewards both you and your friend with a $5 investment! review:
Acorns is obviously a great app for anyone who wants to be more resourceful. I like the app because it‚Äôs simple and the settings can be altered for your financial goals. Investing will get addictive and that obviously will be a pro or con if your uneducated. If your bank account is low on funds. Automatic deduction will cease until your bank account has suitable funds again which is a plus. I experienced few over-draft fees and Acorn emails informing me of such. 

Dislikes. Growth seems to extremely, extremely slow. It‚Äôs the long game but I‚Äôve tested PayPal and invested Bitcoin and got a reasonable and faster ROI. Also more accessible options to acquire my funds. You really have to add money more often to see a difference. More funds goes towards the subscription fee in my opinion. Which makes the company a sizable profit for them. Example: I pay a $3 monthly subscription. Let‚Äôs say 1,000,000 customers have same subscription. That‚Äôs $3,000,000 a month, which is great for your company but I have no say in how my money is invested, which is inexcusable for me. Basically we as consumers are a funding source for them as a company and they reap the higher benefits, ROI. Transferring round-ups to Acorns take several days, same as selling your shares and waiting days for pending funds to your bank account. The idea is great but the execution needs to be way better and user friendly. Everyone has different income levels or spending habits, so that‚Äôs a factor also. I still think this app should be better for us. Especially in what we invest our spare change in.

review:
For me, acorns has been great and has never given me a problem, isn‚Äôt it backed by google??  I referred a friend and within 6 months of starting her account, she was locked out with $500 in it . When trying to recover passwords, it said there was no such account , no email found. WHATTTT!!?? Like we pretty much  live paycheck to paycheck and you‚Äôre telling me that $500 that she had been saving for months just disappeared and they let the  account get hacked that easy? This was 6 months ago. The account still has not been recovered and it‚Äôs hard to find a way to contact acorns that is secure . She isn‚Äôt sure of the exact amount that was in acorns since the roundups vary, but the acorns support put $500 back in her bank account and said that they closed her account out , and that she could make a new one. At the same time, recurring deposits are still coming out of her bank and cannot be shut off because we obviously cannot log in! While trying to make a new account, it says her email is still in use . It‚Äôs all just so frustrating and there isn‚Äôt the customer service that there should be with such a large investment app. 

Now like I said, I personally have loved acorns and it has put my money that I wouldn‚Äôt otherwise notice aside, the first year I invested $2000, this year I‚Äôm up to $7000. Now I only make about $50k and tips but i make so many small purchases every day that I don‚Äôt even notice that the money is gone , it‚Äôs like buying a coffee every day. I never would have saved this money myself or on my own because I just wouldn‚Äôt think of it. I sincerely hope they improve the security aspect because I do want to keep using the app and hope that this same thing never happens to me.
title: Needs improvement on security

title: Investing

review:
Acorns does have a sophisticated offering however there are two glaring issues that are of concern one the charting is completely misleading. It doesn‚Äôt matter how bad the market (or their algorithm) is, their charts always shows you an uptick, like it‚Äôs going great.  The reason they do this is to show the money that you‚Äôre personally putting in is increasing but it doesn‚Äôt actually show you the performance of the portfolio. Other competitor services such as Wealthfront show the $ value of your investment as the cash investment as well as another line to show how your portfolio is performing relative to the $ you deposited. Wealthfront is much more honest service in this regard.  

Secondly if you contact customer service )if you‚Äôre lucky to even be able to get reach them) on email they ask you to send back private information which is easily intercepted/hackable and can be used to impersonate you. Specifically they asked for your date of birth call Mary address on file with the email address and the phone number I don‚Äôt know of any other financial services or Fintech operations to ask for this over email. Good financial firms and security experts advise against sending this sensitive information over email. If Acorns would say to me here ‚Äúwe‚Äôre sorry you feel that way, please contact customer service‚Äù that‚Äôs complete waste of time I have advised them of this on numerous occasions and they have done sweet FA over a number of years. So I‚Äôm forced to write in a public forum. Perhaps if you care about your security and if you care about an accurate charting where you can measure yours and their performance then choose another provider.
title: Misleading charts & big security hole

review: It‚Äôs a great idea but the app itself doesn‚Äôt function well. My boyfriend and I signed up on the same exact day. I got to $10 worth of round ups that as of an entire week later haven‚Äôt come out of my bank account nor showed on my acorns account as me having ‚Äúinvested it‚Äù even though I clicked invest and the roundups disappeared, meaning they should‚Äôve been invested. Yesterday one of the $5 roundups showed up as pending on the app, but has yet to come out of my bank acccount. The one that showed up on the app as pending was even the most recent one and not the first one I did, and the first $5 seems to have disappeared into thin air. Says it takes 1-3 business days for everything to process...at this point I‚Äôm at my 5th business day with nothing processed. My boyfriend who not only signed up on the first day but also invested at the same exact time as me AND has the same exact bank had his show up as soon as the day after. Had trouble linking two of my credit cards, one finally linked after days of saying it linked correctly but then immediately giving me an error message. Another credit card company that acorns apparently accepts is still not working to link and the customer support essentially told me they had no idea and oh well even though the error message I get literally says ‚Äúerrors like this are usually solved quickly, so you might want to try this account again later‚Äù and having tried several times a day for a week now it still doesn‚Äôt work, knowing 300% that my account info is correct. Very wary of the app which is a shame because it‚Äôs a brilliant idea.

review:
The service is truly great for people who struggle to save.

Do yourself a favor and make a few one time investments. If you can afford it, set up a weekly deposit (you can do as little as $5 per week), and you should always turn on the round-ups. The round-ups are seemingly unnoticeable, and you can always transfer the money back out of Acorns if you need to. 

It‚Äôs worth it to make some one-time investments to get past your first hundred-dollars or so, because, to be completely honest, solely using the round-ups feature won‚Äôt earn you a ‚Äústaggering‚Äù amount at first. This is because the $1 per month fee will be dragging your profits down, and the fee can be hard to outpace with just your spare change. Of course, that is dependant upon how much money you spend on an average day. 

That all being said, once you have some money in Acorns, the service works great. It is investment with no thinking, and it‚Äôs especially great for people like myself who struggle to set aside money. 

What is more is the incredible referral bonuses. If you are someone who can‚Äôt seem to afford regular deposits, Acorns frequently rewards you for referring new customers. There are promo‚Äôs which can earn you hundreds of dollars for referring a certain number of people (usually around 3-5), and you also get $5 for every individual you bring. It‚Äôs a great way to build up a chunky initial balance, which will grow faster and faster over time!

Finally, I should say that this is NOT financial advice. I am NOT a financial advisor. These are just some things I have learned and experienced during my time with the app, and I felt compelled to deliver my honest review.

review: Hello everyone , I have recently had probably the worst customer service ever . Talking to the acorns agents was a compete waste of time since all they do is give meaningless apologies and refer back to the customer service number. Recently I had my account locked yet again and when I asked to unlock it and to have my account closed/ liquidated. I would consistently have to ‚Äúreprove‚Äù ownership of my bank and bank statements along with proof of pending amount no matter how many times I keep calling and talking to new agents (extremely frustrating). My but it would not post on my bank because they would close my acorns account. And Afterwards the money would be deducted from my personal bank account but I can‚Äôt use my acorns card since they locked it and I would constantly be told to ‚Äúwait 2-3 days‚Äù and the internal team would take care of it and respond by email. I‚Äôm simple terms , they would take my money , lock my card and take forever to give it back now Matter how much you complain. You can‚Äôt contact internal team directly because apparently they do not have a number and only can use emails. They take forever and it shouldn‚Äôt especially when it comes to your money. Even using 24 hour chat support was a joke since they would just refer back to internal team. Point is I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in acorns and I was at one point very happy use the app and the card but honestly it‚Äôs not worth all the hassle. review: So I deposited a cashiers check. They locked my account when the check was available in my spend account.  I got an email asking for proof of why I received the check and what for. So I uploaded the receipt from the check that stated what it was for. Then I received another email saying I had to upload proof that I didn‚Äôt cash the check anywhere else. So I asked repeatedly what type of proof did they want because I was unsure of the type of proof since I uploaded a receipt the first time since that is what they asked for to unlock my account. They lied. They never responded with the type of proof they needed. They kept responding with the same thing asking for the proof. So I told them nevermind I will cash it somewhere else that I want in my account closed. Then I noticed they took the three dollars out of my checking account for my subscription after I said I want to the account closed. Directly after that they reversed the check for my spend account and unlock my account. Now they are saying if I want to cash the check anywhere else that they can‚Äôt close my accountUntil the check clears which makes no sense because the check is not from them it‚Äôs from a different bank so what doesMe cashing the check elsewhere have to do with them closing my account. It all sounds crooked to me. People going to invest with stash there‚Äôs so much better a way better bank than Acorny. So I still have an open account with him that I will never use just like I never use it in the first place the only reason I decided to cash the check there is because I work a lot of hours and it was easier just to deposit the check online then going to a brick and mortar. Will never make that mistake again. I think they‚Äôre trying to rip me off and that‚Äôs why they‚Äôre telling me to wait to deposit the check anywhere else because they try and keep the money for themselves. I don‚Äôt know I‚Äôm thinking maybe I need to contact the FTC......

review:
If I could give zero stars, I would. This company is horrible! Everything was set up fine, until i transferred money into the account. Evidently they feel a $1000 dollar deposit is too much money to be handled electronically so they froze the account until I had a 3 way phone call with Acorn and my original bank to verify that the funds were available. When my bank assured them the funds were available Acorn said that they still had to ‚Äúreview the phone call‚Äù and is denying me access to my money for another 24-48 hours. Then their ‚Äúcustomer service rep‚Äù had the nerve to say, ‚Äúis there anything else I can help you with?‚Äù Needless to say, I will be closing my account as soon as they ‚Äúreview the phone call‚Äù and give me access to the account. Addendum: after another conversation with ‚ÄúCustomer Service‚Äù I was told that I need to provide screen shots of my sending bank records showing the transfer and remaining balance in addition to a pic of my ID. Which I had to send to open the account. After I do that I was told that I might have access to my money in 48 hours. Then she dropped this little nugget, I might need to go through this every time I deposit funds into the account, which won‚Äôt ever happen again.

Update: Day 4 with no access to my money, though the developers recommended I call ‚ÄúCustomer Support‚Äù just so they can tell me that they can‚Äôt unlock my account until it‚Äôs reviewed.  If you really want to help me, unlock my account so I can get my money out and close this account

review:
I joined Acorns almost 7 years ago and I have thoroughly enjoyed exploring all the different features to help me make my money grow. In my personal opinion, it is well worth the subscription fee since I‚Äôve made that money back many times over after all these years. Although I opened with just a simple ‚ÄúInvest‚Äù account, I now also have a ‚ÄúBank‚Äù account and a ‚ÄúLater‚Äù account. I am particularly fond of the ‚ÄúEarn‚Äù feature (used to be called ‚ÄúFound Money‚Äù) which pays me for buying items I would‚Äôve bought anyway. Genius! It is just so fun to watch my money grow and learn about the stock market and investing at the same time! FYI: to this date, I‚Äôve only deposited money into my accounts. Haven‚Äôt tried withdrawing yet so I can‚Äôt speak for that. 

My only (minor) issues have to do with the chart. In the past few months, the chart design was changed and I‚Äôm not very happy with it. The old chart columns included 1 day, 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, and ‚ÄúAll‚Äù. The new chart lists 1 day, 1 month, 3 months, 1 year, 5 years, and ‚ÄúAll‚Äù. My problem is that the new chart layout is so flat that it takes all the visual satisfaction out of using the chart in the first place. On the old chart you could really see the incline (or decline depending). But not this one. Furthermore, the touch screen to zoom into a particular day is incredibly finicky and hard to use. The screen is so flat that your finger ends up hiding the pop up info that you are looking for making it almost impossible to use. Please bring the old chart back! I just don‚Äôt like this one. 

I also have an issue with the ‚ÄúTotal Gain/Loss‚Äù tab. That number should reflect my ‚ÄúMarket Gain/Loss‚Äù amount for each column minus any subscription and advisory fees. But it doesn‚Äôt. For example, in my 1 year category, the difference shown on my chart is only $1.23. Since my subscription fee is $3 per month it SHOULD show a difference of $36 for the year. It‚Äôs not clear why it shows only $1.23. Where did that number even come from? And on my ‚ÄúLater‚Äù account, the number doesn‚Äôt differ at all making the feature useless for my Later account. It‚Äôs just confusing and when it comes to my money, I feel that clarity is essential. 

So please bring the old chart back and fix the issue with the ‚ÄúTotal Gain/Loss‚Äù. I love Acorns anyway, but these small details will make me love you even more.
title: I Love Acorns BUT‚Ä¶

review: Referred my friends so I can get a referral bonus. Long story short, they had shown the bonus coming into my account but then locked my account because I needed to upload identity verification documents. I had to send the documents 4 different times because I would talk to a new person each day and they told me I had to do a different thing to submit them each time. Most of the time they said that they had never received the documents! This was really frustrating because I sent pictures of my drivers license, social security card and even a bank account statement and if I was sending them to ‚Äúacorns‚Äù and there was no record of them receiving them, who did I just send my identification documents to? Very frustrating as. A little sketchy. The customer service workers have no idea what they are doing. I finally got my account unlocked and then the bonus they claimed was coming, was no longer coming. I contacted them wondering why I was getting the bonus then all of a sudden why they just got rid of it‚Ä¶ I contacted them and they claimed that the people I referred did not complete the necessary requirements for me to get the bonus even though it was already on its way. They then said that I couldn‚Äôt receive the bonus even if the people I referred completed their ‚Äúnecessary‚Äù requirements because the promotion time period had already passed. Very convenient for them to say that after the referral period had passed but not tell me that my friends referrals weren‚Äôt going to work until it‚Äôs too late. Such a big scam and a little sketchy. I would recommend using a real brokerage that won‚Äôt rip you off because that‚Äôs all this ‚Äúcompany‚Äù will do.

review:
The Acorns model seems really great. I‚Äôve had an account for several years now and had decent dividends. Last year they had some sort of major glitch in which most accounts (if not all) were sent an email saying their account was locked, followed by an unprofessional email stating that their account was not locked. I contacted Acorns immediately to find out if there had been a security breach and was never able to get an answer that made me feel confident my information had not been compromised. The whole thing was very shady and I‚Äôve never seen a public statement from them on the incident and am no longer comfortable letting them have my money.

I have literally been trying for the last year to transfer my money out of my account and they don‚Äôt seem to play nice with other investment firms. I finally have the process to transfer money out started with Acorns, not just submitting paperwork to my new firm. The process is taking a ridiculously long time with numerous emails back and forth requesting confirmation DESPITE verbal confirmation to proceed on the phone. I have had numerous phone calls with the company over the last year and not once spoken with somebody who‚Äôs first language was English which made the entire process even more difficult because there was clearly a language barrier, to the point the advisor from my new firm was also struggling to communicate as we were on a 3-way call. (Note: I‚Äôm not slamming any specific nationality here as there were numerous accents involved and all of them were so heavy I had difficulties understanding. One person I spoke with even had roosters crowing loudly in the background!)

Additionally, the fine print says that when you sell your stocks to transfer out there‚Äôs a $50 fee. If that‚Äôs a $50/share fee then I will be losing a lot of money in this transfer. We‚Äôll see how much I actually end up with once this never-ending process is complete.

review: I that acorns would be an easy way for me to save some money without thinking about it, however It will never gain you a whole lot of extra cash, and if you choose to put your investment portfolio on aggressive, you will more than likely lose more money than you gain because of the stocks they invest your money into. I have also been paying for what I thought was the lowest tier, that is $3/mo and gives you access to roundups, they‚Äôre save for later option, and they‚Äôre debit card. HOWEVER I recently found out the $3/mo tier that they advertise as the lowest tier in fact IS NOT the lowest tier you can subscribe to. I went to cancel my subscription because all I use are the roundups and not the other things they offer you, and once you click the ‚Äúcancel my subscription‚Äù button they give you an option to pay $1/mo and only have the roundups. If you plan on putting pennies into this and only use the roundups, please do yourself a favor and go to cancel your subscription and downgrade to the $1/mo and save yourself more money than you‚Äôre probably going to earn from this app. The only way to make the $3/mo worth it is to have some serious cash in your account and get lucky. Odds are if you‚Äôre like me you‚Äôre not putting enough money into this app, and it‚Äôs not actually bringing in more money that what you will spend on it. This app is just a way for bid businesses to use your money to fund they‚Äôre own corporations and keep they‚Äôre stocks up. review:
I just started using this recently since I liked the convenience Acorn advertised. Everything works fine for the first few weeks then the issues started happening. 
My weekly recruiting investing started turning off by itself WITHOUT my initiation. I contacted customer service about the issue through their email on the app. I re-setup the recruiting investment again (for exactly the same amount on the same day of the week). Then it stopped again on the same day. I changed password immediately for security concern and re-setup the recruiting investment again and also contacted customer service again. Then it still turned off the recruiting investment AGAIN (third time in a row). And afterthat, my account was suddenly closed while the market went down. They liquidified my investment while the return was NEGATIVE. I didn‚Äôt loose too mich money but it started getting me annoyed. I have to reopen the account to see what happened. And yet there was no response back from customer service. I called customer service and the representative (after talking to their ‚Äúinternal team‚Äù) DIDN‚ÄôT know the problem and didn‚Äôt have and resolution. Then I had a follow-up email saying that I didn‚Äôt have any recruiting investment and ‚Äúhelp‚Äù me to set-up the recruiting investment. I responded with all the confirmation email with time stamp of all the issues that happened. They still don‚Äôt know what happened and offer no resolution at all. I‚Äôll close my account after all the transfer are done. POOR, INCONVENIENT, and INCOMPETENT service!

review: It is a long story but let me summarize it for you so you hopefully won‚Äôt make the mistake. I was offered $1200 bonus for 4 referrals. Wow right? Not really‚Ä¶ You may follow the status of your referrals through the app and my last one‚Äôs status stayed ‚Äúin progress‚Äú for a long time. Apparently they asked my friend for W2, bill, driver license etc‚Ä¶ After he gave all this his account was approved and he completed the initial investment (required for the bonus) before the deadline. His status did not change though. I called Acorns and they assured me that if he had completed the initial transfer there shouldn‚Äôt be any problem. I waited for another week, called again but was told a that someone will reach out by email. They listed a bunch of requirements and told me that my friend might have not satisfied one of them. I checked all of them and they were all satisfied! I asked them to be more specific but of course they couldn‚Äôt. I sent screenshots from my friends account proving that he did satisfy all the requirements but they didn‚Äôt care. Instead, they blocked my friends account right after I reached out to them with the proof and asked more documents to verify his account. Same thing happened to one my referrals when he referred other people. Somehow they started asking more and more documents for his last referral to make sure the final referral is not complete before their deadline. They collect sensitive information from people and probably want to seem like a growing business but do not honor the bonus they claim for it. Please be aware.

review:
Acorns is an almost flawless investing app, and I would have given it 5 stars if not for a few minor (but rather inconvenient) issues.
First the good:
If you‚Äôre bad at saving money like me, this is the app for you. I have an above average knowledge of stocks and Acorns strategy of investing in diversified indexes is great. The fact that they repeatedly emphasize a buy and hold strategy is great too, and a LOT of my age group in their 20‚Äôs and 30‚Äôs need to hear this. Time in the market >> timing the market, and Acorns takes advantage of this strategy to a T. While the lack of customization for holdings may be a put off to some, most successful investors have portfolios very similar to Acorns. 

Their checking account is a must have for round ups which are so crucial in passive investing. And their debit card feels nice in your hand and is great to use. I only wish it had a touch to pay feature which is very common on new cards

And their customer service is beyond amazing. Prompt with replies and extremely helpful, they really help set this app apart from others.

Now for the bad:
If there‚Äôs any area in which Acorns will lose out to other apps, it‚Äôs the lack of a high yield savings account and saving strategies to keep a more liquid portion of your cash saved for more short term expenses. Take betterment for example, and their savings goals, which allows you to save money for a rainy day AND invest. Apps like So-Fi and Digit have similar strategies. I need to have a separate checking account with savings goals in order to maintain rainy day savings that are kept separate from my spending account, since acorns doesn‚Äôt offer this. 
Im a firm believer that not every dollar you save should be invested, and instead investors need to have a certain amount of money (6-8 months of living expenses) in liquid to tide over rough spells. If this current bear market thought us anything, it‚Äôs the fact that everyone needs a safety buffer. Im surprised Acorns missed this important point. Maybe they overlooked a savings account or maybe they just didn‚Äôt feel the need to offer one.
I just do hope they read this and consider adding one so I can make do with one place to store my money and not have to transfer funds separately into Acorns to spend 

Otherwise this is a brilliant app. Keep up the good work.
title: An (almost) flawless investing app

review: I should have done my research before hand, but luckily I didn‚Äôt go to far. I invested into one account, and had scheduled a small amount into two other accounts on here. They then prompted me to make a checking account, so I did. After it sent me emails confirming the card will be on the way once I put a certain amount in the checking account, the checking account was closed for no apparent reason. I stopped the two other savings account from automatically pulling out however it still pulled money out 2 days later, even though it took them 4-5 days to take out the first one. Then not even a day later, my entire account was locked. In order to unlock they are requesting my bank statements with my name and routing number attached. I attempted to contact them via chat and phone, and agents will assure you they will escalate, but then they don‚Äôt. I requested a refund and to close my account, the agents then claimed they couldn‚Äôt find my account, then stated they can‚Äôt refund or close unless I submit personal information such as bank statements with my name on it and account number to them. When trying to escalate to a manager or supervisor, they say they can‚Äôt transfer (I‚Äôve tried chat and phone). After all that, I just had to go to my bank to block charges from this company, after reading reviews it‚Äôs evident this company does this where they lock your account to acquire more personal information, and does not unlock it at all all while requesting more information from you. DO NOT USE THIS APP, STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY THEY HAVE LAWSUITS GOING BACK TO 2008 AND USERS STILL BEING CHARGED A SUBSCRIPTION YEARS LATER AFTER GETTING CONFIRMATION THEY HAVE BEEN CANCELED.
