review: Do not, REPEAT, DO NOT sign up with Acorns!!!  PROMOTIONS ARE A SCAM!!!!!!   This app offers enticing promotions to get people to sign up.  What caught my attention was an offer for $1,000 to sign up 5 of my friends.  Wow a free $1,000 for virtually no work!?  Has to be some kind of catch....  Well I signed up and got 5 friends to do it and of course it turned out to be a scam.  Let me start by saying that people do not want to be bothered with something like this.  I thought it would be easy to get friends to sign up.  I couldn't have been more wrong.  My longtime friends and even family members were very annoyed that I asked them to do this.  Several friendships with friends and family members actually ended up being severed simply by me asking them to sign up for this app.  Well, despite this I was able to get 5.  I had read the fine print for this deal very well as I know companies like this are often notorious for hiding some catch in the small print.  So the promotion ends and my low and behold I DON‚ÄôT get it!??  So I call customer service.  After explaining the situation to the rep (one of these guys clearly from INDIA who has a thick accent and doesn't speak English well and is obviously reading from a script) he says there's nothing he can do.  I ask to speak to a supervisor.  He says one will call me back.  So we wait all day and nobody calls us back.  The next day I call back and the same thing - we are told someone will call us back.  This happens literally 4 times!  Nobody ever calls me back.  I write emails to the company.  I reach out on social media.  NOTHING!  Despite having definitely at the required 5 people, I DON‚ÄôT GET THE PROMOTION!!!!!  See the attached photo for yourself.  So now I am absolutely enraged!  I want what is owed to me for all the hard work I did!  Not only did I get at least 5 people to sign up, but many of them got people to sign up as well.  Do yourself a favor and avoid this app at all cost.  The promotions are a SCAM!!!!!

I had not done anything for this to happen so I then go into my acorns account bc it said my bank had issues so I just canceled that bank out NEVER placing my other as the main one for investments. The next day I go onto my bank account and guess who took $5 out without asking? That‚Äôs right acorns, go into my account and it‚Äôs there so I email them bc in extremely angry and within that day the $5 disappeared from my account yet was not placed back in my bank account.. I have emailed repeatedly over this and a few other issues (then depositing money to ‚Äúverify‚Äù my bank yet tell me those deposits they put are wrong) again had proof they were in the wrong. Just yesterday they yet again tried to get another $5 from me but I was a step ahead, I emptied my spending account out and hid my money in another account they do not have. I emailed them asking for the 4th time for my $5 back and they tell me they couldn‚Äôt take it bc I didn‚Äôt have the funds.... Uhhh no I‚Äôm talking about the $5 before that time that I have PROOF of (not the initial $5 to start the account either) but they don‚Äôt want to hear it, don‚Äôt want to help and continue to do things their way. The guy didn‚Äôt understand a word I was saying and gave answers to questions I already knew and that had nothing to do with what was going on!! Terrible just terrible, you treat someone like not only they are stupid but a liar when I‚Äôve asked repeatedly to speak to someone higher up that understands English and has a email I can send photos too but they avoid that question every single time. Please if your reading this DO NOT waste your time or money, heck just give them your bank info if you still move forward that‚Äôs all they want anyway. After all this they still haven‚Äôt resolved my issue, treat me like an idiot and completely ignored my issues.

review: I‚Äôve been an Acorn customer for several years more, but I am ending that and have no desire to ever return. There are many other platforms available that provide the same service, and‚Äîeven though I‚Äôm not making these companies a lot of money with my measly investments‚ÄîI‚Äôd like to think ANY other company would treat me with more respect than Acorn did. **PLEASE let me paint a picture: After entering her savings account info by accident and immediately correcting it, my friend/referral‚Äôs money came out of the bank on July 11th. It showed in the Acorns app as available on July 15th. The DEADLINE for the reward was July 16th. After hearing I qualified for the reward, I was then told I didn‚Äôt because her ‚Äúinvestment‚Äù had not settled until July 19th. ??????????????? *** I was told I qualified for a reward after asking two friends to enroll and spending time walking them through it (AND talking them into trusting Acorn HAHA). I was essentially told that they choose when a deposit is ‚Äúsettled‚Äù and they apologized for ‚Äúany frustration‚Äù it may have caused me. After countless emails, I‚Äôve still received nothing but vague emails that ended with a cheerful ‚Äúone of our support staff will reach out!‚Äù. I‚Äôll quote part of the email below. Maybe elsewhere online I can share a screenshot of it. ***I‚Äôm sorry, but $500 is quite a bit of money for some of us, especially in this climate of inflation, etc‚Ä¶PLEASE PLEASE don‚Äôt get your hopes up over something like this, just to have it yanked back.*** When my friend I referred reached out after they told me they wouldn‚Äôt communicate further about why I didn‚Äôt qualify, they responded within the hour every time. WHEN I REACHED OUT IT TOOK DAYS. It‚Äôs not alright that they‚Äôre able to do this. Just please be aware that they probably won‚Äôt honor their referral reward, no matter how much effort you put into it. Apparently they set their own rules and don‚Äôt have to share any real information as to why. I was really counting on this money and worked hard on it, but they didn‚Äôt care about that.

review:
I‚Äôm in my early 20s, almost mid 20s. I‚Äôve had Acorns for almost 2 1/2 years, so I feel that I can state with enough certainty how the app is. 

I highly recommend it for anyone who is looking to build a savings account and to have a sense of security for long-term growth. I started the same as most people with $5 in September of 2018. As of January 20, 2020, I now have $2,246 (a total of 29% ROI). 

I average about $65-75 a month in automatic deposits since I use the 2x option for the last year 1/2. 

Listen, is it the highest ROI? No. And it won‚Äôt be and I expect this. However, when you think of the idea of this coming from PENNIES, then you realize how powerful of a savings account/emergency account this could be. This is money I would have never saved myself and just happens to be there because of the round-up idea. (To the highest dollar). 

But when you combine this account with other investments like Roth IRA/ 401k/ generic investing in Schwab/Robinhood/ etc, how can you possibly go wrong?! It‚Äôs an automatic investment tool that grows you a nice cushion! 

I also really enjoy the plethora of business that you can collect cash back from. Sure, it‚Äôs not automatic and it‚Äôs not the quickest, but it will happen. And since 2018, the number of companies partnering with Acorns has grown 10-fold. 

So if you are someone who wants to add an investment account, save for an emergency nest egg, wants to see long term growth potential, or just wants an investment account that‚Äôs completely hands-off, I highly recommend Acorns and continue too for people who ask. The pros (in my honest opinion) greatly outweigh the cons.
title: Think of it as a Savings Account (because it is)

review:
I don‚Äôt recommend this app to anyone. This company doesn‚Äôt honor their clients and customer service never responded to questions, especially the harvest team.

About two months I saw that acorns was advertising a bank fee reimbursement program. After I signed up and followed through with the steps for the reimbursement I received an email with a header called ‚Äúreimbursement receipt‚Äù although there was no number disclosed in the email. In the email I was told the harvest team would follow up in the next 2-3 business days after they calculated their own fees for the program. Well, since then I have never gotten an actual amount for the reimbursement nor was I told which account my money would be reimbursed to. As I stated before this is going back to the middle of September. 

Since then I have been tried numerous times to get a hold of the harvest department, and all I‚Äôve been told by customer service is a representative from the harvest team will be reaching out. By the way, there‚Äôs no number for the harvest team. There is an email but no one responds, there is a web page, but no one responds, and there‚Äôs a chat line, but no responds. The only representative you can get a hold of is the general customer service agent. When I asked to escalate this issue and talk to a manager or supervisor I‚Äôm told I can not, only they can. It‚Äôs a huge problem! 

It‚Äôs almost as if acorns set up a harvest refund program with no one in charge of it. When I ask to speak to a representative from that team I‚Äôm constantly told someone will be reaching out, but no one never actually does. I have been a loyal customer with Acorns since 2016 and all I‚Äôm looking for is transparency and I can‚Äôt even get that. I will be pulling my money out today. 

THIS COMPANY DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CLIENTS. THEY ARE MONEY HUNGRY AND ALL THEY WANT IS YOUR FUNDS.

title: Scam

review:
No way these guys should have a legal authority to conduct business. They just scam people by making all these crazy promises but failing to complete them.
-first of all it is almost impossible to cancel your membership
-second they have these fake referral programs when support finds every excuse to not count your referrals so you waste time and energy referring people just for them to tell you it‚Äôs not valid. (happened 6 times)
-third the customer support should be called ‚ÄúBlame the customer department‚Äù when you tell them there is a problem in a certain part of the app they just keep telling you it‚Äôs your fault. When you ask them why your referrals aren‚Äôt going through they say things like ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know from our end but you did something wrong‚Äù gaslighting people into thinking it‚Äôs their fault
-Finally fourth I have reason to believe this is an outright scam. Portfolios don‚Äôt go up with the market for some reason. They always stay very still (at high risk investment option) I feel like they take away your earnings when your portfolios do good and take away from them when they perform poorly. 

Overall good concept but terrible execution. If you‚Äôre on the fence about downloading, don‚Äôt. They are a bunch of rich stuck ups taking money from small businesses and not so better off people for their own gains. 
If you see this acorns, I spent so much time referring 6 people when the deal said I only need to do 3 referrals but your gaslighting department kept telling me only one is valid when I witnessed them make deposits and fit all criteria. Make this right.
title: Sneaky scammers

review:
My account was locked due to an error on the part of Acorns and I was unable to access any of my funds (over $1000) for an entire month. 

I exchanged 20+ e-mails and spent hours on the phone with multiple ‚Äúadvocates‚Äù in an attempt to get in contact with someone who could recover my account. No one seemed to understand why my account had been locked nor knew how to fix it.

The phone ‚Äúadvocates‚Äù repeatedly told me that they could not recover my account themselves - only ‚Äúsupervisors‚Äù and the ‚Äúinternal team‚Äù would be able to access the application‚Äôs backend. But each time I called - nearly every day of the week & at nearly every time of the day - there were no supervisors available to assist me. I was told time and time again that my case had been escalated to ‚Äúurgent‚Äù and that I would receive and email or call back from a supervisor or member of the internal team within 1 business day. I never received any communication.

The only way I finally got in contact with a supervisor was by forcing an advocate to stay on the line with me for over an hour so that she could connect me immediately with her direct supervisor after he finished a meeting that she saw in his calendar. After a full month of consistent communication, this was the only way I could get in touch with anyone who could recover my funds. It took this supervisor 3 hours of communication with his ‚Äúinternal‚Äù team to recover my account. I was given no explanation as to why my account was locked.

I‚Äôve been an Acorns customer for nearly 5 years and I‚Äôm terrified that it took 15+ hours of work to recover MY money. Keep your money in the bank.
title: Scam

review:
Previously a delighted customer who advocated for the benefits of Acorns to friends and family. A few ‚Äúmalfunctioning‚Äù referral links later (through the Acorns referral bonus program) and I have unfortunately lost both my enthusiasm and trust in Acorns.

What should be a simple referral process did not correctly capture four very close friends‚Äô referred accounts and although I attempted to be patient and assume the best, I grew frustrated with the continued follow-up required only to be emailed what seems to be a template advising no one could help and that I should reach out again if I had additional questions. I gave Acorns the benefit of the doubt the first and second time this happened, but it became quite clear by the fourth time there was a referral issue that there is no incentive for Acorns customer support to fix the ‚Äúbroken referral link‚Äù issue - especially once your friend or family‚Äôs account is opened. 

I called and emailed much more than I would have liked to and was surprised at how unpleasant the referral bonus process has become but ultimately leaving this review for the benefit of other users who go through the efforts of referring friends and family. I did speak to a supervisor to advise that it feels the referral bonus program is set up for us to fail somewhere along the way. I successfully completed referral bonuses in the past, but the previous two referral bonus periods have changed for the worse compared to the originally simple process.

Would be great if this small review helps the product team recognize a product deficiency and address this referral bonus issue for the benefit of loyal Acorns users.
title: Referral Program Issues

review:
So, at first I thought the company was just cute. It‚Äôs a nice way to take my change and invest it. Then the terrible customer service really tugged at my last nerve. 

Attempted 5 or 6 times to submit my proof of address, and kept getting ‚Äúdocument had a different name than the one provided‚Äù. Obviously this is a robot ‚Äúverifying‚Äù my identity. That is what led me here, but that‚Äôs not the point I want to make. 

Whether you‚Äôre paying $1,$3, or $5 monthly in 10 years you‚Äôd have paid $120, $360, or $600 for their ‚Äúservice‚Äù. This is actually the worst investment plan available in this niche. 

For example, Ally Bank will do this same thing, Chime Bank will do this same thing. Round up and invest the difference. For FREE. I may be wrong and it may be savings account, but you can look to better investment opportunities as well:

Betterment and M1 Finance do this same robo-advised investments based on the answers to the short questionnaire experienced with Acorns. Betterment is almost the exact same, whereas M1 will allow you to be more in control of ‚Äúwhere‚Äù your investments can go. 

Remember, you‚Äôre expecting to see returns of 12,36,60 per year JUST to break even. Do you spend that much change? You‚Äôre putting your finances into their (robots?) hands. 

Acorns - if you truly cared about our security, you would be more cognizant of your customers issues with your non-human securities. I‚Äôm 100% not anti-roboadviser. I‚Äôm anti ‚Äúset it and forget it‚Äù whilst being unresponsive.

review:
Acorns is a great app for saving and whatnot, it makes the process of investing in a savings automated so that is nice, but never waste your time on the referral bonus that they send monthly if it's ever over $450, they only will send something under that amount for referring like 2 or 3 people, if you see the ones for like $905 or $1200 they aren't going to send it and just say something happened. I also believe in the policy it says they have the right to just up and deny sending out referral bonuses with out reason, which is fine just a waste of peoples time I've done a refer 5 and get $1200, which I did and seen nothing for 2 months. Not a big problem just why am I wasting my time telling friends and family about something they could do too when it's not even an incentive that's guaranteed. 
Also this has happened twice for me for bonuses over$450.
title: Okay app but the refferal programs arent worth doing

review: In 2015 I opened an acorns account, hoping to invest my change and maybe make a little money. I forgot my password and gave up trying to access my account because it was inconvenient and for a few years, honestly forgot about it. Today, I finally changed the password and re- accessed my account. Not only had it not accumulated any revenue, the $100 I initially invested had magically become $18.88. I‚Äôm in the process of trying to at least get this back, but the site keeps asking for amounts of payments I‚Äôve received which have obviously been less than 0. Not a solid investment in my way of thinking, I feel apologetic to several friends to whom I recommended this shady app.

review: Since starting this account in 2021 I have had nothing but problems with this app and company. The app lets you choose the dates to be billed, but for me it changes to different dates without my knowledge until I look at my bank statements and realize that I‚Äôve been charged on the 5th instead of the 15th, and so on so forth. I have been charged twice in the same months without my authorization on several incidents. I called on the 07/03/2023 because my account was charged again on the 1st instead of the 15th of this month and the app changed my pay dates without my knowledge once again. Then I had to call back on 07/05/2023 I was told they would close my account so I wouldn‚Äôt be charged no further, but they didn‚Äôt tell me it wasn‚Äôt going to be closed till the 15th, they didn‚Äôt tell me I was going to be charged AGAIN and that I WOULDN‚ÄôT GET MY MONEY BACK. This app and the company itself has caused me so many problems.
title: This company is a scam!!

review:
I have written a review recently. It just doesn‚Äôt seem to want to show up. So here I am. Making it known until I am positive it is there for people to see: Acorns will steal your money. What a headache. The investment option doesn‚Äôt build any compound interest. So it is fine if you want to taste investments but not actually build heavily. But again- be warned, they will literally not let you close your account. They will continue to nickel and dime money from you; and when you call them, they will go in circles with you and then ‚Äúescalate this to a supervisor call they will call you back within 24-48hrs‚Äù only THEN, you better make sure you get the call, because if you are out living life in any way and miss the call, you get to start the fun process all over again. Also- document EVERYTHING, and create a file for said documentations- because they will make you provide step by step proof of the requests you made WITHIN THEIR SYSTEM. The whole thing is an unethical, dishonest funneling fiasco. But hey, you might make a couple hundred dollars in a year.
Edited to add: they finally closed my account after months of asking- but completely ignored the fact that they have taken money from me without my want or consent- as I had requested my account closed- they are just going to continue to ignore that. My 1 star stands. And ONLY because I can‚Äôt give zero.
title: Trash

review: I started using Acorns a few years back rounding up purchases using my debit card and it was surprisingly easy to do . I was amazed how much money accumulated . Then I decided to invest a recurring weekly amount into a customized personal investment account designed by Acorns. Money automatically transfers from my checking account to my Acorns account.It works really well for me and can check up on my investment Acorns account anytime I want using the Acorns App . I don‚Äôt know a lot about investing, but Acorns does all the work for me in a custom portfolio. I would highly recommend Acorns to anyone wants to invest some of their income but without the hassle or knowledge to handle an investment on their own .

review: I had Acorns for several years however, I found it more difficult to transfer funds from the spend account so I decided to close the account. They have an automated procedure which indicated any funds remaining on the account would automatically be transferred to the linked external account or they would send a check. As soon as I completed this, the app changes the splash screen to tell you the accounts are in the process of closing. I assumed everything was fine until a few months later I noticed they were still charging fees. I downloaded and installed the app again and still saw the same splash screen saying it was still ‚Äúclosing‚Äù. Mind you, the app no longer presents any options to transfer funds out or do anything. I had to log through the website to get chat help. There, the agent told me I was supposed to have gone back in and transferred the funds myself (I was not advised this previously). I found out the only way to do this is through the website, not the now locked app. You might be fine if you have your accounts open but I do consider this to be shady practices on consumers. *** UPDATE 03/10/23 *** It has been a week since the fund transfers were completed and the account did not close as the customer service rep had stated. I had to go back again and chat with them to process the closure. I will have to keep an eye out to make sure no additional fees are charged. If you have a similar experience and need to file a complaint, you will want to reach out to the government agency FINRA. These guys have become a scam. Literal definition of deceptive practices.

Well almost a month later I‚Äôm still trying to get the 197.00 refunded and when I call customer service, they told me I had to fill out the paper work and dispute this charge.  So I did and still nothing. But REALLY? I mean your fraud sept called ME and told me that it would not come out of my account! And the new card they sent, had a tracker button to find out where your card was , mailed- on its way- or delivered. review:
I‚Äôve been using acorns for about a year and a half and I have liked the concept of roundups. It‚Äôs a nice passive way to save money. That‚Äôs where I give my stars.

However, I have recently lost trust in the company. They have a referral program that has high payouts that I decided to go for. 5 referrals in a week you‚Äôd get $1200, 2 referrals the next week you get $500. And each referral you get $5. So I‚Äôll admit I paid people to sign up with my referral code and got all of them signed up far in advance before the deadline. They did all the requirements, deposited money and everything. 

It‚Äôs been 2 months now and I have not received anything from acorns. The referrals say ‚Äúin progress‚Äù so I contacted customer service over chat and they‚Äôd refuse to answer the problem and just said, ‚Äúsorry it didn‚Äôt work and doesn‚Äôt count‚Äù which I think is strange considering I had 7 people sign up you would think even one of them would count for the $5 right? Nope. I get other accounts privacy being important but they already knew what was happening. Then the customer service rep quickly ended the chat out of nowhere.

A few days later I decided to call Acorns. The lady was helpful but told me the reason was because they didn‚Äôt ‚Äúverify their accounts‚Äù which makes no sense as they had to already deposit money and they all showed up as ‚Äúin progress‚Äù on the referral status updates. If they weren‚Äôt verified they wouldn‚Äôt show up at all and shouldn‚Äôt have been able to move forward with acorns. And the terms and conditions they have say NOTHING about that. However they just said there‚Äôs nothing they can do and just said I should try for the next $5 bonuses (the bonuses go down significantly after you do one or two). I don‚Äôt think so. I‚Äôm going to need some real compensation to make this one alright not just a ‚Äútoo bad so sad‚Äù or a pity response from the developer on this review with no actual help/results. While speaking with support the whole thing felt pretty fishy if you ask me.

While I originally loved the concept I can‚Äôt recommend it anymore because I don‚Äôt trust this company to live up to any of its promises. I‚Äôve seen other people have the same problem. I will more than likely be moving my money out of my account and I suggest if you‚Äôre debating whether or not you should as well take some time to look into the company and how well they keep their promises. At least don‚Äôt do their referral program as it‚Äôs more than likely a scam.
title: Trust lost.

review:
In 6 months I went from $0.00 to $3,500! 
I do round up‚Äôs every time I use my debit card and that alone puts money into my Acorns account, by the end of the month I have a surprise amount in it plus I do $10.00 automatic deposit everyday. It‚Äôs a easy, hassle free way to save. I also do one-time deposits when ever I have extra money to put down. It‚Äôs hard to keep up and remember to save and I don‚Äôt use cash anymore so I can‚Äôt just put money in a jar and save that way, it almost reminds you and forces you to save when you set it to auto, which I love. 
Yes you pay the $3.00 a month or whatever but that‚Äôs NOTHING! 
Get the app, put $20-$50 a week or more if you can and set it on auto and let the pros do the work for you, watch your money make money for you while you sleep! Don‚Äôt listen to all the bad reviews, I have had no problems with this and like with all investing, yes you take a chance, but if you don‚Äôt try, you may never have a chance to make easy money, even if you only use it for the roundups, it‚Äôs still worth that alone. I‚Äôm in it for the long haul. I wish you all financial success in this.
title: Great for saving and set it & forget it investing!

review: I tried the app for a year because a friend referred it to me. And thought it would maybe help diversify my savings and investments. It is an easy way to save up money, if you have trouble doing it on your own. Although it costs you $36 per year just to save $$ that you could have on your own. My biggest disappointment was with the earn rewards. Supposedly if you shopped certain places( and it was a wide variety of them) you could earn small percentages from your purchase that would be deposited into your account. It almost never worked. I watched tutorials, changed multiple settings in my phone etc‚Ä¶. It only ever worked with two places, Chevron Gas Stations and Burger King. But Walmart, Pharmacies, other restaurants listed in the program, nothing. Then I would get emails from Acorns telling me ‚ÄúYou missed out on $xx.xx last month of earn rewards‚ÄùüôÑ. No, they just never worked . I then looked closely at how my own 401K investments stacked up, and I was getting way more bang for my buck with it, and it is a moderate to conservative investment strategy. So I cancelled my subscription and put my $$ back into my 401K. I‚Äôm not saying this app is bad, but disappointing for me.
title: Decent way to save money if you are bad at doing that

review:
I love the concept of Acorns and many of their services. In fact, I use several different services they offer. I miss the local found money feature. I found it to be a convenient way to discover restaurants off the beaten path.

Update 3/3/2022: I was informed that my account had been rebalanced by moving a substantial portion on my Later investments into bond, thereby locking in substantial losses on my investments in light of recent significant volatility. I was VERY upset to see this happen without any advance notification or even ASKING if I approved of the change. I will be abandoning the Acorns platform due to this. I feel very betrayed that Acorns would force such a heavy loss on my Roth IRA without even notifying me in advance.
title: Good concept paired with a great execution, but limited by lacking communication

review: I just completed a review of my Acorns account and was pleased to see I have been building up my account since 2015 (5+ years).  I started slowly with round-ups only but now I'm comfortable with weekly recurring investments of $130 plus regular round-ups.  I never asked questions about investing in my earlier working years, so now I am trying to make up for lost time.  I turn 65 in a few months but continue to work nearly full time as a rideshare driver for my retirement job.  The prediction tool in the Acorns app allows me to determine that my investment will yield 50% growth within 10 years and double in 20 years, so that is great news.  For merely 10 cents a day I am able to add to my current retirement income for a time when I no longer want or am able to drive people around for pay--and this gives me great peace of mind!
title: Investment for Pennies a Day

review:
Update: Some days passed after making this review, and I got an email saying they would like to try to help me again. So I went to customer support and submitted a ticket explaining my problem. A few days after that it got approved. I got my refund so I will change my 1 star to 3 stars, but no more than that because I feel the process was unnecessarily long.

 (Old review:) A few months ago, I had made an Acorns account. I didn‚Äôt fully finish the setup process. After a while I had forgot about the app. But today, I realized they charged me $5 this month. Which is weird because they never charged me the previous months. So why now all of a sudden? My bank account wasn‚Äôt even verified! Well, I go to customer support and explain my situation to Karishma Gupta. To sum it up, I told her that I‚Äôm struggling financially at the moment and cannot afford this subscription so I would like to get a refund. She dismisses me and just says she can close the account to avoid any further charges. I kindly ask again why I cannot get a refund for this as it‚Äôs odd for them to randomly charge me this month and not the others. She tells me to provide a screenshot of the money being removed. After I send it, she says the transaction wasn‚Äôt able to go through as my bank account isn‚Äôt verified. Yet I showed proof that it did? How was it ‚Äúnot able to go through‚Äù but my bank account says the transaction has already been processed? It doesn‚Äôt make any sense to me. I feel that this app has potential. But if you cannot make sure that your customers are satisfied, that‚Äôs a problem. Me requesting a refund wasn‚Äôt even that big of an issue, that should have been an easy fix. You guys are just finessing people. Not that it matters to you but I don‚Äôt think I will return to this app even when I can afford it. The customer service is just not worth it. Nothing will get solved. I hope this review helps someone, and that the next person has a better experience than I did.
title: Awful Customer Service

review: Acorns intermittently disconnects from my bank accounts. I have to re-link my accounts several times in a one week time span. Twice for my checking and once for my credit cards. The unreliability is not worth my time. The payment deductions are not as invisible on my bank statements as I expected. Accrued penny transactions must meet a minimum of $5 before you withdraw. Therefore your statement might look like this. Purchase 1 - $45.50 Purchase 2 - $9.50 . . . Purchase 10 - $4.50 Acorns - withdraws $5.00 from your account ($.50*10 transactions = $5.00). I was hoping the ‚Äúdollar round up‚Äù would deduct from my account after EVERY purchase to make my purchases an even number but this isn‚Äôt the case. Acorns‚Äô business model apparently can‚Äôt support the amount of micro transaction fees this would require. At least my account was easy to close via website, and the monthly $3 fees are nothing in the long run. For what it‚Äôs worth, I enjoyed trying a new investment idea. This was cute.
title: Not what I expected. (A review from an experienced investor)

This app is extremely expensive considering how much money you would have to put in just to make sure you cover the $36 yearly fee that they charge at $3 per month.They charge you this fee whether you want an IRA and a checking account or not. SoFi offers all the same features plus much more for free and has very good customer service. The only way you get this service any cheaper than $3 per monthIs if you try to cancel your account and I‚Äôll offer you the basic service for $1.

 I never even got a debit card when I tried to cancel my checking account so that I could close my Acorns account completely and because I requested the withdrawal they froze my account and it took me weeks to get the funds released and account closed. The wait time to call and talk to somebody on the phone is ridiculous and the number of times that I‚Äôve had to contact them to resolve this issue was also ridiculous. review: They held my money for weeks but froze it on the 1st. I banked with them for 5 months and deposited around 15000 a month. With no warning they froze my account. I had 3,921 in there on rent due date. They held my money plus the customer service is 2 hr or 3 hr waiting and nobody can give you answers once you talk with them. The script is a lie cause they will say ‚Äúwe are escalating your case‚Äù but that is a lie. The conclusion the money came out of my account and back to the original funding source. No tracking or confirmation. Plus no proof that the money was sent anywhere. They returned my money to a million dollar corporation and gave me no confirmation to let them know this is my money being sent here. I am currently in the process of suing them for pain and suffering. If you make a lot of money please do not use this bank. Never use a bank without a physical location. They are partners with Lincoln bank but they will play Lincoln Bank and Acorns back and forth while holding your money. You will get mixed signals from each person you talk to but never the same answer. PLEASE STAY AWAY!! It‚Äôs a great system but it will not benefit you in the long run. I lost 3921 dollars and it is no way of getting it back. The communication horrible. Lawsuit is the only thing you can do for them don‚Äôt let them get away with this horrible service.

If you tap into each feature, it's easier to offset your subscription.", 'modified': '2021-10-06T18:47:08Z'}

review:
I have had this account for almost 3 years now (UPDATE: 5 years now). It is nice to have an app that will do the math for rounding up the difference of what you spend and transfer it to a savings account.  It doesn‚Äôt cost much since it is only $1 per month subscription fee. (UPDATE: service is now $3 a month.)

Until the recent update, it was nice being able to look at all of my transactions made on all my credit cards that were linked up with Acorns.  Heck, 2 years ago I was able to spot a fraudulent charge on one of my accounts and get that resolved before it became a bigger issue. Acorns customer service was really good at helping me figure out the details of that fraudulent transaction, I even received calls from them and spoke to a customer service rep.  

However, the last couple times I have emailed them regarding and issue, I have not received a response.  They recently updated the app and now I am only able to see the last 2 most recent transactions.  Unless I ‚Äúround-up‚Äù those transactions, I cannot see any others.  Well, once I have 2 transactions that require a full $1 ‚Äúround-up‚Äù I cannot see any other transactions and I am not going to ‚Äúround-up‚Äù full dollar transactions.  

Since I have sent out an email asking how to see all of my transactions (about 4 days ago), I have not heard anything from Acorns except from an automated message stating that they have a high volume of email they are responding to.  This is the same message I received before when I did not get any other responses.  

Furthermore, I have had issues with a ‚Äúlinked‚Äù account and the issue has not been resolved even though when I try to click the link to resolve it, I get a message stating that the account has been ‚Äúre-linked.‚Äù  It has not.  I emailed customer service about this and have not received a response.

The company has grown too big to keep up with customers‚Äô questions, and I am ready to close this account.  There are other apps which do the same as Acorns without charging a monthly fee.  I have given them 2 stars because of the the horrible update and the 2 or 3 times I have emailed my concerns without responses from customer service.  Therefore, they have 3 strikes.  Had I received timely responses and the update wasn‚Äôt so horrible, I would give it 5 stars.

UPDATE 9/29/2021

They still don‚Äôt have their sh!t together! Plus, they raised their monthly fee from $1 to $3 a month. 

Why should I pay $3 a month when I have to unlink and link my account every freaking month. I don‚Äôt save as much as I should be with an app that actually works as it promises. 

I‚Äôm done! I am not paying $36 a year if the app can‚Äôt even save me $50 a year on autonomous mode.

This should be a brainless and hassle free service for the price you want to charge.
title: Disappointed in Customer Service

review: When you start, do a little math and invest enough to at least pay for your monthly fee. I started with only $20 in an invest account and and IRA. Was paying $6 a month, and only getting about .20-.40 cents in profits. Start with $100 or more and it'll pay for itself and you'll build from there. But overall, the app and Acorns is an awesome! Great way for people to begin educating themselves about investing. More I invest, the more I am tuning in to the stock market and learning the influences that affect it day to day worldwide. Recommend it for newbies to stocks/investing.
title: Start smart

title: 23% returns, I am so happy!

review:
I used this app in 2015/2016. After testing it against E*TRADE and other apps to put little bits of money every month.  I stopped putting money in but let it sit after it reached $500.  Limited growth, so I pulled it all out in March of 2019.  Thinking I was done with them, deleted the app once the deposit hit my bank account. 

Fast forward to August 2021, I notice a $1 charge in my checking account from Acorns! Thankfully I happened to check my account the day the charge happened as $1 is easy to get lost. I kindly asked support to refund my charge as I haven‚Äôt used the app in almost 2.5 years and if they have been charging me, I‚Äôd like that money back as well. Not even for the money‚Ä¶it‚Äôs the principle (don‚Äôt steal people‚Äôs money). 

The response from acorns was: 
After a thorough review, your request did not meet the eligibility requirements needed for us to issue a refund.

That SAME email said my account was closed on 8/20/21.

The charge to my account was on 8/30/21!

SUMMARY: There are better ways to save your money! This app will charge you maintenance fees even if you‚Äôre not using it (no deposits and no money in the account). 
I recommend taking more control of your money. Taking $20/month and putting it in robinhood in a Vanguard fund would be better long term with lower costs to invest.

Switch to my mail app, grab the code, then switch back to acorn. Guess what? My acorn log in timed out and wants me to re login. And then it wants to send me a new code. Switch back to my email, grab the code, back to acorn, it‚Äôs timed out. Rinse and repeat. Even tried to use safari browser to open my email rather than the email app, NOPE! SAME ISSUE, ACORN JUST KEEPS ON TIMING OUT. I CAN NO LONGER ACCESS MY ACORN ACCOUNT, OTHER APPS HANDLE 2FA JUST FINE, GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER ALREADY!

review:
I had acorn at the beginning of 2019. At first I thought it was cool and I signed up for their lite package. However, after having it for a few months and yielding little to no results I decided to delete the app. At that time there was no way to talk to customer service because there was no way to reach them. And before you ask yes I searched the app and the I googled their number for a customer service number to no available. I then googled how to shut down my account which of course led me to shutting down my account with them. Or so I thought because in March of 2020 mid pandemic these swindlers started withdrawing from my account again without notice. There was a button in your acorns account that lets you stop them from directly taking your money from your account which I checked off. So acorn your telling me you have the ability to reactivate using my account and take from my banking after I tried to close my account with you? 

And before the developers or whoever reach out to apologize to say I can go get help at blah blah blah.com or call so and so number ya b*tch did. And your customer service didn‚Äôt help except HOPEFULLY they actually closed my account this time but who knows I might start getting charged again in 6months or during our next pandemic but I will keep you updated. 

Here was their response to me about getting the money back after months of them charging me without me knowing. 
‚Äú Our records show that a withdrawal was initiated. However, a withdrawal doesn‚Äôt close your account, it only liquidates the funds within the account. To close your account, you must visit the ‚ÄúMy Subscription‚Äù settings in your app or on your desktop. You can also reach out to Acorns Customer Support and request that a member of our team closes your account for you.‚Äù
üòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòíüòí

‚Äú To close your account, you must visit the ‚ÄúMy Subscription‚Äù settings in your app or on your desktop. ‚Äú ‚Äî‚Äî 
This doesn‚Äôt tell me how to cancel my account fully don‚Äôt do this step you will think you are done but you're not just call customer service and tell them you want to cancel it and then call your bank  to stop/flag all payments going to acorn going forward. Because when acorn takes your money YOU ARE NOT GETTING ANYTHING BACK. Make sure to check your bank statements going forward for the next year. 

All in all my experience with them is rated a 1/10 (because it won‚Äôt let me rate lower) I would not recommend.

review: I would strongly recommend against anyone using this app, you can buy ETFs and index funds on your own. My problem with acorns is their disingenuous referral program, where they scam you into signing people up but don‚Äôt pay you the big weekly bonuses they promise for doing so. If you happen to sign up the right number of people, make sure you keep their names, phone numbers, and email addresses so in case they ask you to prove it to them that your friends signed up. You must do this even though they send you the $5 referral bonus confirmation emails for the sign ups, within the week specified. I signed up and received the 2 referrals bonuses and met the 2 signee requirements met for two particular weeks where 2 were required for bonuses of $200 and $300. It showed clearly on my app that I received these two sign up bonuses, AND I received email confirmations from those two weeks that I met the requirements, but they never paid out the weeks‚Äô larger bonus. When I inquired why I hadn‚Äôt received the bonuses, they told me for a week straight that they needed me to furnish the names, phone numbers, and email addresses of those I signed up. I kept arguing that they had already confirmed on their end that this was the case, and I did indeed show on my app and through my email inbox that the two signees were verified- both within the contest time periods. After arguing this point over and over, for the better part of a week they kept insisting that I needed to show them details that were never stipulated as part of their contest rules (they needed phone numbers, email addresses, my referral code, and the dates I sent the referrals) and ONLY then could they ‚Äúresearch‚Äù who signed up and when. I kept telling them how preposterous it was that they couldn‚Äôt see that they had already credited me the $5 referrals for each week. The final email I received stated that they were somehow miraculously able to ‚Äúresearch‚Äù my claims and told me that I only signed up two referrals total, even though I‚Äôd been paid the $5 referral for FOUR people during those two weeks. These guys are scam artists and you‚Äôre wasting your time signing up referrals if you use their app. Do a quick Google search on acorns referral program- you‚Äôll see many many disappointed and frustrated people like myself. Stay away from this shady company.
title: Dishonest company

review:
I went out of my way to refer four other people to Acorns, who have all invested with the app. I was supposed to be paid $600 for the referrals, per their email offer to me. 

When I attempted to verify the referrals, they made me provide them with the names, phone numbers, emails, referral code, and date that I shared with each of them. 

After jumping through those hoops, they simply said that only two of my referrals used my link and therefore they would not pay me the $600. I then sent screen shots of my texts to each referral, along with texts from my referrals stating that they clicked the link to sign up with Acorns. 

Rather than honoring their offer after I proved that each referral signed up because of me, they chose to hide behind some technicality. They won‚Äôt even tell us which of the three didn‚Äôt click the link! They just say they didn‚Äôt, and that‚Äôs that. 

We had intended to use Acorns for the 40+ employees at our company, but this unbelievably short-sighted and pathetic approach to customer service will see us going elsewhere. I would highly recommend using Stash (tons more investment options) or Robinhood (way better service).
title: Absolutely the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever seen

review:
I got Acorns to try some micro investing and they seemed a good choice based on web articles.  

Here is the real deal.  They have 100% outsourced customer service that is undereducated on the product & banking in general.  I tried to deposit a 1300.00 CASHIERS check & they locked me out of my account the same day.  They asked for all sorts of documents, but as the money was gift from a relative, I had no ‚Äúinvoices or paystubs to offer‚Äù.  I told them to cancel the transaction and they would not.
